translated: Now, by what process are the products of cooking produced? This is shown by the words of raw substances such as a pot and so on. By the word and so on in a pot and so on, the body and so on are also included. For there, by knowing the production of the products of cooking, when attachment to that ceases, one becomes detached and attains the highest good. Of raw substances is to exclude cooked substances.

original: yadyapi pārthivaparamāṇuṣvahetukasya rūpāderasambhavāt te 'pi pākādutpannāstathāpi viśiṣṭarūpāpekṣayā śyāmādaya ityucyante / tadāśrayasyāmadravyasya ye ārambhakāḥ pāramparyeṇa paramāṇavasteṣu karmāṇyutpadyante / kutaḥ / agnyabhighātānnodanād vā /
analyzed: yadi api pārthiva paramāṇuṣu ahetukasya rūpa ādeḥ asambhavāt te pi pākāt utpannāḥ tathā api viśiṣṭa rūpa apekṣayā śyāma ādayaḥ iti ucyante tad āśrayasya āma dravyasya ye ārambhakāḥ pāramparyeṇa paramāṇavaḥ teṣu karmāṇi utpadyante kutas agni abhighātāt nodanāt vā
translated: Although in earth atoms, since form and so on without a cause is impossible, they are also produced from cooking, still, in relation to a specific form, they are said to be black and so on. In the atoms that are indirectly the constituents of the raw substance that is their basis, actions arise. From what? From contact with fire or from stirring.

original: abhighātastu vegāpekṣaḥ parasparavibhāgahetorekasya karmaṇaḥ kāraṇam / nodanantu avibhāgahetoranekasyeti vakṣyāmaḥ karmādhikāre /
analyzed: abhighātaḥ tu vega apekṣaḥ paraspara vibhāga hetoḥ ekasya karmaṇaḥ kāraṇam avibhāga hetoḥ anekasya iti vakṣyāmaḥ karma adhikāre
translated: Contact, which depends on momentum, is the cause of the action of one [atom] that leads to mutual separation. But stirring is the cause of the many [actions] that lead to non-separation. We will discuss this in the section on action.

original: anye tu ghaṭasyādirdvyaṇukaṃ tadārambhakāḥ paramāṇavaḥ sākṣāditi manyante /
analyzed: anye tu ghaṭasya ādiḥ dvyaṇukam tad ārambhakāḥ paramāṇavaḥ sākṣāt iti manyante
translated: Others think that the beginning of a pot is the dyad, and the atoms that are its constituents are direct.

original: tatra karmotpattāvaṇavaḥ samavāyikāraṇaṃ tatsaṃyogo 'samavāyikāraṇaṃ vegādi nimittakāraṇamiti / tebhyo vibhāgāste tu dravyārambhakasaṃyogapratidvandvinaḥ / tatrāpyasamavāyikāraṇaṃ karma / paramāṇvoḥ samavāyitvaṃ śeṣam nimittakāraṇamiti / vibhāgebhyaḥ saṃyogavināśāḥ / teṣāṃ samavāyyādikāraṇānupalabdhernimittādevotpattiḥ / na hyabhāvaḥ samavetaḥ kvacidutpadyamāno dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tatra karma utpattau aṇavaḥ samavāyi kāraṇam tad saṃyogaḥ samavāyi kāraṇam vega ādi nimitta kāraṇam iti tebhyaḥ vibhāgāḥ te tu dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga pratidvandvinaḥ tatra api asamavāyi kāraṇam karma paramāṇvoḥ samavāyi tvam śeṣam nimitta kāraṇam iti vibhāgebhyaḥ saṃyoga vināśāḥ teṣām samavāyi ādi kāraṇa anupalabdheḥ nimittāt eva utpattiḥ na hi abhāvaḥ samavetaḥ kvacid utpadyamānaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ  /
translated: Among them, the atoms are the inherent cause in the production of an action. Their conjunction is the non-inherent cause. Velocity, etc. are the instrumental cause. The disjunctions from them are the opposites of the conjunctions that produce the substance. There also, action is the non-inherent cause. The atoms are the inherent cause. The rest are the instrumental cause. From the disjunctions, the destructions of conjunctions arise. Since the inherent and other causes of those are not perceived, they arise only from the instrumental cause. Indeed, an absence is never seen arising anywhere as inherent.

original: ata evāsamavāyikāraṇaṃ nāsti / ekārthasamavāyābhāvāt / nimittakāraṇantu anvayavyatirekābhyāṃ vyāpriyamāṇaṃ tadutpattāvupalabdham / saṃyogavināśebhyaḥ kāryadravyaṃ dvyaṇukalakṣaṇaṃ vinaśyatīti / jātyapekṣayaikavacanam /
analyzed: atas eva asamavāyi kāraṇam na asti ekārtha samavāya abhāvāt nimitta kāraṇam tu anvaya vyatirekābhyām vyāpriyamāṇam tad utpattau upalabdham saṃyoga vināśebhyaḥ kārya dravyam dvyaṇuka lakṣaṇam vinaśyati iti jāti apekṣayā ekavacanam
translated: For this very reason, there is no non-inherent cause, because there is no inherence in the same object. But the instrumental cause is found to operate in the production of that by positive and negative concomitance. From the destructions of conjunctions, the effect substance characterized by the dyad is destroyed. The singular is used with reference to the class.

original: paramāṇuṣu pūrvarūpanāśānantaraṃ pākajarūpādyutpattiḥ
translated: In the atoms, after the destruction of the previous form, the production of the cooked form, etc. occurs.

original: tasmin vinaṣṭe svatantreṣu paramāṇuṣvagnisaṃyogād auṣṇyāpekṣāt śyāmādīnāṃ vināśaḥ / punaranyasmādagnisaṃyogād auṣṇyāpekṣāt pākajā jāyante /PDhS
analyzed: tasmin vinaṣṭe svatantreṣu paramāṇuṣu agni saṃyogāt auṣṇya apekṣāt śyāma ādīnām vināśaḥ punar anyasmāt agni saṃyogāt auṣṇya apekṣāt pāka jāḥ jāyante
translated: When that is destroyed, in the independent atoms, from contact with fire, depending on heat, the black color etc. are destroyed. Again, from another contact with fire, depending on heat, the cooked ones are produced.

original: ghaṭatadrūpādīnāmutpattiḥ
analyzed: ghaṭa tad rūpa ādīnām utpattiḥ
translated: The production of the pot, its color etc.

original: tadanantaraṃ bhogināmadṛṣṭāpekṣādātmāṇusaṃyogādutpannapākajeṣu karmotpattau teṣāṃ parasparasaṃyogād dvyaṇukādikrameṇa kāryadravyamutpadyate / tatra ca kāraṇaguṇaprakrameṇa rūpādyutpattiḥ /PDhS
analyzed: tad anantaram bhoginām adṛṣṭa apekṣāt ātma aṇu saṃyogāt utpanna pāka jeṣu karma utpattau teṣām paraspara saṃyogāt dvi aṇuka ādi krameṇa kārya dravyam utpadyate tatra ca kāraṇa guṇa prakrameṇa rūpa ādi utpattiḥ
translated: After that, in the cooked ones produced from the contact of the atoms with the souls depending on unseen [forces], when action arises in them, from their mutual contact, the effect substance is produced in the order beginning with the dyad. And in that, the production of color etc. occurs in the order of the qualities of the cause.

original: tasmin vinaṣṭe paramāṇuṣvanyasmādagnisaṃyogāt śyāmādīnāṃ nivṛttiḥ / punaranyasmādagnisaṃyogād auṣṇyāpekṣyāt pākajā jāyante tatra paramāṇuḥ samavāyikāraṇam / agnisaṃyogo 'samavāyikāraṇam / uṣṇasparśo nimittakāraṇamiti /
analyzed: tasmin vinaṣṭe paramāṇuṣu anyasmāt agni saṃyogāt śyāma ādīnām nivṛttiḥ punar anyasmāt agni saṃyogāt auṣṇya āpekṣyāt pāka jāḥ jāyante tatra paramāṇuḥ samavāyi kāraṇam agni saṃyogaḥ samavāyi kāraṇam uṣṇa sparśaḥ nimitta kāraṇam iti
translated: When that is destroyed, in the atoms, from another contact with fire, the black color etc. cease. Again, from another contact with fire, depending on heat, the cooked ones are produced. There, the atom is the inherent cause, the contact with fire is the non-inherent cause, and the hot touch is the instrumental cause.

original: tadanantaram raktādyutpattikṣaṇānantaram / utpannapākajeṣvaṇuṣu samavetāni kāryāṇi utpadyante / asamavāyikāraṇamāha ātmāṇusaṃyogāt adṛṣṭāpekṣāt / adṛṣṭañca keṣāmityāha bhoginām iti /
analyzed: tad anantaram rakta ādi utpatti kṣaṇa anantaram utpanna pāka jeṣu aṇuṣu samavetāni kāryāṇi utpadyante asamavāyi kāraṇam āha ātma aṇu saṃyogāt adṛṣṭa apekṣāt adṛṣṭam ca keṣām iti āha bhoginām iti
translated: After that, i.e., after the moment of the origin of the red etc., the effects that inhere in the atoms that have arisen through cooking originate. He states the non-inherent cause: from the conjunction of the self-atoms, dependent on unseen [forces]. And he says which [unseen forces] are [dependent]: of the experiencers.

original: karmotpattau satyāmanantaraṃ vibhāgāḥ / tebhyaḥ saṃyogavināśāḥ / tataḥ paramāṇūnāṃ paraspareṇa saṃyogād dvyaṇukānyutpadyante / tatra paramāṇvoḥ samavāyitvam / tatsaṃyogasyāsamavāyikāraṇatvam / śeṣaṃ nimittamiti / tadādikrameṇa kāryamutpadyata iti / tribhirdvyaṇukaistryaṇukamārabhyate / tryaṇukaiścāniyamena svakāryamiti tāvad yāvad ghaṭaḥ / sarvatra kāraṇaguṇapūrvaprakrameṇa rūpādyutpattiriti /
analyzed: karma utpattau satyām anantaram vibhāgāḥ tebhyaḥ saṃyoga vināśāḥ tatas paramāṇūnām paraspareṇa saṃyogāt dvyaṇukāni utpadyante tatra paramāṇvoḥ samavāyi tvam tad saṃyogasya asamavāyi kāraṇa tvam śeṣam nimittam iti tad ādi krameṇa kāryam utpadyate iti tribhiḥ dvyaṇukaiḥ tryaṇukam ārabhyate tryaṇukaiḥ ca aniyamena sva kāryam iti tāvat yāvat ghaṭaḥ sarvatra kāraṇa guṇa pūrva prakrameṇa rūpa ādi utpattiḥ iti
translated: When action has arisen, immediately there are disjunctions. From them, the destruction of conjunctions. Then, from the conjunction of the atoms with each other, binary compounds arise. There, the atoms have inherence. That conjunction is the non-inherent cause. The rest is the instrumental cause. In that order, the effect arises. A ternary compound is produced from three binary compounds, and the binary compounds produce their own effects without restriction, up to a pot. Everywhere, the origin of color etc. is in the order of the qualities of the cause.

original: nanu sarvametadasambaddham / etasmin krame pramāṇābhāvāt / tathā hi /
analyzed: nanu sarvam etat asambaddham etasmin krame pramāṇa abhāvāt tathā hi
translated: But all this is unconnected, because there is no evidence for this order. Thus:

original: paramāṇau kriyāyāḥ sadbhāve pramāṇābhāvāt tatkāryasyāsiddhau taddvyaṇukasya vināśena pramāṇamasti /
analyzed: paramāṇau kriyāyāḥ sadbhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt tad kāryasya asiddhau tat dvyaṇukasya vināśena pramāṇam asti
translated: Because there is no evidence for the existence of action in an atom, and when its effect is not established, there is evidence of the destruction of that dyad.

original: agnisaṃyogasya nānātve / dravyavināśe / śyāmādinivṛttau / raktādyutpattau / utpannapākajeṣu kriyākrameṇa taddvyaṇukasyaivotpattiriti sarvaṃ pramāṇaśūnyameva /
analyzed: agni saṃyogasya nānātve dravya vināśe śyāma ādi nivṛttau rakta ādi utpattau utpanna pāka jeṣu kriyā krameṇa tad dvyaṇukasya eva utpattiḥ iti sarvam pramāṇa śūnyam eva
translated: When there is diversity of contact with fire, in the destruction of substance, in the cessation of blackness, in the production of redness, and in the cooked things that have arisen, the production of that dyad itself occurs in sequence through action - all this is devoid of evidence.

original: bādhakopapatteśca / tathā hyāpākanikṣipteṣu ghaṭādiṣu kulālasya chidrapradeśena nirīkṣamāṇasyākṣajaṃ vijñānam ghaṭaḥ pacyate iti / na cedaṃ saṃśayaviparyayasvarūpam / tallakṣaṇālakṣitatvāt / bādhakānupapatteśca /
analyzed: bādhaka upapatteḥ ca tathā hi āpāka nikṣipteṣu ghaṭa ādiṣu kulālasya chidra pradeśena nirīkṣamāṇasya akṣa jam vijñānam ghaṭaḥ pacyate iti na ca idam saṃśaya viparyaya svarūpam tad lakṣaṇa a lakṣita tvāt bādhaka anupapatteḥ ca
translated: And because of the possibility of refutation. Thus, in pots etc. placed in an oven, when a potter observes through a hole, the visual cognition arises the pot is cooking. And this is not in the form of doubt or error, because it is not characterized as such, and because refutation is not possible.

original: tathā pākottarakālaṃ sa evāyaṃ ghaṭaḥ ityabādhyamānasya pratyabhijñānasyopalabdheḥ /
analyzed: tathā pāka uttara kālam saḥ eva ayam ghaṭaḥ iti a bādhyamānasya pratyabhijñānasya upalabdheḥ
translated: Similarly, after cooking, because of the perception of the non-refuted recognition this is the same pot.

original: avasthānam / uparisthāpitānāñca tṛṇakarparādīnāmapātāccāvasthāyitvam / yadi hi paramāṇavaḥ pacyeran ūrdhvasthāpitānāṃ karparādīnām pātaḥ syāt / paramāṇūnāñca dhāraṇasāmarthyābhāvāt /
analyzed: avasthānam upari sthāpitānām ca tṛṇa karpara ādīnām apātāt ca avasthāyi tvam yadi hi paramāṇavaḥ pacyeran ūrdhva sthāpitānām karpara ādīnām pātaḥ syāt paramāṇūnām ca dhāraṇa sāmarthya abhāvāt
translated: Stability. And the stability is due to the non-falling of grass, mats, etc. that are placed on top. For if the atoms were to cook, there would be a falling of the mats, etc. placed on top, and because the atoms have no capacity to hold.

original: taddeśatvatatparimāṇatvatatsaṃkhyātvopalabdheśca / yadi cotpannapākajāḥ paramāṇavo dvyaṇukādiprakrameṇa ghaṭādikamārabheran taddeśaṃ / tāvat parimāṇam / tatsaṃkhyā ca na syāt / niyamahetorabhāvāt / dṛṣṭaścāyaṃ niyamastasminneva deśe / tāvatparimāṇam / tatsaṃkhyā ca / evaṃ ghaṭādīnāmavasthāyitvam /
analyzed: tad deśa tva tad parimāṇa tva tad saṃkhyā tva upalabdheḥ ca  yadi ca utpanna pāka jāḥ paramāṇavaḥ dvyaṇuka ādi prakrameṇa ghaṭa ādikam ārabheran tad deśam tāvat parimāṇam tad saṃkhyā ca na syāt niyama hetoḥ abhāvāt dṛṣṭaḥ ca ayam niyamaḥ tasmin eva deśe tāvat parimāṇam tad saṃkhyā ca  / evam ghaṭa ādīnām avasthāyi tvam
translated: And because of the perception of being in that place, having that size, and having that number. And if the atoms that have produced cooking were to produce the pot, etc. in the order of dyads, etc., it would not have that place, that size, and that number, because there is no cause for the rule. And this rule is seen in that very place, having that size, and having that number. Thus the stability of the pot, etc.

original: na ca ghaṭādervināśe kartrādibhirvinā punarutpattiryuktā / atheśvarādeḥ sadbhāvād yuktamiti cet / tathā hīśvaraḥ kartā kāraṇam / adṛṣṭādiparamāṇavaḥ karmeti / naitad yuktam / kṣityādikāryeṣvivāsmadādisambandhāditaḥ kāryānapekṣasya ghaṭādisampādane 'pi sāmarthyānivṛtteḥ kulālavyāpāravaiyarthyameva syāt /
analyzed: na ca ghaṭa ādeḥ vināśe kartṛ ādibhiḥ vinā punarutpattiḥ yuktā atha īśvara ādeḥ sadbhāvāt yuktam iti ced tathā hi īśvaraḥ kartā kāraṇam adṛṣṭa ādi paramāṇavaḥ karma iti na etat yuktam kṣiti ādi kāryeṣu iva asmat ādi sambandhāt itas kārya anapekṣasya ghaṭa ādi sampādane pi sāmarthya anivṛtteḥ kulāla vyāpāra vaiyarthyam eva syāt
translated: And it is not proper for a pot etc. to be produced again without a maker etc. upon their destruction. If it is argued that it is proper because of the existence of God etc., that is not correct. For God is the maker and cause, and the unseen etc. atoms are the action. This is not correct. Just as in the case of effects like the earth etc., even in producing a pot etc. the capacity would not cease, because of the connection with us etc., the operation of the potter would be pointless.

original: āvaraṇābhāvaśca / tathā hi / vegādagnisambandhādavayavakriyākrameṇa ghaṭādervināśastathāvegācca cakṣuḥsambandhāt kācābhrasphaṭikādeḥ kriyākrameṇa vināśe tadvyavahitena sambaddhasya cakṣuṣaḥ prakāśakatvamityāvaraṇābhāvaḥ syāt / atha svacchatayā sphaṭikādidravyamindriyavyavadhāyakaṃ na bhavatītyupapannamevāvṛtasyāpi grahaṇam / tarhi ghaṭādidravyamapi tathāsvabhāvatayā tejodravyavyavadhāyakaṃ na bhavatītyaṇupraveśādantardeśe 'pyupapadyata evaṃ pākaḥ / anyathā hyāvṛtānāvṛtayostulyopalabdhiḥ syāt / āvaraṇābhāvasyobhayatrāviśeṣāt /
analyzed: āvaraṇa abhāvaḥ ca tathā hi vegāt agni sambandhāt avayava kriyā krameṇa ghaṭa ādeḥ vināśaḥ tathā vegāt ca cakṣuḥ sambandhāt kāca abhra sphaṭika ādeḥ kriyā krameṇa vināśe tad vyavahitena sambaddhasya cakṣuṣaḥ prakāśaka tvam iti āvaraṇa abhāvaḥ syāt atha svaccha tayā sphaṭika ādi dravyam indriya vyavadhāyakam na bhavati iti upapannam eva āvṛtasya api grahaṇam tarhi ghaṭa ādi dravyam api tathā svabhāva tayā tejaḥ dravya vyavadhāyakam na
translated: And there is no obstruction. For thus, by the speed and contact with fire, the destruction of the pot etc. occurs through the sequence of actions of the parts. Similarly, by the speed and contact with the eye, the destruction of glass, cloud, crystal etc. occurs through the sequence of actions. The eye, obstructed by that, would be illuminating. This would be the absence of obstruction. But since the substance crystal etc. is transparent, it does not obstruct the sense organ. Therefore, it is established that even the obstructed is perceived. Then, the substance pot etc. also, by that very nature, does not obstruct the substance fire. Therefore, penetration by atoms is possible even in the inner space. Thus cooking occurs. Otherwise, there would be equal perception of the obstructed and unobstructed, because the absence of obstruction is the same in both cases.

original: yadi cāṇupraveśād dravyasya vināśastarhi bahirdeśe śītasparśopalambhānyathānupapattyā udakasya niḥsaraṇād ādhārasya vināśe tatpātaḥ syāt / atha sacchidradravyamityudakasya niḥsaraṇam / tarhi tanmārgeṇaiva tejo 'ṇupraveśād antardeśe pākaḥ sampadyata iti kiṃ tadvināśenetyalam /
analyzed: yadi ca aṇu praveśāt dravyasya vināśaḥ tarhi bahis deśe śīta sparśa upalambha anyathā anupapattyā udakasya niḥsaraṇāt ādhārasya vināśe tad pātaḥ syāt atha sa chidra dravyam iti udakasya niḥsaraṇam tarhi tad mārgeṇa eva tejaḥ ṇu praveśāt antardeśe pākaḥ sampadyate iti kim tad vināśena iti alam
translated: If the substance is destroyed by the entry of atoms, then due to the impossibility of the perception of cold touch in the external region, the destruction of the support by the outflow of water would lead to its fall. If it is said that the substance has holes, and thus the water flows out, then by the entry of fire atoms through that very path, cooking would be accomplished in the internal region. What is the use of its destruction? Enough of this.

original: sarvametadabādhakamanaikāntikatvāt / tathā hyudakaparipūrṇe ghaṭe vegavat sucīdravyasambandhādavaśyaṃ kaṇṭhapradeśe kriyā / sā cotpannā dravyārambhakasaṃyogapratidvandvinaṃ vibhāgamārabhata iti pratyakṣasiddham / tasmāt saṃyogavināśe tadārabdhasya dravyasya nivṛttiḥ / tasyāpi dravyāntarārambhakatvāt tannivṛttau tadārabdhanivṛttiriti vināśakāraṇasānnidhyād ghaṭasya vināśaḥ / anyathā hi vināśakāraṇasānnidhye 'pyavināśe kāryasya nityatvameva syāt / upalabhyate tu ghaṭa iti avasthitasaṃyogairdravyāntarārambho niścīyate /
analyzed: sarvam etat abādhakam anaikāntika tvāt tathā hi udaka paripūrṇe ghaṭe vegavat sucī dravya sambandhāt avaśyam kaṇṭha pradeśe kriyā sā ca utpannā dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga pratidvandvinam vibhāgam ārabhate iti pratyakṣa siddham tasmāt saṃyoga vināśe tad ārabdhasya dravyasya nivṛttiḥ tasya api dravya antara ārambhaka tvāt tad nivṛttau tad ārabdha nivṛttiḥ iti vināśa kāraṇa sānnidhyāt ghaṭasya vināśaḥ anyathā hi vināśa kāraṇa sānnidhye pi avinā
translated: All this is not contradictory, because of the non-exclusiveness [of the reason]. For instance, in a pot full of water, there is necessarily an action in the region of the neck due to the connection with a fast-flowing perforated substance. And that action, having arisen, produces the disjunction which is the opposite of the conjunction that produces the substance. This is established by perception. Therefore, when there is destruction of the conjunction, there is cessation of the substance produced from it. And because that [substance] also produces another substance, when that [conjunction] ceases, that which is produced from it ceases. Thus, due to the presence of the cause of destruction, there is destruction of the pot. Otherwise, even in the presence of the cause of destruction, if there were no destruction, the effect would be eternal. But the pot is perceived. Thus, the production of another substance by the persisting conjunctions is ascertained.

original: tatra ca pratyakṣaṃ sa evāyam iti pratyabhijñānam na vyāvṛttam / uparisthāpitadravyasya pātaḥ / taddeśatvam / tatsaṃkhyātvam / tatparimāṇatvam / pratyakṣeṇa ca kartrāderanupalabdhistatrāstītyanekāntādasādhanam / na ca ghaṭasya vināśe 'pyudakasyānāśitatvaṃ pāto vā dṛśyata iti / /
analyzed: tatra ca pratyakṣam saḥ eva ayam iti pratyabhijñānam na vyāvṛttam upari sthāpita dravyasya pātaḥ tad deśa tvam tad saṃkhyā tvam tad parimāṇa tvam pratyakṣeṇa ca kartṛ ādeḥ anupalabdhiḥ tatra asti iti anekāntāt asādhanam na ca ghaṭasya vināśe pi udakasya anāśita tvam pātaḥ vā dṛśyate iti  /
translated: And there, the recognition This is the same is not contradicted. The falling of the substance placed above. Being in that place. Having that number. Having that dimension. And there is the non-apprehension of the agent, etc. by perception, so it is inconclusive and not a proof. And when the pot is destroyed, the water is not destroyed or seen to fall.

original: paramāṇuṣveva rūpādīnāmutpattiḥ
analyzed: paramāṇuṣu eva rūpa ādīnām utpattiḥ
translated: The origination of form, etc. is in the atoms themselves.

original: na ca kāryadravye rūpādivināśa utpattirvā sambhavati / sarvāvayaveṣvantarbahiśca vartamānasyāgninā vyāptyabhāvāt / aṇupraveśādapi vyāptirna sambhavati kāryadravyavināśāditi /PDhS
analyzed: na ca kārya dravye rūpa ādi vināśaḥ utpattiḥ vā sambhavati sarva avayaveṣu antar bahis ca vartamānasya agninā vyāpti abhāvāt aṇu praveśāt api vyāptiḥ na sambhavati kārya dravya vināśāt iti
translated: And the destruction of form, etc. in the effect substance or their origination is not possible, because there is no pervasion by fire of what exists internally and externally in all the parts. And pervasion is not possible even by the entry of atoms because of the destruction of the effect substance.

original: atha paramāṇuṣu pākajā jāyanta iti kimatrāsmadādīnāṃ pramāṇam / ghaṭādiṣu pūrvaguṇavilakṣaṇasya guṇāntarasyotpāda iti / sa ca ghaṭādiṣu vartamānaḥ kathaṃ paramāṇuṣu pākajā jāyanta iti gamayet / tatrāgnisaṃyogena tathānupapatteḥ / tadevāha na ca kāryadravye rūpādivināśa utpattirvā sambhavati / kasmāt / sarvāvayaveṣvantarbahiśca vartamānasyāgninā vyāptyabhāvāt / tathā hi / avayavī sarvāvayaveṣu antarbahiśca vartate / na cāntardeśe 'gneranupraveśo 'stīti vyāptyā sambandhābhāvād apākaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: atha paramāṇuṣu pāka jāḥ jāyante iti kim atra asmat ādīnām pramāṇam ghaṭa ādiṣu pūrva guṇa vilakṣaṇasya guṇa antarasya utpādaḥ iti sa ca ghaṭa ādiṣu vartamānaḥ katham paramāṇuṣu pāka jāḥ jāyante iti gamayet tatra agni saṃyogena tathā anupapatteḥ tat eva āha na ca kārya dravye rūpa ādi vināśaḥ utpattiḥ vā sambhavati kasmāt sarva avayaveṣu antar bahis ca vartamānasya agninā vyāpti abhāvāt tathā hi avayavī sarva avayaveṣu antar bah
translated: Now, if it is said that the products of cooking arise in atoms, what is our proof here? That a different quality arises in pots etc. different from the previous quality. And how can that which exists in pots etc. make us understand that the products of cooking arise in atoms? Because it is not possible in that way due to the contact with fire there. He says that: And the destruction or production of form etc. in the effect substance is not possible. Why? Because there is no pervasion by fire of that which exists internally and externally in all the parts. Indeed, the whole exists internally and externally in all the parts. And since there is no entry of fire into the internal space, there is no connection by pervasion, so there is the consequence of non-cooking.

original: atha sūkṣmasya tejaso 'nupraveśād antardeśe pākaḥ sampadyata ityāha aṇupraveśādapi vyāptirna sambhavati / kasmāt / kāryadravyavināśāditi / tathā hi / vegavaddravyasambandhasya anyatra kriyāhetutvenopalambhād ihāpyavayave kriyājanakatvam / sā cāvayavāntareṇa vibhāgaṃ dravyārambhakasaṃyogapratidvandvinamārabhate / tasmāt saṃyoganivṛttau tadārabdhasya kāryadravyasya vināśe tadārabdhasyāpi nivṛttiritikrameṇa ghaṭasyāpyavaśyaṃ vināśaḥ /
analyzed: atha sūkṣmasya tejasaḥ nupraveśāt antardeśe pākaḥ sampadyate iti āha aṇu praveśāt api vyāptiḥ na sambhavati kasmāt kārya dravya vināśāt iti tathā hi vegavat dravya sambandhasya anyatra kriyā hetu tvena upalambhāt iha api avayave kriyā janaka tvam sā ca avayava antareṇa vibhāgam dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga pratidvandvinam ārabhate tasmāt saṃyoga nivṛttau tad ārabdhasya kārya dravyasya vināśe tad ārabdhasya api nivṛttiḥ iti krameṇa ghaṭasya api avaśyam vin
translated: Now, if cooking is produced in the inner space by the entry of subtle fire, he says: Even by the entry of atoms, pervasion is not possible. Why? Because of the destruction of the resultant substance. Indeed, because the connection with a moving substance is observed as the cause of action elsewhere, here too it generates action in the parts. And that generates separation from another part, which is the opposite of the conjunction that produces the substance. Therefore, when the conjunction ceases, the destruction of the resultant substance necessarily occurs, and the destruction of that which is produced from it also occurs. In this way, even a pot must be destroyed.

original: atha ghaṭāvayavāḥ patryante / tatrāpyantardeśe pāko na syāditi tejo 'ṇupraveśena vināśaḥ / tadevamuttarottarāvayaveṣu agnyaṇupraveśāt tadvināśe svatantrāḥ paramāṇavaḥ pacyante /
analyzed: atha ghaṭa avayavāḥ patryante tatra api antardeśe pākaḥ na syāt iti tejaḥ ṇu praveśena vināśaḥ tat evam uttara uttara avayaveṣu agni aṇu praveśāt tad vināśe svatantrāḥ paramāṇavaḥ pacyante
translated: If the parts of the pot are destroyed, then cooking would not occur in the inner space, so there would be destruction without the entry of fire atoms. In this way, by the entry of fire atoms into the parts one after another, their destruction occurs, and the independent atoms are cooked.

original: na ca kāryadravye pūrvarūpādīnāmavasthāne raktādyutpattiḥ syāt / guṇavati guṇāntarapratiṣedhāt / ato raktādyutpattyanyathānupapattyā jñāyate pūrvarūpādinivṛttiḥ / sā cāśrayavināśādeva kāryadravye / tathā ca sūtram rūparasagandhasparśā dravyānityatvādanityāḥ vai / sū / / ityāśrayavināśena vināśo 'bhihitaḥ / kāryadravye 'gnisaṃyogācca vai / sū / / etena nityeṣvanityatvaṃ vyākhyātam vai / sū / / ityagnisaṃyogasya nityeṣveva rūpādinivartakatvamuktam / ataḥ kāryadravye guṇāntaraprādurbhāvāt pūrvarūpādinivṛttirjñāyate / sā cāśrayavināśādeva / agnisaṃyogasya nityaviṣayatvena niyamāt /
analyzed: na ca kārya dravye pūrvarūpa ādīnām avasthāne rakta ādi utpattiḥ syāt guṇavati guṇa antara pratiṣedhāt atas rakta ādi utpatti anyathā anupapattyā jñāyate pūrvarūpa ādi nivṛttiḥ sā ca āśraya vināśāt eva kārya dravye tathā ca sūtram rūpa rasa gandha sparśāḥ dravya anitya tvāt anityāḥ vai sū iti āśraya vināśena vināśaḥ bhihitaḥ kārya dravye gni saṃyogāt ca vai sū etena nityeṣu anitya tvam vyākhyātam vai sū iti agni saṃyogasya nityeṣu eva
translated: And in the produced substance, if the previous color etc. remained, the production of red etc. would not occur, because another quality is prohibited in one that has a quality. Therefore, from the impossibility of the production of red etc., it is known that the previous color etc. cease. And that is only due to the destruction of the substratum in the produced substance. And thus the aphorism: Color, taste, smell and touch are impermanent because of the impermanence of substances. Vai. Su. 1.1.10. Thus destruction is stated to be by the destruction of the substratum. And in the produced substance, by the conjunction with fire also. Vai. Su. 1.1.11. By this, impermanence in the permanent is explained. Vai. Su. 1.1.12. Thus the removal of color etc. by the conjunction with fire is stated to be only in the permanent. Therefore, from the appearance of another quality in the produced substance, the cessation of the previous color etc. is known. And that is only due to the destruction of the substratum, because the conjunction with fire is restricted to the permanent only.

original: evaṃ kapālānāmapyavasthāne pūrvarūpādyanivṛttau raktādyutpattirna syāt / ataḥ kārye 'pi kāraṇarūpānuvidhāyitayā śyāmādikamutpadyate / tadevaṃ tatkāraṇaII /kāraṇeṣvapi pūrvaguṇavilakṣaṇasya guṇāntarasyotpattirvācyā / anyathā hi tatkāryeṣvapi na syāt /
analyzed: evam kapālānām api avasthāne pūrva rūpa ādi anivṛttau rakta ādi utpattiḥ na syāt atas kārye pi kāraṇa rūpa anuvidhāyi tayā śyāma ādikam utpadyate tat evam pūrva guṇa vilakṣaṇasya guṇa antarasya utpattiḥ vācyā anyathā hi tad kāryeṣu api na syāt
translated: Similarly, if the potsherds were to remain, the production of red etc. would not occur without the cessation of the previous form etc. Therefore, even in the effect, the black etc. is produced by conforming to the form of the cause. Thus, the production of another quality different from the previous quality must be stated even in the causes. Otherwise, it would not occur even in their effects.

original: sā cotpattiḥ pūrvarūpādīnāmavasthāne na ghaṭate / rūpavati rūpāntarārambhapratiṣedhāditi pūrvarūpādinivṛttirvācyā / sā cāśrayavināśādeveti sakalasyāpi kāryadravyasyāpi vināśaḥ /
analyzed: sā ca utpattiḥ pūrvarūpa ādīnām avasthāne na ghaṭate rūpavati rūpa antara ārambha pratiṣedhāt iti pūrvarūpa ādi nivṛttiḥ vācyā sā ca āśraya vināśāt eva iti sakalasya api kārya dravyasya api vināśaḥ
translated: And that production is not possible if the previous form etc. remain, because the production of another form in that which has form is prohibited. Therefore, the cessation of the previous form etc. must be stated. And that occurs only through the destruction of the substratum. Therefore, the destruction of the entire composite substance is also.

original: na ca paramāṇuṣvapi pūrvarūpādīnāmavasthāne raktādyutpattiḥ syāt / tadabhāvāt dvyaṇukasyāpi kāraṇaguṇapūrvakrameṇa śyāmādikamevotpadyata iti vilakṣaṇarūpādyasambhava eva / dṛṣṭaśca kārye guṇāntaraprādurbhāvastena paramāṇuṣu rūpādinivṛttau raktādyutpattiriti / na ca tatrāśrayasya vināśaḥ sambhavatītyagnisaṃyogasyaiva nivartakatvam / kāraṇāntarasyāsambhavāt tasyaivotpādakatvamiti /
analyzed: na ca paramāṇuṣu api pūrva rūpa ādīnām avasthāne rakta ādi utpattiḥ syāt tad abhāvāt dvyaṇukasya api kāraṇa guṇa pūrva krameṇa śyāma ādikam eva utpadyate iti vilakṣaṇa rūpa ādi asambhavaḥ eva dṛṣṭaḥ ca kārye guṇa antara prādurbhāvaḥ tena paramāṇuṣu rūpa ādi nivṛttau rakta ādi utpattiḥ iti na ca tatra āśrayasya vināśaḥ sambhavati iti agni saṃyogasya eva nivartaka tvam kāraṇa antarasya asambhavāt tasya eva utpādaka tvam iti
translated: And even in atoms, if the previous color etc. were to remain, the production of red etc. would not occur. Due to the absence of that, even in dyads, only black etc. are produced in the order of the qualities of the cause. Thus, the impossibility of a different color etc. remains. And the appearance of another quality in the effect is seen. Therefore, when the color etc. cease in atoms, the production of red etc. occurs. And the destruction of the substratum is not possible there. Thus, the contact with fire itself is the cause of cessation. Due to the impossibility of another cause, it is the producer itself.

original: yadapīdaṃ sacchidradravyam ityuktaṃ tatra yadi kapālarandhrāpekṣayā / tasyāntardeśe pāko na syāt / atha tadavayavarandhrāpekṣayā / tasyāntardeśe pākābhāvaḥ / tadevamuttarottarāvayaveṣvapi vācyaṃ tāvad yāvad dvyaṇukam /
analyzed: yat api idam sa chidra dravyam iti uktam tatra yadi kapāla randhra apekṣayā tasya antardeśe pākaḥ na syāt atha tad avayava randhra apekṣayā tasya antardeśe pāka abhāvaḥ tat evam uttara uttara avayaveṣu api vācyam tāvat yāvat dvyaṇukam
translated: And this substance with holes that was mentioned - if it is in relation to the cavity of the potsherd, then the cooking would not occur in the inner part. But if it is in relation to the cavity of its parts, then the absence of cooking would be in the inner part. This should be said in the same way for the subsequent parts until the dyad.

original: atha tasyāntardeśābhāvāt pāko bhaviṣyatīti / na / tasyāpi vegavadagnisambandhena avaśyaṃ vināśopapatteḥ / śyāmādivināśañca vinā raktādyutpattirna syāt / tadvināśaścāśrayavināśādevetyuktapūrvam / sa ca saṃyogavināśāt / so 'pi vibhāgāt / vibhāgaśca kriyāta iti guṇāntaraprādurbhāva eva kriyādikramāstitve pramāṇamiti /
analyzed: atha tasya antardeśa abhāvāt pākaḥ bhaviṣyati iti na tasya api vegavat agni sambandhena avaśyam vināśa upapatteḥ śyāma ādi vināśam ca vinā rakta ādi utpattiḥ na syāt tad vināśaḥ ca āśraya vināśāt eva iti ukta pūrvam sa ca saṃyoga vināśāt saḥ u pi vibhāgāt vibhāgaḥ ca kriyātaḥ iti guṇa antara prādurbhāvaḥ eva kriyā ādi krama astitve pramāṇam iti
translated: If it be said that, because there is no interval between them, there will be cooking, (we reply) no; because it is possible that that (interval) also will be destroyed by the contact of the fire with speed; and the production of red, etc., will not take place without the destruction of black, etc.; and that destruction (of black, etc.) is only by the destruction of the substratum, as has been said before; and that (destruction of the substratum) is by the destruction of conjunction; that (destruction of conjunction) is by disjunction; and disjunction is by action. Thus the appearance of another quality is the only proof for the existence of the sequence of action, etc.

original: atra tu prayogaḥ pārthivaparamāṇurūpādayaḥ / saṃyogajāḥ / vibhāgajavibhāgaśabdajaśabdānyatvānityatve sati nityasya viśeṣaguṇatvāt / sukhādivat / vibhāgajavibhāgaśabdajaśabdena vyabhicāraparihārārthaṃ tadanyatve satīti / salilādiparamāṇurūpādivyavacchedārthañca anityapadam / sāmānyaguṇavyavacchedārthaṃ viśeṣaguṇagrahaṇam / anityavyavacchedaśca nityapadeneti /
analyzed: atra tu prayogaḥ pārthiva paramāṇu rūpa ādayaḥ saṃyoga jāḥ vibhāga ja vibhāga śabda ja śabda anya tva anitya tve sati nityasya viśeṣa guṇa tvāt sukha ādi vat vibhāga ja vibhāga śabda ja śabdena vyabhicāra parihāra artham tad anya tve sati iti salila ādi paramāṇu rūpa ādi vyavaccheda artham ca anitya padam sāmānya guṇa vyavaccheda artham viśeṣa guṇa grahaṇam anitya vyavacchedaḥ ca nitya padena iti
translated: But here the argument is: the form, etc., of the earth-atoms are produced by conjunction, because they are non-eternal and different from the sound produced by the disjunction produced by disjunction, like pleasure, etc. The word non-eternal is used to exclude the form, etc., of water-atoms, etc., and the word special quality is used to exclude the general qualities. And the exclusion of non-eternality is by the word eternal.

original: anye tu ghaṭādigatā rūpādayaḥ / pāramparyeṇāgnisaṃyogajāḥ / sākṣād ghaṭamānatve sati agnisaṃyogatadbhāvabhāvitvenotpadyamānatvāt / śrūyamāṇāgniśabdavat / ityanumānaṃ bruvate / na cāsiddhaṃ viśeṣaṇamuktanyāyāt /
analyzed: anye tu ghaṭa ādi gatāḥ rūpa ādayaḥ pāramparyeṇa agni saṃyoga jāḥ sākṣāt ghaṭamāna tve sati agni saṃyoga tad bhāva bhāvi tvena utpadyamāna tvāt śrūyamāṇa agni śabda vat iti anumānam bruvate na ca asiddham viśeṣaṇam ukta nyāyāt
translated: Others say that the colors etc. in a pot etc. are ultimately born from contact with fire, because they are produced with the nature of being present when the pot exists and there is contact with fire, like the sound of fire that is heard. And the qualifier is not unestablished, by the reasoning stated.

original: yaccedaṃ agnisaṃyogasya nānātve pramāṇābhāva iti / etadasat / tasyaiva II / kāryabhedena nānātvopacārāt / yadā śyāmādinivartikā vahnau kriyotpannā tadā prāktanākāśādideśena vibhāgamārabhate / tadaiva tadavayave raktādyutpādake ca vahnau karmetyekaḥ kālaḥ / tato vibhāgāt saṃyogavināśo 'vayavakarmaṇā ca avayavāntarād vibhāgaḥ kriyate / raktādyutpādakāgnikarmaṇā ca ākāśādideśenetyekaḥ kālaḥ / tataḥ śyāmādinivartakasyāgneḥ paramāṇunā saṃyogaḥ / śyāmādīnāṃ vinaśyattā / avayavavibhāgācca dravyārambhakasaṃyogavināśaḥ / śyāmādyucchedakasyāgnervinaśyattā / raktādyutpādakasyāgneḥ prāktanasaṃyogavināśaḥ paramāṇunā ca saṃyogasyotpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ / tataḥ śyāmādīnāṃ vināśastaducchedakasyāgnervināśaḥ karma / saṃyogasya vinaśyattā / raktādijanakasyāgnisaṃyogasyotpādo / raktādīnāmutpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ / tato raktādīnāmutpādaḥ śyāmādinivartakāgnisaṃyogasya vināśa iti agnisaṃyogasya nānātvam / na ca śyāmādyucchedakāgnisaṃyogasya vinaśyadavasthatvād rūpādyutpattāvasamavāyikāraṇatvamiti /
analyzed: yat ca idam agni saṃyogasya nānātve pramāṇa abhāvaḥ iti etat asat tasya eva kārya bhedena nānātva upacārāt yadā śyāma ādi nivartikā vahnau kriyā utpannā tadā prāktana ākāśa ādi deśena vibhāgam ārabhate tadā eva tad avayave rakta ādi utpādake ca vahnau karma iti ekaḥ kālaḥ tatas vibhāgāt saṃyoga vināśaḥ vayava karmaṇā ca avayava antarāt vibhāgaḥ kriyate rakta ādi utpādaka agni karmaṇā ca ākāśa ādi deśena iti ekaḥ kālaḥ tatas śyāma ādi n
translated: And this argument that there is no evidence for the diversity of the conjunction with fire is not correct. Because that very [fire] is figuratively spoken of as diverse due to the diversity of its effects. When the action that removes the black etc. arises in the fire, then it begins the disjunction with the previous space etc. region. At that very moment, the action in the fire that produces the red etc. in its parts is one moment. Then from the disjunction, the destruction of the conjunction and the disjunction from the other parts is produced by the action of the parts. And by the action of the fire that produces the red etc. in the space etc. region, it is one moment. Then the conjunction of the fire that removes the black etc. with the atom, the destruction of the black etc., and the destruction of the conjunction that produces the whole by the disjunction of the parts, the destruction of the fire that removes the black etc., the destruction of the conjunction of the previous fire that produces the red etc. with the atom, and the production of the conjunction of the fire that produces the red etc. with the atom is one moment. Then the destruction of the black etc., the destruction of the fire that removes them,

original: anye tu śyāmādinivartakasyāgneḥ karmasamakālaṃ tadavayave 'pi karmasañcintanāt śyāmādinivṛttisamakālameva tatsaṃyogasya vināśa iti bruvate /
analyzed: anye tu śyāma ādi nivartakasya agneḥ karma sama kālam tad avayave pi karma sañcintanāt śyāma ādi nivṛtti sama kālam eva tad saṃyogasya vināśaḥ iti bruvate
translated: But others say that the destruction of the conjunction takes place at the very time of the cessation of the dark color, because the action is conceived even in the parts of the fire that causes the cessation of the dark color at the same time as the action.

original: athotpannapākajeṣu kriyākramasya sadbhāve kiṃ pramāṇam / kāryadravyasyotpattireva / anyathā hi kriyāmantareṇa parasparamaprāptānāṃ dravyārambhakatvaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: atha utpanna pāka jeṣu kriyā kramasya sadbhāve kim pramāṇam kārya dravyasya utpattiḥ eva anyathā hi kriyām antareṇa parasparam aprāptānām dravya ārambhaka tvam na syāt
translated: Now, what is the evidence for the existence of a sequence of actions in the products that have already arisen? The production of the product itself. For otherwise, without action, they would not be able to produce another substance, being unable to reach each other.

original: atha paramāṇūnāṃ dvyaṇukārambhakatvameveti pramāṇābhāvaḥ / tanna / ekatvamitara /vat bahutvapakṣe bādhakasadbhāvāt dvitvasaṃkhyopetānāmevārambhakatvaprasiddheḥ / tathā hi / bahūnāmārambhakatve śatādisaṃkhyopetānāmapyārambhakatvameva syāt / evañca sati ghaṭādikāryaṃ paramāṇubhirārabdhamiti cet / bhaṅge 'vāntarakāryasyānutpannatvādupalambho na syāt / upalabhyate tu ghaṭasya vināśe tadavayavā iti / tadavayave 'pi tadavayavā iti dvyaṇukādikrameṇārambho niścīyate /
analyzed: atha paramāṇūnām dvi aṇuka ārambhaka tvam eva iti pramāṇa abhāvaḥ tat na ekatvam itara vat bahutva pakṣe bādhaka sadbhāvāt dvitva saṃkhyā upetānām eva ārambhaka tva prasiddheḥ tathā hi bahūnām ārambhaka tve śata ādi saṃkhyā upetānām api ārambhaka tvam eva syāt evañca sati ghaṭa ādi kāryam paramāṇubhiḥ ārabdham iti ced bhaṅge vā antara kāryasya anutpanna tvāt upalambhaḥ na syāt  upalabhyate tu ghaṭasya vināśe tad avayavāḥ iti tad avayave pi t
translated: If it is argued that there is no evidence for atoms being the cause of binary compounds, that is not so. Because in the case of plurality, there is the presence of a counter-argument, and it is well-known that only those possessing the number two are the cause. For instance, if many are the cause, then those possessing the number one hundred and so on would also be the cause. And if that is so, and it is argued that the effect like a pot is produced by atoms, then because the intermediate effect is not produced, it would not be perceived. But it is perceived that when the pot is destroyed, its parts are seen. And in those parts also, it is ascertained that there is production in the order of binary compounds and so on.

original: atha dravyāṇi dravyāntaramārabhante vai / sū / / / saṃyogānāṃ dravyam vai / sū / / / iti ca sūtravyāghātaḥ / na / dvivacanabahuvacanābhyāṃ vigrahāśrayatvāt / tathā hi / dravye ca dravyāṇītyekaśeṣaḥ / kāryadravyāII /pekṣayā tu bahuvacanam / bahūni kāryadravyāṇyeva dravyamārabhante / dvitvasaṃkhyopetānyeva ca nityāni / na tu nityānyeva / kāryadravye 'pi sadbhāvāt /🔽na caikasya kramayaugapadyābhyāmārambhakatvam / ekasvabhāvatvāt / tathā hyekaḥ paramāṇurna krameṇa kāryaṃ karoti / samarthasya kṣepāyogāt / yugapat kṛtvā punarakaraṇe hetvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: atha dravyāṇi dravya antaram ārabhante vai sū saṃyogānām dravyam vai sū iti ca sūtra vyāghātaḥ na dvivacana bahuvacanābhyām vigraha āśraya tvāt tathā hi dravye ca dravyāṇi iti ekaśeṣaḥ tu bahuvacanam bahūni kārya dravyāṇi eva dravyam ārabhante dvitva saṃkhyā upetāni eva ca nityāni na tu nityāni eva kārya dravye sadbhāvāt  na ca ekasya krama yaugapadyābhyām ārambhaka tvam eka svabhāva tvāt  tathā hi ekaḥ paramāṇuḥ na krameṇa kāryam karoti samarthasya kṣepa ayogāt yugapad kṛtvā punar akaraṇe hetu abhāvaḥ
translated: If substances produce another substance, then there is a contradiction with the sutra The substance is the cause of conjunctions. No, because the plural and dual forms are based on the number of components. For example, in substances in a substance, there is ellipsis of one. But the plural form is used in relation to the effect-substances. Many effect-substances produce the substance. And the eternal substances have the number two, not that they are eternal. Because they exist even in the effect-substance.🔽And one cannot produce successively or simultaneously, because it has a single nature. For example, a single atom does not produce an effect successively, because what is capable cannot be delayed. And if it produces simultaneously and does not produce again later, there is no reason.

original: na ca samānaparimāṇatāyāṃ kāryakāraṇabhāvo dṛṣṭaḥ / kṣaṇabhaṅgapratiṣedhāt / kāraṇavibhāgābhāvādavināśitvaṃ kāryadravyasya ca prasajyate /
analyzed: na ca samāna parimāṇa tāyām kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ kṣaṇa bhaṅga pratiṣedhāt kāraṇa vibhāga abhāvāt avināśi tvam kārya dravyasya ca prasajyate
translated: And the relation of cause and effect is not seen in having the same dimension, because momentariness is denied. And the non-destruction of the effect-substance would follow from the absence of division of the cause.

original: tathā saṃyogaśca saṃyogau ca saṃyogāśceti saṃyogāḥ / teṣāṃ dravyaṃ kāryamiti nityāpekṣayā saṃyogasyaiva kāryadravye cāniyama ityavirodhaḥ /🔽tadevaṃ dvitvasaṃkhyopetāḥ paramāṇavaḥ kāryadravyamārabhante / ekatvabahutvapakṣe bādhakapramāṇasadbhāve satyārambhakatvāt / dvitvantu dvyaṇukārambhakaḥ / tantudvitayavat / na hi bahubhistantubhirdvitantukamārabhyate / nāpyekeneti saviśeṣaṇasya hetorasadbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā saṃyogaḥ ca saṃyogau ca saṃyogāḥ ca iti saṃyogāḥ teṣām dravyam kāryam iti nitya apekṣayā saṃyogasya eva kārya dravye ca aniyamaḥ iti avirodhaḥ  tat evam dvi tva saṃkhyā upetāḥ paramāṇavaḥ kārya dravyam ārabhante ekatva bahu tva pakṣe bādhaka pramāṇa sadbhāve sati ārambhaka tvāt dvi tvam tu dvi aṇuka ārambhakaḥ tantu dvitaya vat na hi bahubhiḥ tantubhiḥ dvi tantukam ārabhyate na api ekena iti sa viśeṣaṇasya hetoḥ asadbhāvaḥ
translated: Similarly, conjunctions are the conjunctions of two atoms, and the conjunctions of many atoms. The substance is the effect of these. Thus, there is no contradiction in the rule that conjunction alone is the cause of the effect-substance, and there is no restriction on the number of atoms in the cause.🔽Thus, atoms endowed with the number two produce the effect-substance. Because they produce it when there is the presence of valid means of knowledge that refute the theories of one or many. But duality produces the dyad, like a pair of threads. For a dyad is not produced by many threads, nor by one. Thus, the reason with a qualification is not non-existent.

original: atha dvyaṇukāni dvitvādisaṃkhyopetāni aniyamena kimiti kāryaṃ nārabhante / bādhakopapatteḥ / tathā hi dvayordvyaṇukayorārambhakatve 'ṇuparimāṇotpattāveva kāraṇatvamastīti vyarthārambhaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: atha dvyaṇukāni dvi tva ādi saṃkhyā upetāni aniyamena kim iti kāryam na ārabhante bādhaka upapatteḥ tathā hi dvayoḥ dvyaṇukayoḥ ārambhaka tve ṇu parimāṇa utpattau eva kāraṇa tvam asti iti vyartha ārambha prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If dyads endowed with the number two and so on do not produce an effect without restriction, it is because there is a valid means of knowledge that refutes it. For example, if two dyads produce an effect, then they would be the cause only for the production of atomic size, and it would follow that the effect is useless.

original: na ca dvyaṇukadvayasya kāraṇaparamāṇvapekṣayā bahutvaṃ sambhavatīti vācyam / kāraṇaṃ / na / kāraṇāvṛttibahutvasya parimāṇotpattāvakāraṇatvāt / kāraṇavṛtti ca bahutvaṃ mahattvotpattau kāraṇamiti dṛṣṭam / anyathā hi dvyaṇuke 'pi mahattvaṃ syāt akāraṇāpekṣitayā bahutvasya tatrāpi sambhavāt / tathā dvyaṇuka /dvyaṇukasyāpi bahutvasaṃkhyopetasyaiva mahadārambhakatvamiti / paraṃ dvyaṇukasyaitat kalpanīyamiti / ekasya cārambhakatvaṃ pratiṣiddham /
analyzed: na ca dvyaṇuka dvayasya kāraṇa paramāṇu apekṣayā bahu tvam sambhavati iti vācyam kāraṇam na kāraṇa āvṛtti bahu tvasya parimāṇa utpattau akāraṇa tvāt kāraṇa vṛtti ca bahu tvam mahat tva utpattau kāraṇam iti dṛṣṭam anyathā hi dvyaṇuke mahat tvam syāt akāraṇa apekṣi tayā bahu tvasya tatra api sambhavāt tathā dvyaṇuka dvyaṇukasya api bahu tva saṃkhyā upetasya eva mahat ārambhaka tvam iti param dvyaṇukasya etat kalpanīyam iti ekasya ca ārambhaka
translated: And it should not be said that the duality of dyads cannot be many in relation to the causal atoms, because the plurality of the cause is not the cause of the origination of extension. And the plurality that inheres in the cause is seen to be the cause of the origination of largeness. Otherwise, there would be largeness even in the dyad, because the plurality that does not require a cause is possible there also. Similarly, the duality of dyads also is the cause of the origin of the gross, being endowed with the number of plurality. But this must be supposed to apply to the dyad. And the origination of a single one is prohibited.

original: atha catuṣṭvādisaṃkhyopetānāmaniyamenārambhakatvamiti neṣyate / sākṣādghaṭādyārambhakatvaprasaṅgāt / tadbhaṅge ca avāntarakāryasyānupalabdhirevānutpannatvāt / na ca bahutvaṃ vinā mahattvaṃ sambhāvyata iti tritvasaṃkhyopetānāmevārambhakatvam / tathā hi / dvyaṇukāni / tritvasaṃkhyopetānyeva dravyamārabhante / dvitvacatuṣṭvādipakṣe bādhakapramāṇasadbhāve sati ārambhakatvāt / tritantukārambhe tantutritayavat /
analyzed: atha catuṣṭva ādi saṃkhyā upetānām aniyamena ārambhaka tvam iti nā iṣyate sākṣāt ghaṭa ādi ārambhaka tva prasaṅgāt tad bhaṅge ca avāntara kāryasya anupalabdhiḥ eva anutpanna tvāt  na ca bahu tvam vinā mahat tvam sambhāvyate iti tritva saṃkhyā upetānām eva ārambhaka tvam tathā hi dvyaṇukāni tritva saṃkhyā upetāni eva dravyam ārabhante dvitva catuṣṭva ādi pakṣe bādhaka pramāṇa sadbhāve sati ārambhaka tvāt tri tantuka ārambhe tantu tritaya vat
translated: If it is not accepted that the number four etc. is the cause of origination without restriction, because it would lead to the direct origination of the pot etc., and because the intermediate effect is not perceived when it is destroyed, because it has not yet arisen, and because largeness is not possible without plurality, the origination is only by the number three. Thus, the dyads originate the substance only when they have the number three, because they are the cause of origination when there is the presence of the invalidating means of knowledge in the case of the number two, four etc., like the three threads in the origination of the cloth.

original: atra tu kiyatā kālena dvyaṇuke rūpādyutpattiriti kriyā nirūpyate /
analyzed: atra tu kiyatā kālena dvyaṇuke rūpa ādi utpattiḥ iti kriyā nirūpyate
translated: But here, the action is determined in how much time the color etc. arises in the dyad.

original: tatra svakāraṇād dvyaṇukasya vināśaḥ / tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / śyāmādyucchedakāgnisaṃyogasyotpādaḥ / śyāmādīnāṃ vinaśyattā / raktādyutpādakāgnisaṃyogasyotpadyamānatā / vibhāgajavibhāgasyotpādaḥ / paramāṇvorākāśādideśena saṃyogasya vinaśyattetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sva kāraṇāt dvyaṇukasya vināśaḥ tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā śyāma ādi ucchedaka agni saṃyogasya utpādaḥ śyāma ādīnām vinaśyat tā rakta ādi utpādaka agni saṃyogasya utpadyamāna tā vibhāga ja vibhāgasya utpādaḥ paramāṇvoḥ ākāśa ādi deśena saṃyogasya vinaśyat tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: There, the destruction of the dyad is from its own cause. The destructibility of its effect. The production of the contact with fire that destroys the dark color, etc. The destructibility of the dark colors, etc. The production of the contact with fire that produces the red color, etc. The production of the disjunction produced by disjunction. The destructibility of the contact of the atoms with space, etc. This is the one time of these.

original: tatastryaṇukasya vināśaḥ / tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / śyāmādīnāṃ vināśaḥ / śyāmādyucchedakāgnisaṃyogasya vinaśyattā / raktādyutpādakāgnisaṃyogasyotpādaḥ / raktādīnāmutpadyamānatā / ākāśadvyaṇukasaṃyogasya vināśaḥ / uttarasaṃyogasyotpadyamānatetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tryaṇukasya vināśaḥ tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā śyāma ādīnām vināśaḥ śyāma ādi ucchedaka agni saṃyogasya vinaśyat tā rakta ādi utpādaka agni saṃyogasya utpādaḥ rakta ādīnām utpadyamāna tā ākāśa dvyaṇuka saṃyogasya vināśaḥ uttara saṃyogasya utpadyamāna tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the destruction of the triad. The destructibility of its effect. The destruction of the dark colors, etc. The destructibility of the contact with fire that destroys the dark colors, etc. The production of the contact with fire that produces the red colors, etc. The production of the red colors, etc. The destruction of the contact of the dyad with space. The production of the subsequent contact. This is the one time of these.

original: tatastatkāryasya vināśāt tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / śyāmādyucchedakāgnisaṃyogasya vināśaḥ / raktādīnāmutpādaḥ / raktādyutpādakāgnisaṃyogasya vinaśyattā / tathottarasaṃyogasyotpādaḥ / vibhāgavibhāgajavibhāgakarmaṇāṃ vinaśyattā / kriyāyā utpadyamānatetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tatastatkāryavināśaḥ / tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / vibhāgavibhāgajavibhāgakarmaṇāṃ vināśaḥ / raktādyutpādakāgnisaṃyogasya vināśaḥ / kriyāyā utpādaḥ / vibhāgasyotpadyamānatetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tatastatkāryavināśāt tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / vibhāgasyotpādaḥ / saṃyogasya vinaśyattetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tad kāryasya vināśāt tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā śyāma ādi ucchedaka agni saṃyogasya vināśaḥ rakta ādīnām utpādaḥ rakta ādi utpādaka agni saṃyogasya vinaśyat tā tathā uttara saṃyogasya utpādaḥ vibhāga vibhāga ja vibhāga karmaṇām vinaśyat tā kriyāyāḥ utpadyamāna tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas tad kārya vināśaḥ tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā vibhāga vibhāga ja vibhāga karmaṇām vināśaḥ rakta ādi utpādaka agni saṃyogasya vināśaḥ kriyāyāḥ utpādaḥ vibhāgasya utpadyamāna tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas tad kārya vināśāt tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā vibhāgasya utpādaḥ saṃyogasya vinaśyat tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, from the destruction of that effect, there is the destructibility of that effect. The destruction of the contact that causes the burning of the black etc., the production of the red etc., the destructibility of the contact that causes the production of the red etc., similarly the production of the subsequent contact, the destructibility of the action produced by the separation of separation, and the production of the action - this is one moment.

original: tatastatkāryavināśāt tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / saṃyogasya vināśaḥ / uttarasaṃyogasyotpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tad kārya vināśāt tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā saṃyogasya vināśaḥ uttara saṃyogasya utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, from the destruction of that effect, there is the destructibility of that effect. The destruction of the action produced by the separation of separation, the destruction of the contact that causes the production of the red etc., the production of the action, the production of the separation - this is one moment.🔽Then, from the destruction of that effect, there is the destructibility of that effect. The production of the separation, the destructibility of the contact - this is one moment.🔽Then, from the destruction of that effect, there is the destructibility of that effect. The destruction of the contact, the production of the subsequent contact - this is one moment.

original: tatastatkāryavināśāt tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / uttarasaṃyogasyotpādaḥ / dvyaṇukasyotpadyamānatā / vibhāgakarmaṇorvinaśyattetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tad kārya vināśāt tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā uttara saṃyogasya utpādaḥ dvyaṇukasya utpadyamāna tā vibhāga karmaṇoḥ vinaśyat tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, from the destruction of that effect, the destructibility of that effect, the production of the subsequent conjunction, the becoming-to-be-produced of the dyad, and the destructibility of the action of separation - these have one time.

original: tatastatkāryasya vināśāt tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / dvyaṇukasyotpādaḥ / rūpādīnāmutpadyamānatā / vibhāgakarmaṇorvināśa ityeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tad kāryasya vināśāt tad kāryasya vinaśyat tā dvyaṇukasya utpādaḥ rūpa ādīnām utpadyamāna tā vibhāga karmaṇoḥ vināśaḥ iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, from the destruction of that effect, the destructibility of that effect, the production of the dyad, the becoming-to-be-produced of color etc., and the destruction of the action of separation - these have one time.

original: tata utpanne dvyaṇuke kāraṇaguṇapūrvaprakrameṇa navame kṣaṇe rūpādyutpattiriti /
analyzed: tatas utpanne dvyaṇuke kāraṇa guṇa pūrva prakrameṇa navame kṣaṇe rūpa ādi utpattiḥ iti
translated: Then, when the dyad has been produced, in the ninth moment according to the order of the qualities of the cause, there is the production of color etc.

original: yadā tu kāryavināśaviśiṣṭaṃ kālam apekṣyetyasya dravyanāśaviśiṣṭaṃ II / kālam apekṣya kāraṇayorvartamāno vibhāgaḥ kāryasaṃyuktākāśadeśena vibhāgamārabhata iti vyākhyātam / tadā śyāmādinivṛttisamakālaṃ vibhāgajavibhāgasañcintanāt daśame kṣaṇe dvyaṇuke rūpādyutpattiriti cintanīyam /
analyzed: yadā tu kārya vināśa viśiṣṭam kālam apekṣya iti asya dravya nāśa viśiṣṭam kālam apekṣya kāraṇayoḥ vartamānaḥ vibhāgaḥ kārya saṃyukta ākāśa deśena vibhāgam ārabhate iti vyākhyātam tadā śyāma ādini vṛtti sama kālam vibhāga ja vibhāga sañcintanāt daśame kṣaṇe dvyaṇuke rūpa ādi utpattiḥ iti cintanīyam
translated: But when it is explained that the separation of the two causes, which depends on the time qualified by the destruction of the effect, produces the separation from the space conjoined with the effect, then it should be considered that the production of color etc. in the dyad occurs in the tenth moment, because the separation produced by separation is considered simultaneously with the cessation of darkness etc.

original: tathā ca dvyaṇukavināśe śyāmādinivṛttiḥ / tato raktādyutpattiḥ / uttarasaṃyogaḥ / kriyāvibhāgasaṃyogavināśaḥ / paramāṇūnāñca saṃyogād dvyaṇukotpattau kāraṇaguṇapūrvaprakrameṇa rūpādyutpattiriti / śeṣaṃ pūrvavaditi / idamekasmin paramāṇau dravyotpādikā tadvināśiketi ca kriyādvayamadhikṛtyoktam /
analyzed: tathā ca dvyaṇuka vināśe śyāma ādi nivṛttiḥ tatas rakta ādi utpattiḥ uttara saṃyogaḥ kriyā vibhāga saṃyoga vināśaḥ paramāṇūnām ca saṃyogāt dvyaṇuka utpattau kāraṇa guṇa pūrva prakrameṇa rūpa ādi utpattiḥ iti śeṣam pūrvavat iti idam ekasmin paramāṇau dravya utpādikā tad vināśikā iti ca kriyā dvayam adhikṛtya uktam
translated: And so, when the dyad is destroyed, the black color ceases, then red color arises, there is a subsequent conjunction, destruction of action, disjunction, and conjunction, and when the dyad arises from the conjunction of atoms, color etc. arise in the same order as the qualities of the cause. The rest is as before. This is said with reference to two actions in one atom, one producing substance and the other destroying it.

original: yadā tvekasmin paramāṇau dravyavināśikānyasmiṃśca dravyotpādikeṣyate tadā katham /
analyzed: yadā tu ekasmin paramāṇau dravya vināśikā anyasmin ca dravya utpādikā iṣyate tadā katham
translated: But when destruction of substance is accepted in one atom and production of substance in another, how is that?

original: tatra dravyārambhakasaṃyogavināśasamakālaṃ dvitīyaparamāṇau dravyārambhakaṃ karma / tato dravyārambhakasaṃyogavināśād dvyaṇukasya vināśaḥ / tatkāryasya vinaśyattā / śyāmādyucchedakāgnisaṃyogasyotpādaḥ / śyāmādīnāmucchidyamānatā / raktādyutpādakāgnisaṃyogasyotpadyamānatā / vibhāgajavibhāgasyotpādaḥ / paramāṇorākāśādideśena saṃyogasya vinaśyattā / dvitīyaparamāṇau vibhāgasyotpādaḥ prāktanasaṃyogasya vinaśyattetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /

translated: Then, the destruction of the dyad, the destructibility of its effect, the destruction of the dark color etc., the destructibility of the contact with fire that destroys it, the production of the contact with fire that produces the red color etc., the production of the red color etc., the destruction of the contact of the dyad with space, the production of the contact of that atom with the region of space etc., the destruction of the prior contact in the second atom, and the production of the contact with the other atom - these occur at one time.
