analyzed: anityāyāntu salilasya ādi pāṭhā apekṣayā pṛthivī tasyāḥ paramāṇavaḥ tad rūpāṇām iva iti dṛṣṭāntaḥ tu yathā hi pārthiva paramāṇu rūpa ādayaḥ niṣpadyamāna tvāt anityāḥ tadvat ekatvam kāryeṣu niṣpadyamāna tvāt anityam iti
translated: But for non-eternal water, earth is mentioned first. Its atoms are like its forms, etc. The example is that just as the forms, etc. of the earthen atoms are non-eternal due to being produced, so is oneness non-eternal due to being produced in the effects.

original: na ca pārthivaparamāṇurūpādīnāmiva ekatvādīnāmagnisaṃyogādutpattiḥ / vailakṣaṇyāpratipatteḥ / sparśe tu vailakṣaṇyāpratipattāvapyagnisaṃyogajatve 'numānamuktaṃ pṛthivyadhikāre / na ca tatsāmānyaguṇeṣu sambhavatīti /
analyzed: na ca pārthiva paramāṇu rūpa ādīnām iva eka tva ādīnām agni saṃyogāt utpattiḥ vailakṣaṇya apratipatteḥ sparśe tu vailakṣaṇya apratipattau api agni saṃyoga ja tve numānam uktam pṛthivī adhikāre na ca tat sāmānya guṇeṣu sambhavati iti
translated: And the production of unity, etc., is not like that of the color, etc., of earth atoms, from the contact with fire, because no difference is perceived. But in the case of touch, even though no difference is perceived, the inference of being produced from the contact with fire has been stated in the section on earth. And that is not possible in the general qualities.

original: anye tu salilañca tadādiparamāṇavaśceti tacchabdalopena samāsaṃ kurvate / anityatve salilarūpādi dṛṣṭāntaḥ / nityatāyāñca tadādiparamāṇurūpamityalam /
analyzed: anye tu salilam ca tad ādi paramāṇavaḥ ca iti tad śabda lopena samāsam kurvate anitya tve salila rūpa ādi dṛṣṭāntaḥ nitya tāyām ca tad ādi paramāṇu rūpam iti alam
translated: But others, omitting the word water, make a compound of water and its atoms, etc. In the case of non-eternality, the example is the color, etc., of water. And in the case of eternality, the example is the color, etc., of its atoms. That is enough.

original: anekadravyā tu / dvitvameva ādiryasyāḥ sā / dvitvādikā / parārdhamevānte 'vasāne yasyāḥ sā parārdhāntā / na hi parārdhādūrdhvamiyattāvyavahāraḥ sambhavatītyāgame paṭhyate /
analyzed: aneka dravyā tu dvi tvam eva ādiḥ yasyāḥ sā dvi tva ādikā parārdham eva ante vasāne yasyāḥ sā parārdha antā na hi parārdhāt ūrdhvam iyat tā vyavahāraḥ sambhavati iti āgame paṭhyate
translated: But it is of many substances. That which has duality as its beginning is beginning with duality. That which has the highest number as its end is ending with the highest number. For beyond the highest number, the usage of limitation is not possible. It is read in the scriptures.

original: dvitvotpattivināśaprakārau
analyzed: dvi tva utpatti vināśa prakārau
translated: The modes of origination and destruction of duality.

original: tasyāḥ khalvekatvebhyo 'nekaviṣayabuddhisahitebhyo niṣpattirapekṣābuddhivināśād vināśa iti / katham / yadā boddhuścakṣuṣā samānāsamānajātīyayordravyayoḥ sannikarṣe sati tatsaṃyuktasamavetasamavetaikatvasāmānye jñānotpattāvekatvasāmānyatatsambandhatajjñānebhya ekatvaguṇayoranekaviṣayiṇī ekā buddhirutpadyate ekatvasāmānyabuddheśca vinaśyattā / tatastāmapekṣyaikatvābhyāṃ svāśrayayordvitvamārabhyate /PDhS
analyzed: tasyāḥ khalu eka tvebhyaḥ neka viṣaya buddhi sahitebhyaḥ niṣpattiḥ apekṣā buddhi vināśāt vināśaḥ iti katham yadā boddhuḥ cakṣuṣā samāna asamāna jātīyayoḥ dravyayoḥ sannikarṣe sati tad saṃyukta samaveta samaveta eka tva sāmānye jñāna utpattau eka tva sāmānya tad sambandha tad jñānebhyaḥ eka tva guṇayoḥ aneka viṣayiṇī ekā buddhiḥ utpadyate eka tva sāmānya buddheḥ ca vinaśyat tā tatas tām apekṣya eka tvābhyām sva āśrayayoḥ dvi tva
translated: Its origination is from the cognitions of oneness associated with cognitions of multiple objects, and its destruction is from the destruction of the dependent cognition. How? When the cognizer, through the eye, in contact with substances of the same and different kinds, a cognition arises of the oneness inhering in what is conjoined, from the oneness inhering in that, its relation, and the cognition of that, a single cognition with multiple objects arises regarding the oneness and quality. And the cognition of the general oneness is destroyed. Then, depending on that, duality is produced in its substrata by the two onenessses.

original: tasyāḥ khalvekatvebhyo 'nekaviṣayabuddhisahitebhyo niṣpattiḥ / apekṣābuddhivināśād vināśaḥ iti saṃkṣepeṇotpattivināśakāraṇaṃ darśayati / nanu cātra bahutvanirdeśād dvitvotpattirna labhyate / na hi dvitvamekatvebhyo bhavatīti / na / dvivacanabahuvacanābhyāṃ vigrahāśrayaṇāt / tathā hyekatve 'nekatvāni cetyekaśeṣaḥ / prakṛtisārūpyasya vivakṣitatvāt / vacanasārūpyeṇa tvekaśeṣābhyupagame dhavakhadirādiṣvekaśeṣaprasaṅgaḥ syāt / ata ekatvebhyo 'nekatvasaṃkhyotpattirityaII /nena dvitvotpattirvyākhyātaiva /
analyzed: tasyāḥ khalu ekatvebhyaḥ neka viṣaya buddhi sahitebhyaḥ niṣpattiḥ apekṣā buddhi vināśāt vināśaḥ iti saṃkṣepeṇa utpatti vināśa kāraṇam darśayati nanu ca atra bahutva nirdeśāt dvitva utpattiḥ na labhyate  na hi dvitvam ekatvebhyaḥ bhavati iti na dvivacana bahuvacanābhyām vigraha āśrayaṇāt tathā hi ekatve nekatvāni ca iti ekaśeṣaḥ prakṛti sārūpyasya vivakṣita tvāt vacana sārūpyeṇa tu ekaśeṣa abhyupagame dhava khadira ādiṣu ekaśeṣa pras
translated: The origination of that [number] is from many unities accompanied by cognitions of multiple objects. Its destruction is from the destruction of the cognition of dependence. Thus he briefly shows the causes of origination and destruction. But here, since plurality is mentioned, the origination of duality is not obtained, for duality does not arise from unities. No, because the dual and plural endings are based on the absence of a base. For thus, unity and multiplicities is a single residual [form]. Because similarity to the original is intended. But if the acceptance of a single residual [form] is based on similarity of endings, then in the case of dhava, khadira, etc. a single residual [form] would be required. Therefore, the origination of the number many from many unities is explained by this [statement].

original: kiṃviśiṣṭebhya ityāha aneko viṣayo yasyāḥ sā anekaviṣayā / sā cāsau buddhiśca tayā sahitānyekatvāni tebhyaḥ / niṣpattirityapekṣākāraṇanirdeśaḥ /
analyzed: kiṃviśiṣṭebhyaḥ iti āha anekaḥ viṣayaḥ yasyāḥ sā aneka viṣayā sā ca asau buddhiḥ ca tayā sahitāni eka tvāni tebhyaḥ niṣpattiḥ iti apekṣā kāraṇa nirdeśaḥ
translated: To which [unities] with what characteristics? He says: That which has many objects is having many objects. And that is the cognition, from those accompanied by that [cognition]. This is the indication of the required cause.

original: anye tu tritvādyutpattirevātra saṅgrahavākye vivakṣitā / dvitvotpattiścopariṣṭād bhaviṣyatīti manyante / taccāsat / tritvādyutpatterapyupari sadbhāvenānarthakyaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anye tu tri tva ādi utpattiḥ eva atra saṅgraha vākye vivakṣitā dvi tva utpattiḥ ca upariṣṭāt bhaviṣyati iti manyante tat ca asat tri tva ādi utpatteḥ api upari sadbhāvena ānarthakya prasaṅgāt
translated: Others, however, think that the origin of the number three and so on is what is intended here in the summary statement, and that the origin of the number two will come later. But that is not correct, because if the origin of the number three and so on also existed later, it would be meaningless.

original: evañca saṃkṣepeṇotpattivināśakāraṇe prajñāpite viśeṣākāṅkṣitayā ajñasya praśnaḥ kathamiti / kena rūpeṇa utpattiśca vināśaśca bhavatītyāha yadā boddhuḥ ityādi / tathā hi / budhyata iti boddhā / tasya boddhurātmanaścakṣuṣā saha samānāsamānajātīyayordravyayoḥ sannikarṣe satītyaniyamaṃ darśayati samānāsamāna iti samānajātīyayorasamānajātīyayośca dravyayoḥ sannikarṣe satīti / tatsaṃyuktasamavetasamavetaikatvasāmānye jñānamutpadyata iti / tena cakṣuṣā saṃyuktaṃ dravyaṃ / tatsamavetamekatvaguṇam / tatsamavetañca tadekatvasāmānyam / tasmin jñānamutpadyate pūrvaṃ / viśeṣaṇatvāt / tathā hi / viśeṣaṇajñānamādau / kāraṇatvāt / viśeṣyajñānantu paścāt / kāryatvāt /
analyzed: evam ca saṃkṣepeṇa utpatti vināśa kāraṇe prajñāpite viśeṣa ākāṅkṣi tayā ajñasya praśnaḥ katham iti kena rūpeṇa utpattiḥ ca vināśaḥ ca bhavati iti āha yadā boddhuḥ ityādi tathā hi budhyate iti boddhā tasya boddhuḥ ātmanaḥ cakṣuṣā saha samāna asamāna jātīyayoḥ dravyayoḥ sannikarṣe sati iti aniyamam darśayati samāna asamānaḥ iti samāna jātīyayoḥ asamāna jātīyayoḥ ca dravyayoḥ sannikarṣe sati iti tad saṃyukta samaveta samaveta
translated: Thus, when the causes of origination and destruction have been indicated in brief, due to the desire for specification, the ignorant one asks how? In what form do origination and destruction occur? He says when of the knower and so on. For thus: One who knows is the knower. Of the knower shows the absence of restriction that it is when there is contact between the self and the eye with substances of the same and different kinds. Of the same and different means when there is contact between substances of the same kind and of different kinds. When there is knowledge of the universal of oneness inhering in what is conjoined with that means knowledge arises of the universal of oneness inhering in the quality of oneness inhering in the substance conjoined with that eye. That substance is conjoined with that eye. The quality of oneness inheres in that. And the universal of oneness inheres in that. Knowledge arises of that first, because it is the qualifier. For thus: Knowledge of the qualifier comes first, because it is the cause. But knowledge of the qualified comes later, because it is the effect.

original: ata eva ekatvasāmānyajñānotpattau satyām / ekatvasāmānyañca tatsambandhaśca / tajjñānañceti ekatvasāmānyatatsambandhatajjñānāni / tebhyo 'nekaviṣayiṇyekā buddhirutpadyate / anekaścāsau viṣayaścetyanekaviṣayaḥ / so 'syā vidyate ityanekaviṣayiṇī / ekā ca na viṣayabhede 'pi bhidyate /
analyzed: atas eva eka tva sāmānya jñāna utpattau satyām eka tva sāmānyam ca tad sambandhaḥ ca tat jñānam ca iti eka tva sāmānya tad sambandha tad jñānāni tebhyaḥ neka viṣayiṇī ekā buddhiḥ utpadyate anekaḥ ca asau viṣayaḥ ca iti aneka viṣayaḥ sā u syāḥ vidyate iti aneka viṣayiṇī ekā ca na viṣaya bhede bhidyate
translated: For this very reason, when the cognition of the universal 'one' arises, and that 'one' is the universal, and that is the relation, and that is the cognition, so the 'one', the universal, that relation, and that cognition. From them, a single cognition arises that has multiple objects. And that is multiple and that is the object, so it has multiple objects. That exists for this, so it has multiple objects. And it is single and is not differentiated even when the objects are different.

original: kaścāsāvaneko viṣaya ityāha ekatvaguṇayoḥ iti / ekatvaguṇaścaikatvaguṇaścetyekatvaguṇayorviṣayabhūtayoryathoktā buddhirutpadyate / ekatvasāmānyabuddheśca vinaśyattā / tatastāmapekṣyaikatvābhyāṃ svāśrayayordvitvamārabhyate atra ca svāśrayayoriti samavāyikāraṇanirdeśastathā ekatvābhyāmityasamavāyikāraṇasya / tāmapekṣyeti apekṣābuddhernimittakāraṇatvam / ekatvasāmānyajñānasya ca vināśaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ ca asau anekaḥ viṣayaḥ iti āha ekatva guṇayoḥ iti ekatva guṇaḥ ca ekatva guṇaḥ ca iti ekatva guṇayoḥ viṣaya bhūtayoḥ yathā uktā buddhiḥ utpadyate ekatva sāmānya buddheḥ ca vinaśyat tā tatas tām apekṣya ekatvābhyām sva āśrayayoḥ dvi tvam ārabhyate atra ca sva āśrayayoḥ iti samavāyi kāraṇa nirdeśaḥ tathā ekatvābhyām iti asamavāyi kāraṇasya tām apekṣya iti apekṣā buddheḥ nimitta kāraṇa tvam ekatva sāmānya jñānasya ca vinā
translated: What is that multiple object? He says 'of the one and the quality'. The cognition as stated arises of the one and the quality, which are the objects. And the cognition of the universal 'one' is destroyed. Then, in dependence on that, duality is produced in the two substrata by the two unities. And here, the statement 'in the two substrata' indicates the inherent cause, and similarly 'by the two unities' indicates the non-inherent cause. 'In dependence on that' indicates that the cognition of dependence is the instrumental cause, and the destruction of the cognition of the universal 'one'.

original: tataḥ punastasmin dvitvasāmānyajñānamutpadyate / tataḥ punardvitvasāII /mānyajñānād apekṣābuddhervinaśyattā / dvitvasāmānyatatsambandhatajjñānebhyo dvitvaguṇabuddherutpattirityekaḥ kālaḥ /PDhS
analyzed: tatas punar tasmin dvi tva sāmānya jñānam utpadyate tatas apekṣā buddheḥ vinaśyat tā dvi tva sāmānya tad sambandha tad jñānebhyaḥ dvi tva guṇa buddheḥ utpattiḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then again, the knowledge of the universal duality arises. Then from the knowledge of the universal duality, the expectancy cognition ceases. From the universal duality, its relation, and the knowledge of that, the cognition of the quality duality arises - this is one moment.

original: tataḥ samutpanne dvitve tatsaṃyuktasamavetasamavāyād dvitvasāmānye jñānamutpadyate pūrvam / viśeṣaṇatvāt / tasmāt sāmānyajñānād apekṣābuddhervinaśyattā vināśakāraṇasānnidhyam / jñānasya jñānāntaravirodhitvāt / dvitvasāmānyatajjñānatatsambandhebhyo dvitvaguṇabuddherutpadyamānateti / dvitvasāmānyād / dvitvasāmānyajñānād dvitvasāmānyaguṇasambandhād dvitvaguṇabuddherutpadyamānatā utpattikāraṇasānnidhyam ityeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas samutpanne dvi tve tad saṃyukta samaveta samavāyāt dvi tva sāmānye jñānam utpadyate pūrvam viśeṣaṇa tvāt tasmāt sāmānya jñānāt apekṣā buddheḥ vinaśyat tā vināśa kāraṇa sānnidhyam jñānasya jñāna antara virodhi tvāt dvi tva sāmānya tad jñāna tad sambandhebhyaḥ dvi tva guṇa buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā iti dvi tva sāmānyāt dvi tva sāmānya jñānāt dvi tva sāmānya guṇa sambandhāt dvi tva guṇa buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā utpatti kāraṇa sānnidhya
translated: Then, when duality has arisen, from the inherence of inherence connected with that, the knowledge of the universal duality arises first, because of being a qualifier. From that knowledge of the universal, the expectancy cognition ceases, the presence of the cause of destruction. Because knowledge is opposed by another knowledge. From the universal duality, its knowledge, and their relation, the cognition of the quality duality is about to arise. From the universal duality, from the knowledge of the universal duality, from the relation of the quality of the universal duality, the cognition of the quality duality is about to arise - this is the presence of the cause of origination. This is one moment.

original: dvitvavināśaprakāraḥ
analyzed: dvitva vināśa prakāraḥ
translated: The mode of destruction of duality

original: tata idānīmapekṣābuddhivināśād dvitvaguṇasya vinaśyattā / dvitvaguṇabuddhitaḥ sāmānyabuddhervinaśyattā / dvitvaguṇatajjñānatatsambandhebhyo dve dravye iti dravyabuddherutpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /PDhS🔽tata idānīmapekṣābuddhervināśaḥ / tadvināśād dvitvaguṇasya vinaśyattā dvitvaguṇabuddherutpādastatsāmānyabuddherapi vinaśyattā / dvitvaguṇatajjñānatatsambandhebhyaḥ iti / dvitvaguṇaśca tajjñānañca tatsambandhaśceti tathoktāstebhyo nimittebhyaḥ dve dravye iti dravyabuddherutpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas idānīm apekṣā buddhi vināśāt dvi tva guṇasya vinaśyat tā dvi tva guṇa buddhitaḥ sāmānya buddheḥ vinaśyat tā dvi tva guṇa tad jñāna tad sambandhebhyaḥ dve dravye iti dravya buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas idānīm apekṣā buddheḥ vināśaḥ tad vināśāt dvitva guṇasya vinaśyat tā dvitva guṇa buddheḥ utpādaḥ tad sāmānya buddheḥ api vinaśyat tā dvitva guṇa tad jñāna tad sambandhebhyaḥ iti dvitva guṇaḥ ca tad jñānam ca tad sambandhaḥ ca iti tathā uktāḥ tebhyaḥ nimittebhyaḥ dve dravye iti dravya buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, now, from the destruction of the cognition of dependence, the destructibility of the quality of duality. From the cognition of the quality of duality, the destructibility of the cognition of the universal. From the quality of duality, its cognition, and their relation, the cognition of the two substances is about to arise. This is one moment.🔽Then, now, the destruction of the cognition of dependence. From its destruction, the destructibility of the quality of duality. The production of the cognition of the quality of duality. The destructibility of the cognition of the universal. From the quality of duality, its cognition, and their relation. The quality of duality, its cognition, and their relation are thus called. From those causes, the cognition of the two substances is about to arise. This is one moment.

original: tadanantaraṃ dve dravye iti jñānotpādaḥ / dvitvasya vināśaḥ / dvitvaguṇabuddhervinaśyattā / dravyajñānāt saṃskārasyotpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /PDhS
analyzed: tad anantaram dve dravye iti jñāna utpādaḥ dvi tvasya vināśaḥ dvi tva guṇa buddheḥ vinaśyat tā dravya jñānāt saṃskārasya utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, the production of the cognition of the two substances. The destruction of duality. The destructibility of the cognition of the quality of duality. From the cognition of the substance, the production of the impression. This is one moment.

original: tadanantaraṃ dravyajñānasyotpādaḥ / tasmād dvitvaguṇabuddhervinaśyattā / sāmānyabuddhervināśo 'pekṣābuddhivināśād guṇasya vināśaḥ / saṃskārasyotpadyamānatetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tadanantaraṃ dravyasāmānyāt /jñānād dvitvaguṇabuddhervināśaḥ / dravyabuddherapi saṃskārāditi /PDhS
analyzed: tad anantaram dravya jñānasya utpādaḥ tasmāt dvi tva guṇa buddheḥ vinaśyat tā sāmānya buddheḥ vināśaḥ upekṣā buddhi vināśāt guṇasya vināśaḥ saṃskārasya utpadyamāna tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ  tad anantaram dravya sāmānyāt jñānāt dvi tva guṇa buddheḥ vināśaḥ dravya buddheḥ api saṃskārāt iti
translated: Then the production of the cognition of the substance. Therefore, the destruction of the cognition of the quality of duality. The destruction of the cognition of the universal is from the destruction of the cognition of dependence. The destruction of the quality is from the destruction of the cognition of dependence. The production of the impression. This is the same time for these.🔽Immediately after that, from the cognition of the substance and the universal, the destruction of the cognition of the quality of duality. And the destruction of the cognition of the substance from the impression.

original: tataḥ saṃskārotpāde sati dravyabuddheḥ vinaśyattā / guṇabuddhervināśaḥ / tato dravyabuddherapi saṃskārād vināśa iti /
analyzed: tatas saṃskāra utpāde sati dravya buddheḥ vinaśyat tā guṇa buddheḥ vināśaḥ tatas dravya buddheḥ api saṃskārāt vināśaḥ iti
translated: Then, when the impression is produced, the destructibility of the cognition of the substance. The destruction of the cognition of the quality. Then the destruction of the cognition of the substance also from the impression.

original: nanu sarvametadasambaddham / saṃkhyāsadbhāve pramāṇābhāvāt / athaikaṃ dve trīṇi ityādivyavahāraḥ pramāṇam / tanna / asya kalpanājñānatvāt / na ca kalpanājñānamarthavyavasthāpanāyālam / tadabhāve 'pi bhāvāt / tathā hi / nimittanirvikalpakajñānakrameṇa smaraṇānantaraṃ savikalpakaṃ jñānamutpadyate / na cārthasyāvasthānam / kṣaṇikatvād iti nirviṣayatvam /
analyzed: nanu sarvam etat asambaddham saṃkhyā sadbhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt atha ekam dve trīṇi ityādi vyavahāraḥ pramāṇam  / tat na asya kalpanā jñāna tvāt na ca kalpanā jñānam artha vyavasthāpanāya alam tad abhāve pi bhāvāt tathā hi nimitta nirvikalpaka jñāna krameṇa smaraṇa anantaram savikalpakam jñānam utpadyate na ca arthasya avasthānam kṣaṇika tvāt iti nirviṣaya tvam
translated: But all this is irrelevant, because there is no evidence for the existence of number. If the usage one, two, three etc. is the evidence, that is not so, because it is a conceptual cognition. And a conceptual cognition is not fit to establish an object, because it exists even in its absence. Thus, in sequence with the indeterminate cognition of the cause, a determinate cognition arises after memory. And the object does not remain, because it is momentary. Thus it is objectless.

original: bādhakopapatteśca / tathā hyutpadyamānaṃ dvitvādi na dravyotpatteḥ pūrvamutpadyate / tadabhāvāt / na samakālam / kāryakāraṇabhāvānupapattiprasaṅgāt / athottarakālam / tatrāpi kiṃ tat svabhāvād viparītād veti / tatsvābhāvye kiṃ dvitvādinā / dravyasyaiva tatsvarūpatvāt / viparyaye tu / kathaṃ tatsvabhāvāt tasyotpattiḥ / ekasmād bahubhyaśca dvitvotpattiprasaṅgāt / tatsvabhāvatāyāḥ sarvatrāviśeṣāt /
analyzed: bādhaka upapatteḥ ca tathā hi utpadyamānam dvi tva ādi na dravya utpatteḥ pūrvam utpadyate tad abhāvāt na sama kālam kārya kāraṇa bhāva anupapatti prasaṅgāt atha uttara kālam tatra api kim tat svabhāvāt viparītāt vā iti tad svābhāvye kim dvi tva ādinā dravyasya eva tad svarūpa tvāt viparyaye tu katham tad svabhāvāt tasya utpattiḥ ekasmāt bahubhyaḥ ca dvi tva utpatti prasaṅgāt tad svabhāva tāyāḥ sarvatra aviśeṣāt
translated: And because of the possibility of contradiction. For thus, the arising of duality, etc. does not arise before the arising of substance, because it does not exist. Not simultaneously, because of the consequence of the impossibility of the relation of cause and effect. If it is after, then also whether it is from its own nature or from the opposite? If it is of its own nature, then what is the use of duality, etc.? Because the nature of substance itself is that. If it is the opposite, then how does it arise from its own nature? Because of the consequence of the arising of duality from one and many, because there is no difference in the nature of being that everywhere.

original: tathā vṛttyanupapatteśca / dvitvamanekasmin vartamānamekadeśena sarvātmanā vā vartate / naikadeśena / tadabhāvāt / na sarvātmanā / ubhayavṛttitvābhāvaprasaṅgāt / na ca yenaiva svarūpeṇaikavṛttistenaiva dravyāntare 'pi / tayorekatāprasaṅgād iti vṛttyanupapatterasattvam /
analyzed: tathā vṛtti anupapatteḥ ca dvi tvam anekasmin vartamānam eka deśena sarva ātmanā vā vartate na eka deśena tad abhāvāt na sarva ātmanā ubhaya vṛtti tva abhāva prasaṅgāt na ca yena eva svarūpeṇa eka vṛttiḥ tena eva dravya antare pi tayoḥ ekatā prasaṅgāt iti vṛtti anupapatteḥ asattvam
translated: And because of the impossibility of inherence. Duality inhering in many substances inheres either partially or wholly. Not partially, because that is not possible. Not wholly, because of the consequence of the absence of inherence in both. And it does not inhere in one substance with one form and in another substance with the same form, because of the consequence of the identity of the two. Thus, because of the impossibility of inherence, it is non-existent.

original: tathopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasya sarvairagrahaṇāt / yadi hi dvitvādeḥ sattvam / upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptatvād rūpādivat sarvapuruṣairgṛhyeta / na tūpalabhyate / tasmānnāstīti /
analyzed: tathā upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya sarvaiḥ agrahaṇāt yadi hi dvi tva ādeḥ sattvam upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpta tvāt rūpa ādi vat sarva puruṣaiḥ gṛhyeta na tu upalabhyate tasmāt na asti iti
translated: And because what is perceptible is not perceived by anyone. For if duality, etc. exist, they would be perceived by all men because they are perceptible, like color, etc. But they are not perceived. Therefore they do not exist.

original: samānendriyagrāhyatvācca / yenendriyeṇa dravyamupalabhyate tenaiva saṃkhyāpīti na tato 'rthāntaram / bhede tu rūpādīnāmiva asamānendriyagrāhyatvamapi syāt /
analyzed: samāna indriya grāhya tvāt ca  yena indriyeṇa dravyam upalabhyate tena eva saṃkhyā api iti na tatas rtha antaram bhede tu rūpa ādīnām iva asamāna indriya grāhya tvam api syāt
translated: And because they are perceived by the same sense faculty. The number is perceived by the same sense faculty by which the substance is perceived. Therefore it is not a different object. But if it were different, it would be perceived by different sense faculties, like color, etc.

original: ito 'pyasattvaṃ deśabhedenānupalabdheḥ / tadagrahe tadbuddhyabhāvācca / tathā grahaṇānupapatteśca / tathā hi / dvitvamanekatra vartamānaṃ kathamindriyeṇa paricchidyeta / yugapat sannikarṣadvayasya manasānadhiṣṭhitatvāt / atha cakṣuradhiṣṭhīyate / tathāpyanekapadārthagrahaṇaprasaṅgaḥ / tasya mano'dhiṣṭhitasyānekapadārthaiḥ sambandhāt /
analyzed: itas pi asattvam deśa bhedena anupalabdheḥ tad agrahe tad buddhi abhāvāt ca tathā grahaṇa anupapatteḥ ca  tathā hi dvi tvam anekatra vartamānam katham indriyeṇa paricchidyeta yugapad sannikarṣa dvayasya manasā anadhiṣṭhita tvāt  atha cakṣuḥ adhiṣṭhīyate tathā api aneka padārtha grahaṇa prasaṅgaḥ tasya manaḥ dhiṣṭhitasya aneka padārthaiḥ sambandhāt
translated: And because it is not perceived when the place is different, and because there is no cognition of it when it is not perceived, and because such a perception is impossible. For how would duality, which exists in many things, be delimited by a sense faculty? Because two simultaneous contacts are not apprehended by the mind. But if it is apprehended by the eye, then there would be the fault of apprehending many things, because that [eye] which is apprehended by the mind is related to many things.

original: yathā ca saṃkhyāsambandhād dravyeṣvekādivyavahārastathaikatvādiguṇeṣvapyekādivyavahāre nimittāntarakalpanāyāṃ tatrāpyekādivyavahārasya sambhavādanaII /vasthāprasaṅgaḥ / athaikatvādāvekādivyavahārastatsvarūpatayā / dravye 'pi tathābhāvaprasaṅgaḥ / athaikatvādisāmānye tatsāmānyānupapatterekādivyavahāraḥ / tacca kalpanājñānamiti /
analyzed: yathā ca saṃkhyā sambandhāt dravyeṣu eka ādi vyavahāraḥ tathā eka tva ādi guṇeṣu api eka ādi vyavahāre nimitta antara kalpanāyām tatra api eka ādi vyavahārasya    atha eka tva ādau eka ādi vyavahāraḥ tad svarūpa tayā dravye pi tathā bhāva prasaṅgaḥ atha eka tva ādi sāmānye tad sāmānya anupapatteḥ eka ādi vyavahāraḥ tat ca kalpanā jñānam iti
translated: And just as the usage of one and so on is in substances due to the relation of number, so too in the usage of one and so on in the qualities of oneness and so on, if another cause is imagined, then the usage of one and so on would be possible there too, leading to an infinite regress. If the usage of one and so on in oneness and so on is by way of its own nature, then the same would apply to substances. If the usage of one and so on in the universals of oneness and so on is due to the impossibility of those universals, and that is a conceptual cognition,

original: tadetat sarvamasāmpratam / ekādivyavahārasya bādhakāsambhavena prāmāṇyāt / tathā hyekādijñānamarthānvayavyatirekānuvidhānānnīlādijñānavadarthajam / na cārthādhīnatayā nirvikalpakajñānotpattisamakālameva tasyotpattiḥ / saṅketasmaraṇasya sahakāriṇo 'bhāvāt / nāpi smṛtijameva / arthasyāpi tatra vyāpāropalabdheḥ / na ca smṛteratiśayādhāyakatvamanatiśayanivartakatvaṃ vā / kintu arthasadbhāve sati jñānajanakatvameva /
analyzed: tat etat sarvam asāmpratam eka ādi vyavahārasya bādhaka asambhavena prāmāṇyāt tathā hi eka ādi jñānam artha anvaya vyatireka anuvidhānāt nīla ādi jñāna vat artha jam na ca artha adhīna tayā nirvikalpaka jñāna utpatti sama kālam eva tasya utpattiḥ saṅketa smaraṇasya sahakāriṇaḥ bhāvāt nā api smṛti jam eva arthasya api tatra vyāpāra upalabdheḥ na ca smṛteḥ atiśaya ādhāyaka tvam anatiśaya nivartaka tvam vā kintu artha sadbhāve sati jñāna janaka tvam eva
translated: All this is not correct. Because the usage of one etc. is valid, in the absence of any sublating cognition. For instance, the cognition of one etc. is produced by the object, like the cognition of blue etc., because it conforms to the presence and absence of the object. And it is not produced at the very time of the production of non-determinate cognition, by depending on the object, because of the absence of the co-operating factor, the recollection of convention. Nor is it produced from memory alone. Because the operation of the object is also perceived in that case. And memory does not cause the addition of anything, nor the removal of anything. But it only produces the cognition when the object is present.

original: na cārthasyendriyāṇāṃ vā avicārakatvāt prāgiva paścādapyajanakatvamiti dūṣaṇam / tathā vṛttyanupapatteḥ / deśabhedenāgrahaṇāt / tadagrahe tadbuddhyabhāvācceti / pūrvamevāvayavisamarthanāvasare pratiṣedhāt /
analyzed: na ca arthasya indriyāṇām vā avicāraka tvāt prāk iva paścāt api ajanaka tvam iti dūṣaṇam tathā vṛtti anupapatteḥ deśa bhedena agrahaṇāt tad agrahe tad buddhi abhāvāt ca iti pūrvam eva avayavi samarthana avasare pratiṣedhāt
translated: And the objection that the object or the sense organs, being non-reflective, do not produce the cognition afterwards as they did before, is not valid. Because then there would be no operation of the mind. Because it is not apprehended when there is difference of place. And because there is no cognition of it when it is not apprehended. This has been refuted earlier, at the time of establishing the whole.

original: na cābādhyamānamapi ekādijñānam apramāṇamiti nyāyyam / nīlādijñānasyāpyapramāṇatāprasaṅgāt / atha nīlaṃ vinā tajjñāne na syānnīlākāratā / tadekatvādijñāne 'pi samānam /🔽athaikatvādijñānaṃ śabdākāram / na cārthe tadrūpatāstīti nirviṣayatvam / na / nīlajñānasyāpi śabdākāratayā nirviṣayatāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: na ca ābādhyamānam api eka ādi jñānam apramāṇam iti nyāyyam nīla ādi jñānasya api apramāṇa tā prasaṅgāt atha nīlam vinā tad jñāne na syāt nīla ākāra tā tad eka tva ādi jñāne samānam  atha eka tva ādi jñānam śabda ākāram na ca arthe tad rūpa tā asti iti nirviṣaya tvam na nīla jñānasya api śabda ākāra tayā nirviṣaya tā prasaṅgāt
translated: And it is not right to say that the cognition of one and so on, even though not contradicted, is not a valid means of knowledge, because then the cognition of blue and so on would also be an invalid means of knowledge. If it is argued that the form of blue would not be present in the cognition without blue, the same applies to the cognition of oneness and so on.🔽If it is argued that the cognition of oneness and so on has the form of words, and that form is not present in the object, so it is objectless, no, because then the cognition of blue would also be objectless, as it has the form of words.

original: athādyaṃ nīlajñānaṃ nirvikalpakamarthajam / uttarantu savikalpakamanekakṣaṇavyavadhānād arthāpāye 'pyutpadyate / arthasya kṣaṇikatvācchabdākārātāyāśca tatrāsambhavāditi nirviṣayatvamiṣyata eva /
analyzed: atha ādyam nīla jñānam nirvikalpakam artha jam uttarantu sa vikalpakam aneka kṣaṇa vyavadhānāt artha apāye pi utpadyate arthasya kṣaṇika tvāt śabda ākāra atāyāḥ ca tatra asambhavāt iti nirviṣaya tvam iṣyate eva
translated: If it is argued that the first cognition of blue is non-conceptual and arises from the object, but the subsequent one is conceptual and arises even when the object is absent due to being interrupted by many moments, and that it is accepted to be objectless because the object is momentary and the form of words is not possible there,

original: tadasat / kṣaṇikatvasya pūrvameva pratiṣedhāt / nirvikalpakajñānotpattāvivārthasya savikalpakajñānotpattāvanvayavyatirekābhyāmindriyeṇa saṅketasmaraṇena ca sahakṛtasya vyāpāropalabdheḥ / tathā hi / idantayā jñānotpattestatrendriyasya vyāpāro niścīyate / aṅgulyā vyapadiśyamānatvād arthasya ceti / anyathā hīndriyārthayorekādijñānotpattau vyāpāramantareṇa idantayopalabdhiraṅgulyādinā ca vyapadeśo na syāt / athendriyajñānaṃ manovijñānakrameṇa II / savikalpakajñānotpattau kāraṇamiti / idantayopalabdhiraṅgulyādinā vyapadeśo nārthajāviti cet / na / etasmin krame pramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: tat asat kṣaṇika tvasya pūrvam eva pratiṣedhāt nirvikalpaka jñāna utpattau iva arthasya savikalpaka jñāna utpattau anvaya vyatirekābhyām indriyeṇa saṅketa smaraṇena ca sahakṛtasya vyāpāra upalabdheḥ tathā hi idantayā jñāna utpatteḥ tatra indriyasya vyāpāraḥ niścīyate aṅgulyā vyapadiśyamāna tvāt arthasya ca iti anyathā hi indriya arthayoḥ eka ādi jñāna utpattau vyāpāram antareṇa idantayā upalabdhiḥ aṅguli ādinā ca vyapadeśaḥ na syāt atha indri
translated: That is not so. Because momentariness has already been refuted earlier. Just as in the arising of non-conceptual knowledge, in the arising of conceptual knowledge of an object, the operation of the sense organ along with the recollection of convention is observed through positive and negative concomitance. This is how it is. The operation of the sense organ in that is ascertained from the arising of knowledge as this, and from the indication of the object by the finger, etc. Otherwise, if there were no operation in the arising of knowledge of one, etc. of the sense organ and the object, the perception as this and the indication by the finger, etc. would not occur. If it is argued that the sense knowledge is the cause of the arising of conceptual knowledge through the sequence of mental consciousness, and that the perception as this and the indication by the finger, etc. are not due to the object, that is not so. Because there is no evidence for this sequence.

original: atha saṅkalpāt sadbhāvasiddheranyathā ekādivyavahāro na syādityeṣā kalpanā kriyate / tadasat / vṛttivikalpāderbādhakasya pūrvameva pratiṣedhāt / saṃkhyāsadbhāvasiddhāvekādivyavahārasya sākṣādarthajatvopapatteḥ /
analyzed: atha saṅkalpāt sadbhāva siddheḥ anyathā eka ādi vyavahāraḥ na syāt iti eṣā kalpanā kriyate tat asat vṛtti vikalpa ādeḥ bādhakasya pūrvam eva pratiṣedhāt saṃkhyā sadbhāva siddhau eka ādi vyavahārasya sākṣāt artha ja tva upapatteḥ
translated: Now, if the existence of number is established by mere assumption, then the usage of one and so on would not be possible, so this assumption is made. That is not so. Because the refutation of the objection of difference due to the presence of number has already been stated earlier. And when the existence of number is established, the usage of one and so on is directly seen to be based on the object.

original: śabdākāratā tu savikalpakajñāne na sambhavatyeva / sākāravādapratiṣedhasya vakṣyamāṇatvāt / kevalantu smṛtijanitatvāt savikalpakaṃ jñānaṃ śabdollekhenotpadyate / nirvikalpakantu ullekhaśūnyam / saṅketasmṛteravyāpārāt /
analyzed: śabda ākāra tā tu sa vikalpaka jñāne na sambhavati eva sa ākāra vāda pratiṣedhasya vakṣyamāṇa tvāt kevalam tu smṛti janita tvāt sa vikalpakam jñānam śabda ullekhena utpadyate nirvikalpakam tu ullekha śūnyam saṅketa smṛteḥ avyāpārāt
translated: But the form of the word is not possible in determinate cognition at all, because the doctrine of the existence of forms will be refuted later. The determinate cognition arises only from the production of memory, with the imprint of the word, but the indeterminate cognition is devoid of imprint, because the recollection of convention does not operate.

original: na ca vāsanāprabhavatvam / vāsanāyāḥ pūrvameva pratiṣedhāt / tathā hi / bodhavyatirekeṇānyā vāsanā na sambhavatītyuktameva avayavisamarthanāvasare / yā tu vaiśeṣikopagatā smṛtyanumeyā vāsanā sā na kāraṇamekādivyavahāre / tasyāḥ parokṣakāraṇatayā smṛtivilakṣaṇatvāt / tathā hi / ekādijñānam aparokṣam indriyavyāpāreṇa idantayotpadyate / na ca smṛteretadrūpatvamastīti / na vāsanāprabhavam / tathā itthambhūtavāsanāprabhavatve 'pi paramparayārthavyavasthāpakatvam / arthānubhavapūrvakatvād vāsanāyāḥ / yā tu ekatvādiśabdebhyo vikalpād vāsanā sāpi arthaṃ vyavasthāpayatyeva / śabdasyānubhavapūrvakatvenābhyupagamāt / dṛṣṭe dṛṣṭavāditvam ityanena /
analyzed: na ca vāsanā prabhava tvam vāsanāyāḥ pūrvam eva pratiṣedhāt tathā hi bodha vyatirekeṇa anyā vāsanā na sambhavati iti uktam eva avayavi samarthana avasare yā tu vaiśeṣika upagatā smṛti anumeyā vāsanā sā na kāraṇam eka ādi vyavahāre tasyāḥ parokṣa kāraṇa tayā smṛti vilakṣaṇa tvāt tathā hi eka ādi jñānam aparokṣam indriya vyāpāreṇa idantayā utpadyate na ca smṛteḥ etad rūpa tvam asti iti na vāsanā prabhavam tathā ittham bhūta vāsanā prabhav
translated: Nor is it born of impressions, because impressions have already been refuted earlier. For it has been said that apart from cognition, there can be no other impression, during the demonstration of the whole. As for the impression inferred from memory, accepted by the Vaiśeṣikas, it is not the cause in the usage of one etc., because it is not of the nature of memory, being an indirect cause. For the cognition of one etc. is non-perceptual, produced as this by the operation of the sense organ. And memory does not have this nature. Therefore, it is not born of impressions. Even if it is born of such impressions, it indirectly establishes the object, because impressions are preceded by the experience of the object. And the impression from the words 'one' etc. due to conceptual differentiation also establishes the object itself, because words are accepted as preceded by experience, by the statement 'the seen is spoken of as seen'.

original: yattu utpattivikalpanād ekatvāderasattvamityuktam / tadasat / uttarakālaṃ tadutpattyabhyupagamāt / atha kiṃ tat svabhāvād viparītād vetyuktam / tatra yadi tatsvābhāvyaṃ tadutpādanasāmarthyaṃ vivakṣitam / tadiṣyata eva / athaikatvādyāśrayatvaṃ tannāsti / utpatteḥ pūrvaṃ tadabhāvāt / siddhe ca saṃkhyāsadbhāve pramāṇatastasyāḥ kāryadravye kṛtakatvād avaśyamutpattikāraṇaṃ vācyam / tatra ca ekatvadvitvādyāśrayasya tajjanakatve tadabhāvaḥ syāt / dṛṣṭā cotpattiḥ / tasmāt dravyamitarakārakopacitam teṣāṃ kāraṇamiti utpattivikalpānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: yat tu utpatti vikalpanāt ekatva ādeḥ asattvam iti uktam tat asat uttarakālam tad utpatti abhyupagamāt  / atha kim tat svabhāvāt viparītāt vā iti uktam tatra yadi tat svābhāvyam tad utpādana sāmarthyam vivakṣitam tat iṣyate eva atha ekatva ādi āśraya tvam tat na asti utpatteḥ pūrvam tad abhāvāt siddhe ca saṃkhyā sadbhāve pramāṇataḥ tasyāḥ kārya dravye kṛtaka tvāt avaśyam utpatti kāraṇam vācyam tatra ca ekatva dvitva ādi āśrayasya tad janaka tve tad abhāva
translated: As for what was said about the non-existence of oneness etc. due to the imagination of origination, that is not so. Because origination after that is accepted. Now, if it is asked whether it is from its own nature or from something contrary, if the capability of producing that is intended by its naturalness, that is indeed accepted. But if the basis of oneness etc. is that, it does not exist, because it does not exist before origination. And when the existence of number is established by means of a means of knowledge, its cause in the produced substance must be stated because it is produced. And in that case, if the basis of oneness, twoness etc. were the generator of that, it would be non-existent. And origination is seen. Therefore, the substance accumulated by other agents is the cause of them. Thus, the imagination of origination is not possible.

original: yaccedam / upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasyānupalabdherdvitvāderasattvamiti / tanna / asiddhatvāt / tathā ca yadīyayā apekṣābuddhyā sampāditaṃ dvitvādi tasyaivopaII /labdhilakṣaṇaprāptam / na puruṣāntarasya / tasyaiva tadupalambhāt / yatropalambhastatraiva rūpidravye samavāyikāraṇatvamiṣṭaṃ na tadabhāve 'pīti / tasmānna sakalapuruṣāpekṣayā tadupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptamityasiddho hetuḥ /
analyzed: yat ca idam upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya anupalabdheḥ dvi tva ādeḥ asattvam iti tat na asiddha tvāt tathā ca yadīyayā apekṣā buddhyā sampāditam dvi tva ādi na puruṣa antarasya tasya eva tad upalambhāt yatra upalambhaḥ tatra eva rūpi dravye samavāyi kāraṇa tvam iṣṭam na tad abhāve pi iti tasmāt na sakala puruṣa apekṣayā tat upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptam iti asiddhaḥ hetuḥ
translated: And as for the argument that duality, etc., do not exist because they are not perceived when they are perceptible, that is inconclusive, because it is unestablished. And thus, that duality, etc., which is accomplished by the cognition of dependence belongs only to that [object], not to another person. Because it is perceived only by that [person]. Where there is perception, there alone is the relation of inherence accepted as the material cause, not in its absence. Therefore, the reason is unestablished, as it is not perceptible to all persons.

original: yaccedam / ekatvāderna dravyavyatirekeṇāstitvaṃ samānendriyagrāhyatvāditi / tatra pratijñāvākye padayorvyāghātaḥ / yathā idañca nāsti ceti / na caikatvādeḥ pakṣīkaraṇaṃ yuktam / aprasiddhatvāt / prasiddhañca pakṣīkriyamāṇaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ śabdādi / na ca parasyaikatvādi prasiddhamiti /
analyzed: yat ca idam ekatva ādeḥ na dravya vyatirekeṇa astitvam samāna indriya grāhya tvāt iti tatra pratijñā vākye padayoḥ vyāghātaḥ yathā idam ca na asti ca iti na ca ekatva ādeḥ pakṣīkaraṇam yuktam aprasiddha tvāt prasiddham ca pakṣīkriyamāṇam dṛṣṭam śabda ādi na ca parasya ekatva ādi prasiddham iti
translated: And as for the argument that duality, etc., do not exist separately from substance because they are grasped by the same sense organ, there is a contradiction between the words in the proposition, as in this does not exist. And it is not proper to make duality, etc., the subject, because they are not well-known. What is well-known and made the subject is seen to be sound, etc. And duality, etc., are not well-known to the opponent.

original: atha paravyāptyā parasyāniṣṭāpādanaṃ prasaṅgasādhanamiti cet / tatra yadi pramāṇapūrvikā paraprasiddhistayaiva bādhyamānatvādanutthānaṃ viparītānumānasya / athāpramāṇapūrvikā / tarhi pramāṇaṃ vinā prameyasyāprasiddherekāatvādīnāṃ pakṣīkaraṇamayuktam /
analyzed: atha para vyāptyā parasya aniṣṭa āpādanam prasaṅga sādhanam iti ced tatra yadi pramāṇa pūrvikā para prasiddhiḥ tayā eva bādhyamāna tvāt anutthānam viparīta anumānasya atha apramāṇa pūrvikā tarhi pramāṇam vinā prameyasya aprasiddheḥ eka a a tva ādīnām pakṣīkaraṇam ayuktam
translated: If it be said that reductio ad absurdum is the proof of the opponent's conclusion by the opponent's own premisses, then, if the opponent's doctrine is based on evidence, the reductio is superfluous, since the opponent's conclusion is thereby refuted. If, on the other hand, the opponent's doctrine is not based on evidence, then the object of the conclusion is not established, and it is improper to make of it the minor term in a syllogism.

original: tathā samānendriyagrāhyatvāditi / yenendriyeṇa dravyamupalabhyate tenaiva saṃkhyāpīti sādhanasya rūpādibhedairanaikāntikatvam / tathā hi / yenaivendriyeṇa śuklarūpasya grahaṇaṃ tenaiva pītādeḥ / na ca tasya tasmād bhedo 'sattvaṃ veti / na ca parasya dravyaṃ prasiddhamiti kathaṃ tasmādabhedaḥ sādhyate / atha rūpameva dravyam / na tarhi samānendriyagrāhyatvam rūpasyaikendriyagrāhyatvāt / saṃkhyāyāstu dvīndriyaparicchedyatvāditi /
analyzed: tathā samāna indriya grāhya tvāt iti yena indriyeṇa dravyam upalabhyate tena eva saṃkhyā api iti sādhanasya rūpa ādi bhedaiḥ anaikāntika tvam tathā hi yena eva indriyeṇa śukla rūpasya grahaṇam tena eva pīta ādeḥ na ca tasya tasmāt sattvam vā iti na ca parasya dravyam prasiddham iti katham tasmāt abhedaḥ sādhyate atha rūpam eva dravyam na tarhi samāna indriya grāhya tvam rūpasya eka indriya grāhya tvāt saṃkhyāyāḥ tu dvi indriya paricchedya tvāt iti
translated: Similarly, the argument that number, &c., are not different from substance, because they are perceived by the same senses as substance, is inconclusive, since colour, &c., are perceived by the same senses as substance. For instance, the same sense which perceives the colour white perceives also yellow and other colours, and yet there is no difference between the colour white and the other colours. And since the opponent does not admit the existence of substance, how can he be made to admit that number, &c., are not different from substance? If, on the other hand, substance be the same as colour, then the argument fails, since colour is perceived by the same sense as itself, while number is perceived by two senses.

original: atha rūpādisamudāyo dravyam / tathāpi samānendriyagrāhyatvamasiddham / rūpādeḥ pratiniyatendriyagrāhyatvāt / na ca rūpādīnāṃ pratiniyatendriyagrāhyatvād bhedaḥ / śuklādibhedānāmekatāprasaṅgāt / kiṃ tarhi / pratibhāsabhedāt / sa cehāpyastyeva / tathā hyekatra dravyapratibhāso 'nyatra caikatvādipratibhāsa iti / atha saṃkhyādravyayoḥ pratyakṣeṇa bhedaprasiddherekatāsādhanaṃ pratyakṣeṇa bādhyamānatvāt kālātyayāpadiṣṭaṃ bhavatīti /
analyzed: atha rūpa ādi samudāyaḥ dravyam tathā api samāna indriya grāhya tvam asiddham rūpa ādeḥ pratiniyata indriya grāhya tvāt  na ca rūpa ādīnām pratiniyata indriya grāhya tvāt bhedaḥ śukla ādi bhedānām ekatā prasaṅgāt kim tarhi pratibhāsa bhedāt sa ca iha api asti eva tathā hi ekatra dravya pratibhāsaḥ nyatra ca ekatva ādi pratibhāsaḥ iti atha saṃkhyā dravyayoḥ pratyakṣeṇa bheda prasiddheḥ ekatā sādhanam pratyakṣeṇa bādhyamāna tvāt kāla atyaya apadi
translated: If, on the other hand, substance is a collection of form and so on, even so, being perceived by the same sense faculty remains unestablished, because form and so on are perceived by specific sense faculties. And the difference between form and so on is not due to being perceived by specific sense faculties, because it would follow that white and so on are one. Rather, it is due to the difference in appearance. And that exists here too. For thus, in one case there is the appearance of substance, and in another the appearance of oneness and so on. If it is argued that the proof of oneness is contradicted by perception because the difference between number and substance is well-established by perception, then it is inconclusive due to being untimely.

original: yaccedam / utpannasya dvitvādergrahaṇānupapatterasattvam / tadasat / indriyavyāpāreṇāsya dvitvāderaparokṣasya dṛṣṭatvāt / na ca manasānadhiṣṭhitasyendriyasya paricchedakatvaṃ yugapajjñānotpattiprasaṅgāt / ataścakṣurmanasādhiṣṭhīyate / na sambandhasteṣām / aṇuparimāṇasambandhitayā na yugapadadhiṣṭhāyakaṃ mana iti dvitvāderagrahaṇameva syāt / asti ca grahaṇamataścakṣureva manasādhiṣṭhīyate / II / nanvevamapyanekapadārthasambandhād yugapadanekajñānotpādakaṃ syāt / na / karaṇasyaikapratyayanirvṛttau sāmarthyāt / tathā hyekaṃ karaṇamekasmin kāle 'nekāṃ kriyāṃ na karotīti / tasmād yugapat prakāśanameva ghaṭādīnāṃ na grahaṇānītyuktapūrvam /
analyzed: yat ca idam utpannasya dvi tva ādeḥ grahaṇa anupapatteḥ asattvam tat asat indriya vyāpāreṇa asya dvi tva ādeḥ aparokṣasya dṛṣṭa tvāt na ca manasā anadhiṣṭhitasya indriyasya paricchedaka tvam yugapad jñāna utpatti prasaṅgāt atas cakṣuḥ manasā adhiṣṭhīyate na sambandhaḥ teṣām aṇu parimāṇa sambandhi tayā na yugapad adhiṣṭhāyakam manaḥ iti dvi tva ādeḥ agrahaṇam eva syāt asti ca grahaṇam atas cakṣuḥ eva manasā adhiṣṭhīyate     nanu
translated: And this: The non-existence of duality, etc., which arise, because their apprehension is not possible, is not so, because their non-manifest duality, etc., are seen by the operation of the sense organ. And the sense organ, not controlled by the mind, cannot be the apprehender, because then knowledge would arise simultaneously. Therefore, the eye is controlled by the mind. Their relation is not that. The mind, related to atomic size, does not control simultaneously, so there would be no apprehension of duality, etc. But there is apprehension, therefore the eye itself is controlled by the mind. But even so, from the relation of many objects, there would be the production of many knowledges simultaneously. No, because the instrument has the capacity to produce a single cognition. For thus, a single instrument does not perform many actions at one time. Therefore, the manifestation of pots, etc., is simultaneous, not their apprehension, as stated before.

original: yaccedam / ekādivyavahāro guṇāntarāt svabhāvād vetyuktam / tatraikatvasāmānyavaśāditi brūmaḥ / tathā hi / dravye guṇasambandhād ekādivyavahāro guṇe ca sāmānyasambandhād sāmānye 'pi guṇasambandhāt / na ca grahaṇaparamparā / viśeṣaṇajñānasya niyamena jñānapūrvakatvānabhyupagamāt / atha saṃyuktasamavetasamavāyād ekatvasāmānye jñānamutpadyate / viśeṣaṇatvādityuktam / anekaguṇaviṣayasya viśeṣyajñānasyaivāsaṃvedanāt / na / dvitvasyotpattyanyathānupapattyā tatsadbhāvasiddheḥ / tathā hi / yadi kāraṇaguṇapūrvaprakrameṇa rūpādivadutpadyate dvitvaṃ prathamākṣasannipātavelāyāmeva grahaṇaṃ syāt / cirotpannatvāt / gaṇanāvaiyarthyañca / na caitat / tasmādanekaguṇaviṣayasya jñānasyātmavartino 'pi dvitvotpattau kāraṇatvaṃ niścīyate / tadvināśācca vināśaḥ / anyathā hi samavāyyasamavāyikāraṇayorvināśād vināśābhyupagame tayoranekakālamavasthānāt sthāyitvameva syāt / kvacinnityatvañca / tayoravināśādanyasya ca virodhiguṇasyāsambhavāt / tasmānnimittakāraṇādeva vināśaḥ kalpyate /
analyzed: yat ca idam eka ādi vyavahāraḥ guṇa antarāt svabhāvāt vā iti uktam tatra eka tva sāmānya vaśāt iti brūmaḥ tathā hi dravye guṇa sambandhāt eka ādi vyavahāraḥ guṇe ca sāmānya sambandhāt sāmānye pi guṇa sambandhāt  / na ca grahaṇa paramparā viśeṣaṇa jñānasya niyamena jñāna pūrvaka tva anabhyupagamāt  atha saṃyukta samaveta samavāyāt eka tva sāmānye jñānam utpadyate viśeṣaṇa tvāt iti uktam aneka guṇa viṣayasya viśeṣya jñānasya eva asaṃve
translated: And this, which has been said - the usage of one and so on is from another quality or from its own nature, there we say it is due to the universal of oneness. For thus: the usage of one and so on is from the connection of a quality in a substance, and in a quality it is from the connection of a universal, and in a universal also it is from the connection of a quality. And there is no series of apprehensions, because the knowledge of a qualifier is not necessarily accepted as preceded by knowledge. Now, it is said that the knowledge of oneness arises from the inherence of the inhered-in in the conjoined, because of the qualifier-ness. Because the knowledge of the qualified itself, which has many qualities as its object, is not experienced. No, because the existence of that is established by the impossibility of the origination of duality in any other way. For thus: if duality arises like color and so on in the order of the qualities of the cause, there would be apprehension even at the time of the first contact with the eye, because it arises long ago. And counting would be useless. But this is not so. Therefore, even though the knowledge which has many qualities as its object resides in the self, the origination of duality is not experienced.

original: na caivaṃ ghaṭādernimittakāraṇavināśād vināśaprasaṅgaḥ / adarśanāt / atra tu samavāyyasamavāyikāraṇayoravasthāne 'pi dvitvādervināśasya dṛṣṭatvād apekṣābuddhivināśād vināśaḥ kalpyate / anyathā hi rūpādivadavasthāne prathamākṣasannipātakāla eva grahaṇaṃ syādityuktam / athāvasthitasyāpi dvitvādervyañjakābhāvāt anupalambhaḥ / upalambhastu idānīmutpannasyāpi ghaṭata ityapekṣābuddhyāderjanakatvameva nyāyyam / tasmād dvitvādivyavahārottarakālaṃ tadabhāvasya saṃvedanāt tadutpattau kāraṇāntarasyāsambhave sati apekṣābuddhivināśasya kāraṇatvamuktam /
analyzed: na ca evam ghaṭa ādeḥ nimitta kāraṇa vināśāt vināśa prasaṅgaḥ adarśanāt atra tu samavāyi asamavāyi kāraṇayoḥ avasthāne dvi tva ādeḥ vināśasya dṛṣṭa tvāt apekṣā buddhi vināśāt vināśaḥ kalpyate anyathā hi rūpa ādi vat avasthāne prathama akṣa sannipāta kāle eva grahaṇam syāt iti uktam atha avasthitasya api dvi tva ādeḥ vyañjaka abhāvāt anupalambhaḥ upalambhaḥ tu idānīm utpannasya api ghaṭate iti apekṣā buddhi ādeḥ janaka tvam eva
translated: And it is not so that a pot etc. are destroyed by the destruction of the instrumental cause, because it is not seen. But in this case, even when the inherent and non-inherent causes remain, since the destruction of duality etc. is seen, the destruction is imagined to be due to the destruction of the expectant cognition. Otherwise, like color etc., if it remained, it would be apprehended at the very time of the first contact with the eye, as stated. Now, if duality etc. remains, its non-apprehension is due to the absence of a manifester. But the apprehension arises even from what is produced now, so the production of the expectant cognition etc. is rightly the cause. Therefore, since the non-existence of that is experienced after the usage of duality etc., when it is produced, in the absence of the possibility of another cause, the destruction of the expectant cognition is stated to be the cause.

original: atha pūrvaṃ dvitvasāmānyajñānamanantaraṃ guṇajñānaṃ dravyajñānañceti kalpanāyāṃ kiṃ pramāṇam / viśeṣaṇatvamiti cet / na / viśeṣaṇe 'pi viśeṣaṇāntarakalpanāyāmanavasthāprasaṅgāt / tathā hi dve dravye iti dravyajñānotpattau guṇasya viśeṣaṇaII /tvād yuktamādau tajjñānaṃ guṇasya ca viśeṣaṇatvānna tatsāmānyajñānaṃ yuktam / abhyupagame vā / tasyāpyanyad viśeṣaṇamityanavasthā syāt / na / niyamānabhyupagamāt / tathā hi / viśeṣaṇe 'vaśyaṃ viśeṣaṇāntarakalpaneti niyamaḥ pratiṣidhyate 'navasthābhayāt / na punarviśeṣaṇe viśeṣaṇameva nāstīti / vivakṣitañcaitad bhāṣyakartuḥ / dravyaviśeṣaṇasyāpi guṇasya sāmānyaviśeṣaṇābhidhānāditi /
analyzed: atha pūrvam dvi tva sāmānya jñānam anantaram guṇa jñānam dravya jñānam ca iti kalpanāyām kim pramāṇam viśeṣaṇa tvam iti ced na viśeṣaṇe viśeṣaṇa antara kalpanāyām anavasthā prasaṅgāt tathā hi dve dravye iti dravya jñāna utpattau guṇasya yuktam ādau tat jñānam guṇasya ca viśeṣaṇa tvāt na tat sāmānya jñānam yuktam abhyupagame vā tasya api anyat viśeṣaṇam iti anavasthā syāt na niyama anabhyupagamāt tathā hi viśeṣaṇe vaśyam viśeṣaṇa
translated: Now, if it is supposed that the knowledge of the universal 'duality' comes first, and then the knowledge of the quality and the knowledge of the substance, what is the evidence for this? If it be said that the quality is the qualifier, no (says the siddhāntin); for if another qualifier were supposed even in the qualifier, there would be an infinite regress. For instance, when the knowledge of the substance arises in the form 'two substances', it is proper that the knowledge of the quality should come first, because the quality is the qualifier of that. And it is not proper that the knowledge of the universal of that (quality) should come first, because the quality is the qualifier of that (substance). And if it is admitted, there would be an infinite regress, because another qualifier would be required for that (universal). No (says the siddhāntin); because no such rule is admitted. For thus, the rule that another qualifier is necessarily to be supposed even in the qualifier is denied, out of fear of an infinite regress. But it is not that there is no qualifier at all in the qualifier. And this is intended by the author of the Bhāṣya (Śabara), because the quality, which is the qualifier of the substance, is mentioned as the qualifier of the universal.

original: atha saṃskārād dravyabuddhervināśa ityatra kiṃ pramāṇam / kāryasyākasmikasyānupalabdheḥ / dravyajñānavināśasya pratyakṣeṇa saṃvedanāt saṃskārasya kāraṇatvaṃ niścīyate / tasya ca smṛtyā sadbhāvasiddhiriti vakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha saṃskārāt dravya buddheḥ vināśaḥ iti atra kim pramāṇam kāryasya ākasmikasya anupalabdheḥ dravya jñāna vināśasya pratyakṣeṇa saṃvedanāt saṃskārasya kāraṇa tvam niścīyate tasya ca smṛtyā sadbhāva siddhiḥ iti vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: Now, what is the evidence here that the cognition of substance is destroyed by the impression? Because the effect is not perceived without a cause. The fact that the destruction of the cognition of substance is experienced by perception establishes that the impression is the cause. And we will explain that the existence of that is established by memory.

original: tritvādyutpattivināśaprakāraḥ🔽etena tritvādyutpattirapi vyākhyātā / ekatvebhyo 'nekaviṣayabuddhisahitebhyo tritvādiniṣpattirapekṣābuddhivināśād vināśa iti /PDhS
analyzed: etena tri tva ādi utpattiḥ api vyākhyātā eka tvebhyaḥ tri tva ādi niṣpattiḥ apekṣā buddhi vināśāt vināśaḥ iti pdhs
translated: The mode of origination and destruction of triteness, etc.🔽By this, the origination of triteness, etc. is also explained. The production of triteness, etc. from unities accompanied by cognitions of many objects, and the destruction from the destruction of the cognition of dependence.

original: tadevaṃ dvitvasyotpattivināśakāraṇe prajñāpite sati etena tritvādyutpattirvyākhyātā ityatideśaṃ karoti / yathā hi / dvitvamekatvābhyāmanekabuddhiviṣayasahitābhyāmārabhyate tathā tritvāderapyekatvebhyo 'nekabuddhiviṣayasahitebhyo niṣpattiriti /
analyzed: tat evam dvi tvasya utpatti vināśa kāraṇe prajñāpite sati etena tri tva ādi utpattiḥ vyākhyātā iti atideśam karoti yathā hi dvi tvam eka tvābhyām aneka buddhi viṣaya sahitābhyām ārabhyate tathā tri tva ādeḥ api eka tvebhyaḥ neka buddhi viṣaya sahitebhyaḥ niṣpattiḥ iti
translated: Thus, when the causes of the origination and destruction of duality have been indicated, he makes a generalization that by this, the origination of triteness, etc. is explained. Just as duality is produced from unities accompanied by cognitions of many objects, in the same way, triteness, etc. also are produced from unities accompanied by cognitions of many objects.

original: utpanne ca tritvādau tatsāmānyajñānam / tato 'pekṣābuddhervinaśyattā / sāmānyatajjñānatatsambandhebhyo guṇabuddherutpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tatastritvādiguṇabuddherutpādaḥ / guṇatajjñānatatsambandhebhyo dravyabuddherutpadyamānatā / apekṣābuddhervināśaḥ / sāmānyajñānasya vinaśyattā / guṇasya vinaśyattetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: utpanne ca tri tva ādau tad sāmānya jñānam tatas upekṣā buddheḥ vinaśyat tā sāmānya tad jñāna tad sambandhebhyaḥ guṇa buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas tri tva ādi guṇa buddheḥ utpādaḥ guṇa tad jñāna tad sambandhebhyaḥ dravya buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā apekṣā buddheḥ vināśaḥ sāmānya jñānasya vinaśyat tā guṇasya vinaśyat tā iti eṣām ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: And when the triad etc. have arisen, there is the cognition of their generality. Then, from the cognition of dependence, there is destruction. From the generality, its cognition, and their relation, the cognition of the quality is in the process of arising - this is one moment.🔽Then, the arising of the cognition of the quality such as triad etc., from the quality, its cognition, and their relation, the cognition of the substance is in the process of arising, the destruction of the cognition of dependence, the destruction of the cognition of generality, and the destruction of the quality - these are one moment.

original: tato dravyajñānasyotpādaḥ / saṃskārasyotpadyamānatā / guṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / sāmānyajñānasya vināśaḥ / apekṣābuddhivināśācca guṇasyāpi nāśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas dravya jñānasya utpādaḥ saṃskārasya utpadyamāna tā guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā sāmānya jñānasya vināśaḥ apekṣā buddhi vināśāt ca guṇasya api nāśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the arising of the cognition of the substance, the process of arising of the impression, the destruction of the cognition of the quality, the destruction of the cognition of generality, and the destruction of the quality due to the destruction of the cognition of dependence - this is one moment.

original: tataḥ saṃskārād dravyajñānasyāpītyatideśārthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas saṃskārāt dravya jñānasya api iti atideśa arthaḥ
translated: Then, from the impression, the cognition of the substance also - this is the meaning of extension.

original: ādipadena tu śatasaṃkhyāderavarodhastatra ca dvitvotpattyatideśo na sambhavatyeva / tathā hi / dravyaśatasya yugapadindriyeṇa sambandhābhāvāt tadgataikaguṇāII /nāmagrahaṇe 'pekṣākāraṇābhāvāt kathaṃ śatasaṃkhyotpattiriti / na cendriyeṇaikatvasāmānyasya ekasmin dravye saṃyuktasamavetasamavāyalakṣaṇasya sambandhasyotpattestasyaikatāyā dravyāntaraguṇeṣvapi sadbhāvāt tadākṛṣṭānāmekaikaguṇānāṃ yugapadgrahaṇācchatasaṃkhyotpattiriti vācyam / sarvatra tathābhāvena śatasaṃkhyādyutpattiprasaṅgāt / tathā hi / indriyasyaikatvasāmānyena saṃyuktasamavetasamavāyalakṣaṇasya sambandhasyāviśeṣāt tadupagrahādekaikaguṇānāṃ grahaṇābhyupagame sarvasmin dravye śatasaṃkhyādyutpattiḥ syāt / na caitat / tasmādapekṣākāraṇābhāvādanutpattiriti / na cāpekṣābuddhiṃ vinaivotpattiḥ / gaṇanāvaiyarthyaprasaṅgādityuktanyāyāt /

Thus, since there is no difference in the relation characterized by inherence in the conjoined and inherence in the unity-universality with the sense organ, if the single qualities are accepted to be grasped by that [inherence], the number 'hundred' etc. would arise in all substances. original: tadetat sarvamasat / saṃkhyāvyavahārasya vāstavatvāt / śatasaṃkhyādisadbhāvasiddhau tasyāḥ kṛtakatvād avaśyamutpattikāraṇaṃ vācyamiti anyasyāsambhavād vilakṣaṇaivāpekṣābuddhiḥ kalpyata iti /🔽tathā caikasmin ekaguṇe jñānotpattau satyāṃ saṃskārasyotpāde dvitīyaikaguṇajñānasyotpadyamānatā / pūrvajñānasya vinaśyattetyekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tato dvitīyaikaguṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / pūrvaguṇasmaraṇasyotpadyamānatā / prāktanasaṃskārasahakāriṇā ca jñānena saṃskārasyotpadyamānatā / prāktanajñānasya vināśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tat etat sarvam asat saṃkhyā vyavahārasya vāstava tvāt śata saṃkhyā ādi sadbhāva siddhau tasyāḥ kṛtaka tvāt avaśyam utpatti kāraṇam vācyam iti anyasya asambhavāt vilakṣaṇā eva apekṣā buddhiḥ kalpyate iti  tathā ca ekasmin ekaguṇe jñāna utpattau satyām saṃskārasya utpāde dvitīya ekaguṇa jñānasya utpadyamāna tā pūrva jñānasya vinaśyat tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas dvitīya eka guṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ pūrva guṇa smaraṇasya utpadyamāna tā prāktana saṃskāra sahakāriṇā ca jñānena saṃskārasya utpadyamāna tā prāktana jñānasya vināśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: All this is false, because the usage of number is real. When the existence of the number hundred etc. is established, its being produced must necessarily be stated as the cause of origination. Since anything else is impossible, only a distinct expectancy cognition is imagined.🔽And thus, when the cognition of a single quality arises in one, the production of the impression, the arising of the second cognition of a single quality, and the destruction of the previous cognition - this is one moment.🔽Then, the arising of the second cognition of a single quality, the arising of the recollection of the previous quality, the arising of the impression by the cognition assisted by the previous impression, and the destruction of the previous cognition - this is one moment.

original: tataḥ smaraṇasyotpādaḥ / saṃskārasyotpādaḥ / dvitīyaguṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / smaraṇānubhavau cāpekṣābuddhiḥ / tato dvitvasyotpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas smaraṇasya utpādaḥ saṃskārasya utpādaḥ dvitīya guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā smaraṇa anubhavau ca apekṣā buddhiḥ tatas dvi tvasya utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the arising of the recollection, the arising of the impression, the destruction of the second cognition of a quality, the expectancy cognition of the recollection and experience, and then the arising of duality - this is one moment.

original: tato dvitvasyotpādāt tajjñānasyotpadyamānatā / dvitīyaikaguṇajñānasyāpi vināśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tato dvitvaguṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / dravyajñānasyotpadyamānatā / smaraṇasya vinaśyattetyekaḥ kālaḥ /🔽tato dravyajñānasyotpādaḥ / guṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / smaraṇasya vināśaḥ / tadvināśād dvitvasya vinaśyattā / tṛtīyaikaguṇajñānasyotpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas dvi tvasya utpādāt tad jñānasya utpadyamāna tā dvitīya eka guṇa jñānasya api vināśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas dvi tva guṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ dravya jñānasya utpadyamāna tā smaraṇasya vinaśyat tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ  tatas dravya jñānasya utpādaḥ guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā smaraṇasya vināśaḥ tad vināśāt dvi tvasya vinaśyat tā tṛtīya eka guṇa jñānasya utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, due to the production of duality, the knowledge of that is in the process of arising, and the second knowledge of the single quality is also being destroyed - this is one moment.🔽Then, the knowledge of the quality of duality arises, the knowledge of the substance is in the process of arising, and the recollection is being destroyed - this is one moment.🔽Then, the knowledge of the substance arises, the knowledge of the quality is being destroyed, the recollection is destroyed, due to its destruction the duality is being destroyed, and the third knowledge of the single quality is in the process of arising - this is one moment.

original: tatastṛtīyaikaguṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / dravyajñānasya vinaśyattā / dvitvaguṇajñānasya vināśaḥ / pūrvaikaguṇadvitaye smaraṇasyotpadyamānatā / pūrvasaṃskāraII /sacivena ekaguṇajñānena saṃskārāntarasyotpadyamānatā / dvitvaguṇasya vināśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tṛtīya ekaguṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ dravya jñānasya vinaśyat tā dvitva guṇa jñānasya vināśaḥ pūrva ekaguṇa dvitaye smaraṇasya utpadyamāna tā ekaguṇa jñānena saṃskāra antarasya utpadyamāna tā dvitva guṇasya vināśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the third knowledge of the single quality arises, the knowledge of the substance is being destroyed, the knowledge of the quality of duality is destroyed, the recollection of the previous two single qualities is in the process of arising, and due to the previous impression, the arising of another impression by the single quality knowledge, and the destruction of the quality of duality - this is one moment.

original: tataḥ smaraṇasyotpādaḥ / saṃskārasyotpādaḥ / ekaguṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / smaraṇānubhavau cāpekṣābuddhiḥ / tatastritvaguṇasyotpadyamānatā / dravyajñānasya vināśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas smaraṇasya utpādaḥ saṃskārasya utpādaḥ eka guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā smaraṇa anubhavau ca apekṣā buddhiḥ tatas tritva guṇasya utpadyamāna tā dravya jñānasya vināśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then there is the production of recollection, the production of the impression, the destruction of the knowledge of the single quality, and the mutual dependence of recollection and experience. Then there is the arising of the quality of three-ness, and the destruction of the knowledge of the substance - this is one moment.

original: tatastritvaguṇasyotpādaḥ / tajjñānasyotpadyamānatā / ekaguṇajñānasya vināśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tritva guṇasya utpādaḥ tad jñānasya utpadyamānatā eka guṇa jñānasya vināśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then there is the production of the quality of three-ness, the arising of its knowledge, and the destruction of the knowledge of the single quality - this is one moment.

original: tatastritvaguṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / dravyajñānasyotpadyamānatā / smaraṇasya vinaśyattetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tritva guṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ dravya jñānasya utpadyamāna tā smaraṇasya vinaśyat tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then there is the production of the knowledge of the quality of three-ness, the arising of the knowledge of the substance, and the destruction of the recollection - this is one moment.

original: tato dravyajñānasyotpādaḥ / guṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / smaraṇasya vināśaḥ / tadvināśāt tritvaguṇasya vinaśyattā / caturthaikaguṇajñānasyotpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas dravya jñānasya utpādaḥ guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā smaraṇasya vināśaḥ tad vināśāt tritva guṇasya vinaśyat tā caturtha ekaguṇa jñānasya utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then there is the production of the knowledge of the substance, the destruction of the knowledge of the quality, the destruction of the recollection, and from its destruction, the destruction of the quality of three-ness, and the arising of the fourth knowledge of the single quality - this is one moment.

original: tataścaturthaikaguṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / dravyajñānasya vinaśyattā / guṇajñānasya vināśaḥ / tritvaguṇavināśaḥ / saṃskārasyotpadyamānatetyayaṃ kramaścatuṣṭvādiṣvapyūhyastāvad yāvadantyadravyaikaguṇe jñānaṃ kalpanayā tatsaṃskāreṇa ca smaraṇasyotpadyamānateti /
analyzed: tatas caturtha ekaguṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ dravya jñānasya vinaśyat tā guṇa jñānasya vināśaḥ tritva guṇa vināśaḥ saṃskārasya utpadyamāna tā iti ayam kramaḥ catuṣṭva ādiṣu api ūhyaḥ tāvat yāvat antya dravya ekaguṇe jñānam kalpanayā tad saṃskāreṇa ca smaraṇasya utpadyamāna tā iti
translated: Then, the production of the knowledge of the fourth and one quality, the destruction of the knowledge of substance, the destruction of the knowledge of quality, the destruction of the quality of three-ness, and the production of the impression - this sequence should be inferred in the case of four-ness and so on, until the knowledge of the last substance and one quality is imagined, and the production of recollection by that impression.

original: tataḥ prāktanāśeṣaikaguṇaviṣayasmaraṇasyotpādaḥ / antyadravyaikaguṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / smaraṇānubhavau cāpekṣābuddhiḥ / tataḥ śatasaṃkhyāyā utpadyamānatetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prāktana aśeṣa eka guṇa viṣaya smaraṇasya utpādaḥ antya dravya eka guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā smaraṇa anubhavau ca apekṣā buddhiḥ tatas śata saṃkhyāyāḥ utpadyamāna tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the production of the recollection of all the previous one qualities, the destruction of the knowledge of the last substance and one quality, the cognition of expectation of the recollection and experience, then the production of the number one hundred - this is one moment.

original: tataḥ śatasaṃkhyāyā utpattiḥ / tajjñānasyotpadyamānatā / antyadravyasyaikaguṇajñānasya vināśa ityekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas śata saṃkhyāyāḥ utpattiḥ tad jñānasya utpadyamāna tā antya dravyasya eka guṇa jñānasya vināśaḥ iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the production of the number one hundred, the production of its knowledge, the destruction of the knowledge of the last substance and one quality - this is one moment.

original: tato guṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / dravyajñānasyotpadyamānatā smaraṇasya vinaśyattetyekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: tatas guṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ dravya jñānasya utpadyamāna tā smaraṇasya vinaśyat tā iti ekaḥ kālaḥ
translated: Then, the production of the knowledge of quality, the production of the knowledge of substance, the destruction of recollection - this is one moment.

original: tadanantaram etāni śatam iti dravyajñānasyotpādaḥ / guṇajñānasya vinaśyattā / saṃskārasyotpadyamānatā / smaraṇasya vināśaḥ / tadanantaraṃ saṃskārād dravyajñānasyāpīti /
analyzed: tad anantaram etāni śatam iti dravya jñānasya utpādaḥ guṇa jñānasya vinaśyat tā saṃskārasya utpadyamāna tā smaraṇasya vināśaḥ tad anantaram saṃskārāt dravya jñānasya api iti
translated: After that, these hundred arise: the knowledge of substance is produced, the knowledge of quality is destroyed, the impression is being produced, the memory is being destroyed. After that, from the impression, the knowledge of substance also.

original: anye tu / ekasmin ekaguṇe jñānaṃ / tena kriyate saṃskāraḥ / punardvitīyaikaguṇe jñānam / tena prāktanena cānyaḥ saṃskāra ityeṣā kalpanā tāvad yāvadantyaguṇe jñānam / tataḥ kalpanayā tatsaṃskārasyābhivyaktatvād aśeṣaikaguṇaviṣayasya smaraṇasyotpattiḥ / anubhavasya vinaśyattā ityapekṣābuddhiḥ śatasaṃkhyājaniketi manyante / na cāntarāle dvitvādyanubhavasyāpi saṃvedanādanubhavena bādheti vācyam / kāraṇāṃśasyaiva kīrtanāt / tathā hi / eka guṇānubhavajanitaḥ saṃskāraḥ smṛtidvāreṇa śatasaṃkhyotpattau kāraṇam / na caivaṃ dvitvādyanubhava iti tasyānupanyāso nāsattvāditi /
analyzed: anye tu ekasmin eka guṇe jñānam tena kriyate saṃskāraḥ punar dvitīya eka guṇe jñānam tena prāktanena ca anyaḥ saṃskāraḥ iti eṣā kalpanā tāvat yāvat antya guṇe jñānam tatas kalpanayā tad saṃskārasya abhivyakta tvāt aśeṣa eka guṇa viṣayasya smaraṇasya utpattiḥ anubhavasya vinaśyat tā iti apekṣā buddhiḥ śata saṃkhyā janikā iti manyante na ca antarāle dvi tva ādi anubhavasya api saṃvedanāt anubhavena bādhā iti vācyam kāraṇa aṃśasya eva k
translated: Others, however, think that the cognition of a single quality produces a latent impression, and then the cognition of a second single quality, along with the previous one, produces another latent impression. This process continues until the cognition of the last quality. Then, due to the manifestation of that latent impression by imagination, the recollection of the entire single quality arises. And the destruction of the experience is the desire to know, which produces the number one hundred. And it cannot be said that the experience of duality, etc. in the interval is also known and invalidated by the experience, because only the causal part is mentioned. Thus, the latent impression produced by the experience of a single quality is the cause for the production of the number one hundred through recollection, and not so for the experience of duality, etc. Therefore, its non-mention is not due to non-existence.

original: athāstvevamutpattiḥ śatasaṃkhyāyāḥ / grahaṇantu kathamiti cintyate / tathā hi / dravyaśatasya yugapadindriyeṇa sambandhābhāvāt tadvartinī śatasaṃkhyāpyapratyakṣeti / kathametāni śatamiti pratyayaḥ syāt / athāntyadravyeṇendriyasya saṃyogāt tatsamavetā ca śatasaṃkhyotpanneti saṃyuktasamavāyādupalabhyata eva / tadākṛṣṭāni ca pūrvopalabdhadravyāṇīndriyasaṃyogābhāve 'pi viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyalakṣaṇenaiva sambandhena etāni śatam ityaparokṣajñānaviṣayāṇi bhavantīti /
analyzed: atha astu evam utpattiḥ śata saṃkhyāyāḥ grahaṇam tu katham iti cintyate tathā hi dravya śatasya yugapad indriyeṇa sambandha abhāvāt tad vartinī śata saṃkhyā apya pratyakṣā iti katham etāni śatam iti pratyayaḥ syāt atha antya dravyeṇa indriyasya saṃyogāt tad samavetā ca śata saṃkhyā utpannā iti saṃyukta samavāyāt upalabhyate eva tad ākṛṣṭāni ca pūrva upalabdha dravyāṇi indriya saṃyoga abhāve pi viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya lakṣaṇena eva sambandhena
translated: Now, let it be so that the number 'hundred' is produced. But how is it apprehended? For thus, since there is no simultaneous connection of the sense organ with the hundred substances, the number 'hundred' residing in them is also imperceptible. So how could there be the cognition 'these are a hundred'? But if, due to the contact of the sense organ with the last substance, the number 'hundred' inhering in that is produced, then it is perceived by the conjunction-inherence. And the previously perceived substances, attracted by that, become the objects of the non-perceptual cognition 'these are a hundred' by the relation of qualifier and qualified, even in the absence of contact of the sense organ with them.

original: tarhi sattāviśeṣeṇākṛṣṭānāmākāśādīnāmapi pratyakṣatā syāt / na / abhiprāyāparijñānāt / tathā hi etāni śatam ityaparokṣajñānasya dṛṣṭatvādatra kāraṇacintā kriyate / tatra cānyasambandhasyānupalabdheḥ śatasaṃkhyākṛṣṭāni viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāveṇaiva pratyakṣāṇi / na caivamākāśādīnyupalabdhapūrvāṇi / na ca teṣvaparokṣaṃ vijñānamastīti naivaṃ kalpyate /
analyzed: tarhi sattā viśeṣeṇa ākṛṣṭānām ākāśa ādīnām api pratyakṣa tā syāt na abhiprāya aparijñānāt tathā hi etāni śatam iti aparokṣa jñānasya dṛṣṭa tvāt atra kāraṇa cintā kriyate tatra ca anya sambandhasya anupalabdheḥ śata saṃkhyā ākṛṣṭāni viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāveṇa eva pratyakṣāṇi na ca evam ākāśa ādīni upalabdha pūrvāṇi na ca teṣu aparokṣam vijñānam asti iti na evam kalpyate
translated: Then, space and so on, attracted by the particular existence, would also be perceptible. No, because of not knowing the intention. For thus, since the knowledge of these are a hundred is seen to be non-conceptual, the inquiry into the cause is done here. And there, because of the non-apprehension of the relation to another, the hundred are apprehended by the relation of qualifier and qualified, attracted by the number hundred. And space and so on have not been apprehended in this way. And since there is no non-conceptual cognition of them, it is not imagined in this way.

original: na cādyadravyasyendriyeṇa saṃyogācchatasaṃkhyopalabhyate / antyadravye samutpādāt / tathā hi / gaṇanādvāreṇa antyadravyasyaikaguṇopalambhād upalabdhaikaguṇeṣu dravyeṣu samavetā śatasaṃkhyotpadyate tena pūrveṣveveti tatsaṃyoge 'pyasambhavād agrahaṇam /
analyzed: na ca ādya dravyasya indriyeṇa saṃyogāt śata saṃkhyā upalabhyate antya dravye samutpādāt tathā hi gaṇanā dvāreṇa antya dravyasya eka guṇa upalambhāt upalabdha eka guṇeṣu dravyeṣu samavetā śata saṃkhyā utpadyate tena pūrveṣu eva iti tad saṃyoge pi asambhavāt agrahaṇam
translated: And the number hundred is not apprehended by the contact of the sense organ with the first substance, because it arises in the last substance. For thus, by the apprehension of the single quality of the last substance through the door of counting, the number hundred inhering in the substances whose single quality is apprehended arises. Therefore, it is in the previous ones. Thus, even in its contact, it is not possible, so it is not apprehended.

original: na cātrānubhavasahakāriṇaḥ saṃskārasya saṃskārāntarārambhakatve ghaṭādyanubhavajanitasaṃskārasyāpi anubhavāntarasahakāriṇaḥ saṃskārārambhakatvaprasaṅgaḥ / adṛṣṭakāritatvād vastuvyavasthāyāḥ / tathā hi / śatasaṃkhyādyupabhogaprāpakādṛṣṭaII /niyamād atraiva viśiṣṭasaṃskārotpattirna ghaṭādau / tatra hi kāryābhāvāditi / kāryasadbhāvena ca kāraṇaparikalpanā kriyata iti / yatrānyathā asambhavastatraiva niyāmakatvamadṛṣṭasya na punardṛṣṭakāraṇapratyākhyānamiti / tasmādadṛṣṭasadbhāve 'pi gaṇanopalambhād apekṣābuddheḥ kāraṇatvaṃ kalpyate / anyathā hi īśvarabuddheradṛṣṭasya ekaguṇasahakāritvena śatasaṃkhyādyārambhakatve sarvadravyeṣu śatasaṃkhyādyutpattau rūpādivaccirotpannatvād gaṇanāmantareṇaivopalambhaḥ syāt / na cāsti /
analyzed: na ca atra anubhava sahakāriṇaḥ saṃskārasya saṃskāra antara ārambhaka tve ghaṭa ādi anubhava janita saṃskārasya api anubhava antara sahakāriṇaḥ saṃskāra ārambhaka tva prasaṅgaḥ adṛṣṭa kārita tvāt vastu vyavasthāyāḥ tathā hi atra eva viśiṣṭa saṃskāra utpattiḥ na ghaṭa ādau tatra hi kārya abhāvāt iti kārya sadbhāvena ca kāraṇa parikalpanā kriyate iti yatra anyathā asambhavaḥ tatra eva niyāmaka tvam adṛṣṭasya na punar dṛṣṭa kār
translated: And here, in the production of a subsequent impression by an impression that assists experience, there is no logical fault of the impression produced by the experience of a pot, etc. also being the producer of an impression that assists another experience, because the establishment of entities is due to unseen [forces]. For thus, the unseen [force] that brings about the enjoyment of a hundred and so on, by rule, produces a special impression just here, not in a pot, etc. For there, because of the absence of an effect. And the postulation of a cause is done by the existence of an effect. And where there is impossibility otherwise, there alone is the unseen [force] the determiner, not again the rejection of a seen cause. Therefore, even in the existence of the unseen [force], the causal nature of the cognition of dependence is postulated due to the apprehension of counting, otherwise, if the unseen [force] were the cause of the cognition of God, producing a hundred and so on by the cooperative effect of a single quality, in the production of a hundred and so on in all substances, like color, etc., due to long-standing production, the apprehension of a hundred and so on would occur without counting.

original: athābhivyañjakābhāvādanupalambha iti cenna / tat sadbhāve pramāṇābhāvādityuktottaratvāt /
analyzed: atha abhivyañjaka abhāvāt anupalambhaḥ iti ced na tat sadbhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt iti ukta uttara tvāt
translated: If it is argued that non-apprehension is due to the absence of manifestors, that is not so. Because it has been answered that there is no evidence for their existence.

original: na cānyadīyabuddhisampāditāni anyasya pratyakṣopalabdhānīti īśvarasampāditāsu asmadādīnāṃ pratyakṣatā na syāt / tasmāduktanyāyenotpattirgrahaṇañcetyalamativistareṇa /
analyzed: na ca anyadīya buddhi sampāditāni anyasya pratyakṣa upalabdhāni iti īśvara sampāditāsu asmat ādīnām pratyakṣa tā na syāt tasmāt ukta nyāyena utpattiḥ grahaṇam ca iti alam ati vistareṇa
translated: And it is not that what is accomplished by the cognition of one is apprehended by perception of another. Therefore, what is accomplished by God would not be perceptible to us. Therefore, by the stated reasoning, there is origination and apprehension. Enough of this extensive discussion.

original: kvacidāśrayavināśāditi / katham / yadaikatvādhārāvayave karmotpadyate tadaivakatvasāmānyajñānamutpadyate / karmaṇā cāvayavāntarād vibhāgaḥ kriyate / apekṣābuddheścotpattiḥ / ato yasminneva kāle vibhāgāt saṃyogavināśastasminneva kāle dvitvamutpadyate / saṃyogavināśād dravyavināśaḥ sāmānyabuddheścotpattiḥ / tato yasminneva kāle sāmānyajñānāpekṣābuddhervināśastasminneva kāle āśrayavināśād dvitvavināśa iti /PDhS
