analyzed: kvacid āśraya vināśāt iti katham yadā eka tva ādhāra avayave karma utpadyate tadā evaka tva sāmānya jñānam utpadyate karmaṇā ca avayava antarāt vibhāgaḥ kriyate apekṣā buddheḥ ca utpattiḥ atas yasmin eva kāle vibhāgāt saṃyoga vināśaḥ tasmin eva kāle dvi tvam utpadyate saṃyoga vināśāt dravya vināśaḥ sāmānya buddheḥ ca utpattiḥ tatas yasmin eva kāle sāmānya jñāna apekṣā buddheḥ vināśaḥ tasmin eva kāle āśraya vināśāt dvi tva vināśaḥ i
translated: In some cases, it is due to the destruction of the substratum. How? When an action arises in a part that is the substratum of unity, at that very time the cognition of the universal unity arises. And by the action, separation is produced from another part, and the cognition of dependence arises. Therefore, at the very time when separation destroys conjunction, at that very time duality arises. By the destruction of conjunction, the substance is destroyed, and the cognition of the universal arises. Then, at the very time when the destruction of the cognition of dependence on the cognition of the universal occurs, at that very time, by the destruction of the substratum, duality is destroyed.

original: vināśamāha na paramapekṣābuddhivināśāt kvacidāśrayavināśāditi / katham / ityavyutpannapraśnaḥ / tatra dvitvasyāśrayavināśena vināśābhidhānāt tatsamānatayā anyatrāpi parijñānaṃ bhaviṣyatīti manyamāno dvitvasyaiva vināśamāha yadaikatvādhārāvayave karmotpadyate / vibhāgasyotpadyamānatā / tadaivaikatvasāmānye jñānamutpadyate / apekṣābuddherutpadyamānatā / tato vibhāgasyotpādaḥ / dravyārambhakasaṃyogasya vinaśyattā / apekṣābuddherutpādaḥ / dvitvasyotpadyamānatā / ekatvasāmānyajñānasya vinaśyattā / tadanantaraṃ saṃyogasya vināśaḥ / ekatvasāmānyajñānasya vinaśyattā / dravyasya vinaśyattā dravya /dvitvasyotpādaḥ / tatsāmānyajñānasyotpadyamānatetyeṣāmekaḥ kālaḥ /
analyzed: vināśam āha na param apekṣā buddhi vināśāt kvacid āśraya vināśāt iti katham iti avyutpanna praśnaḥ tatra dvitvasya āśraya vināśena vināśa abhidhānāt tad samāna tayā anyatra api parijñānam bhaviṣyati iti manyamānaḥ dvitvasya eva vināśam āha yadā ekatva ādhāra avayave karma utpadyate vibhāgasya utpadyamāna tā tadā eva ekatva sāmānye jñānam utpadyate apekṣā buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā tatas vibhāgasya utpādaḥ dravya ārambhaka saṃyogasya vinaśyat tā ap
translated: He states destruction without the destruction of the dependent cognition, or in some cases by the destruction of the substratum. How? This is an uncomprehending question. There, since the destruction of duality is stated by the destruction of its substratum, he thinks that the understanding of it will be the same elsewhere too, and thus states the destruction of duality itself: When an action arises in a part that is the substratum of unity, the division is about to arise. At that very time, the cognition of the universal unity arises. The dependent cognition is about to arise. Then the division arises. The conjunction that causes the substance is about to be destroyed. The dependent cognition arises. Duality is about to arise. The cognition of the universal unity is about to be destroyed. Immediately after that, the conjunction is destroyed. The cognition of the universal unity is about to be destroyed. The substance is about to be destroyed. The substance. Duality arises. The cognition of its universal is about to arise. This is one moment.

original: tataḥ sāmānyajñānasyotpādaḥ / apekṣābuddhervinaśyattā / dravyasya vināśaḥ / guṇasya vinaśyattā / tato dravyavināśād guṇasya vināśaḥ / sāmānyajñānāccāpekṣābuddheriti / na ca apekṣābuddhivināśakāryo guṇavināśaḥ samakālatvāditi dravyavināśasyaiva kāraṇatvaṃ pūrvakālatvāt /
analyzed: tatas sāmānya jñānasya utpādaḥ apekṣā buddheḥ vinaśyat tā dravyasya vināśaḥ guṇasya vinaśyat tā tatas dravya vināśāt guṇasya vināśaḥ sāmānya jñānāt ca apekṣā buddheḥ iti na ca apekṣā buddhi vināśa kāryaḥ guṇa vināśaḥ sama kāla tvāt iti dravya vināśasya eva kāraṇa tvam pūrva kāla tvāt
translated: Then arises the cognition of the universal, the destruction of the relative cognition, the destruction of the substance, the destruction of the quality. Then from the destruction of the substance, the destruction of the quality, and from the cognition of the universal, the destruction of the relative cognition. And the destruction of the quality, which is the effect of the destruction of the relative cognition, does not occur simultaneously, so the cause is only the destruction of the substance, because it occurs earlier.

original: yadā tu apekṣābuddhisamakālamekatvādhārāvayave karma cintyate tadā ubhayavināśādapi guṇasya vināśaḥ sambhavatīti jñeyam /
analyzed: yadā tu apekṣā buddhi sama kālam eka tva ādhāra avayave karma cintyate tadā ubhaya vināśāt api guṇasya vināśaḥ sambhavati iti jñeyam
translated: But when the action is considered in the part that supports oneness simultaneously with the relative cognition, then it should be understood that the destruction of the quality can also occur from the destruction of both.

original: śobhanametadvidhānam vadhyaghātakapakṣe / sahānavasthānalakṣaṇe tu virodhe dravyajñānānutpattiprasaṅgaḥ / katham / guṇabuddhisamakālamapekṣābuddhivināśād dvitvavināśe tadapekṣasya dve dravye iti dravyajñānasyānutpattiprasaṅga iti /PDhS
analyzed: śobhanam etat vidhānam vadhya ghātaka pakṣe saha anavasthāna lakṣaṇe tu virodhe dravya jñāna anutpatti prasaṅgaḥ katham guṇa buddhi sama kālam apekṣā buddhi vināśāt dvi tva vināśe tad apekṣasya dve dravye iti dravya jñānasya anutpatti prasaṅgaḥ iti pdhs
translated: This method is excellent in the case of the killer and the killed. But in the case of contradiction characterized by non-coexistence, the cognition of the substance does not arise. How? From the destruction of the relative cognition at the same time as the cognition of the quality, there is the destruction of duality. Due to that, there is the non-arising of the cognition of the substance as two substances which depends on that.

original: śobhanametadvidhānam ityādinā parapakṣapratiṣedhadvāreṇa svapakṣamupasaṃharati / śobhanaṃ yuktametad dvitvādyutpattividhānam / kasmin pakṣe / ityāha vadhyaghātakapakṣe yadā hi ekasya jñānasyotpādo 'nyasya vinaśyattā /
analyzed: śobhanam etat vidhānam ityādinā parapakṣa pratiṣedha dvāreṇa svapakṣam upasaṃharati śobhanam yuktam etat dvi tva ādi utpatti vidhānam kasmin pakṣe iti āha vadhya ghātaka pakṣe yadā hi ekasya jñānasya utpādaḥ nyasya vinaśyat tā
translated: By the statement This arrangement is good and so on, he concludes his own position through the negation of the opponent's position. This arrangement of the origination of duality and so on is good, proper. In which position? He says, In the position of the killer and the killed, for when the production of one knowledge is the destruction of another,

original: sahānavasthānalakṣaṇe tu virodhe dravyajñānānutpattiprasaṅgaḥ ityaśobhanam / tathā hi / sahānavasthānalakṣaṇe virodhe dvitvasāmānyajñānasamakālam apekṣābuddhivināśāt guṇabuddhisamakālaṃ dvitvavināśe tadapekṣasya dve dravye itijñānasyānutpattiprasaṅgaḥ / tathā nirhetukatā ca vināśasya / yadaiva dvitvasāmānyajñānasyotpādastadaiva apekṣābuddhervināśa ityekakālatvānna sāmānyajñānakāryo 'pekṣābuddhivināśaḥ / na cānyat kāraṇamastīti nirhetukatvaṃ prasajyeta / na caitat sambhavatītyuktameva /
analyzed: saha anavasthāna lakṣaṇe tu virodhe dravya jñāna anutpatti prasaṅgaḥ iti aśobhanam tathā hi saha anavasthāna lakṣaṇe virodhe dvi tva sāmānya jñāna sama kālam apekṣā buddhi vināśāt guṇa buddhi sama kālam dvi tva vināśe tad apekṣasya dve dravye iti jñānasya anutpatti prasaṅgaḥ tathā nirhetuka tā ca vināśasya yadā eva dvi tva sāmānya jñānasya utpādaḥ tadā eva apekṣā buddheḥ vināśaḥ iti eka kāla tvāt na sāmānya jñāna kārya upekṣā buddhi
translated: But if contradiction is defined as non-coexistence, then the undesirable consequence follows that the cognition of substance does not arise. This is not good. For thus, if contradiction is defined as non-coexistence, then at the same time as the cognition of the universal of duality, due to the destruction of the cognition of relation, at the same time as the cognition of quality, there is the destruction of duality. And the undesirable consequence follows that the cognition two substances which depends on that does not arise. Similarly, destruction would be without cause. For just when there is the arising of the cognition of the universal of duality, at that very time there is the destruction of the cognition of relation. Because of being simultaneous, the destruction of the cognition of relation which is the effect of the cognition of the universal is not [caused by that]. And there is no other cause. Therefore the undesirable consequence follows that it would be without cause. And this is not possible. It has been stated.

original: laiṅgikavajjñānamātrāditi cet / syānmatam / yathā abhūtaṃ bhūtasya ityatra liṅgābhāve 'pi jñānamātrādanumānam tathā guṇavināśe 'pi guṇabuddhimātrād dve dravye iti pratyayaḥ syāditi /PDhS
analyzed: laiṅgika vat jñāna mātrāt iti ced syāt matam yathā abhūtam bhūtasya iti atra liṅga abhāve pi jñāna mātrāt anumānam tathā guṇa vināśe pi guṇa buddhi mātrāt dve dravye iti pratyayaḥ syāt iti
translated: If it is argued that it is like inference from mere cognition, it may be thought that just as there is inference from mere cognition even in the absence of a grammatical ending in abhutāṃ bhūtasya, similarly even in the destruction of quality, the notion two substances would arise from mere cognition of quality.

original: atha yadyapi guṇabuddhisamakālamapekṣābuddhivināśāt guṇasya vināśaḥ / tathāpi laiṅgikajñānavajjñānamātrād dve dravye itijñānaṃ bhaviṣyatīti paramatamāśaṅkate laiṅgikavajjñānamātrāditi cet matamabhipretaṃ syāt / yathā II / abhūtamavidyamānaṃ liṅgaṃ bhūtasya vidyamānasya liṅgino gamakamityatra sūtre liṅgābhāve 'pi jñānamātrādanumānamiṣṭam /
analyzed: atha yadi api guṇa buddhi sama kālam apekṣā buddhi vināśāt guṇasya vināśaḥ tathā api laiṅgika jñāna vat jñāna mātrāt dve dravye iti jñānam bhaviṣyati iti para matam āśaṅkate laiṅgika vat jñāna mātrāt iti ced matam abhipretam syāt yathā abhūtam avidyamānam liṅgam bhūtasya vidyamānasya liṅginaḥ gamakam iti atra sūtre liṅga abhāve pi jñāna mātrāt anumānam iṣṭam
translated: Now, even if the destruction of the quality occurs simultaneously with the cognition of the quality due to the destruction of the cognition of dependence, still, like inferential knowledge, the cognition that two substances exist will arise from mere knowledge. Suspecting the opponent's opinion, he says If it were intended that like an inference, knowledge alone is the cause, in the aphorism The non-existent mark is the indicator of the existent thing to be inferred, inference is accepted to occur from mere knowledge even in the absence of a mark.

original: tathā hi / jñānena jñānamanumīyata iti jñānasya liṅgatvādavaśyaṃ grahaṇam / tatastasya vinaśyattā / avinābhāvasambandhasmaraṇasyotpadyamānatā / tadanantaramavinābhāvasambandhasmaraṇasyotpādaḥ / liṅgabhūtasya jñānasya vināśaḥ / tajjñānasya vinaśyattā / parāmarśajñānasyotpadyamānatā / tataḥ parāmarśajñānasyotpādaḥ / avinābhāvasambandhasmaraṇasya vinaśyattā / liṅgajñānasyāpi vināśa iti nirviṣayāt parāmarśajñānamātrādeva jñātari pratipattirbhavatīti dṛṣṭam / tathā guṇavināśe guṇajñānamātrād dravyapratyayaḥ syāditi /
analyzed: tathā hi jñānena jñānam anumīyate iti jñānasya liṅga tvāt avaśyam grahaṇam tatas tasya vinaśyat tā avinābhāva sambandha smaraṇasya utpadyamāna tā tad anantaram avinābhāva sambandha smaraṇasya utpādaḥ liṅga bhūtasya jñānasya vināśaḥ tad jñānasya vinaśyat tā parāmarśa jñānasya utpadyamāna tā tatas parāmarśa jñānasya utpādaḥ avinābhāva sambandha smaraṇasya vinaśyat tā liṅga jñānasya api vināśaḥ iti nirviṣayāt parāmarśa jñāna mātrāt
translated: For thus: Knowledge is inferred from knowledge, so knowledge must be grasped because it is the inferential mark. Then there is the destruction of that [knowledge]. There is the arising of the recollection of the relation of invariable concomitance. Immediately after that, there is the production of the recollection of the relation of invariable concomitance. There is the destruction of the knowledge that is the inferential mark. There is the destruction of that knowledge. There is the arising of the knowledge of the conclusion. Then there is the production of the knowledge of the conclusion. There is the destruction of the recollection of the relation of invariable concomitance. There is also the destruction of the knowledge of the inferential mark. Thus, it is seen that the cognition of the cognizer occurs only from the mere knowledge of the conclusion, which has no object. Similarly, in the destruction of a quality, there would be cognition of the substance merely from the knowledge of the quality.

original: anye tu / yathā abhūtamavidyamānaṃ varṣakarma bhūtasya vidyamānasya vāyvabhrasaṃyogasya liṅgam / tathā guṇavināśe 'pi tajjñānamātrād dravyajñānamiti manyante / na caitad yuktam / tathā hi na avidyamānaṃ varṣakarma vidyamānasya vāyvabhrasaṃyogasya sadbhāve liṅgam / kiṃ tarhi / varṣakarmānutpādo vyabhicārī / sa ca svarūpeṇāstyeveti kathamavidyamānam / atha bhāvarūpatayā tasyāsattvam / tarhi bhāvasyāpyabhāvarūpeṇāsattvamiti sarvasyāsattvameva syāt / tasmād varṣakarmānutpādo vidyamāna eva liṅgamityudāharaṇāntarameva nyāyyam /
analyzed: anye tu yathā abhūtam avidyamānam varṣa karma bhūtasya vidyamānasya vāyu abhra saṃyogasya liṅgam tathā guṇa vināśe tad jñāna mātrāt dravya jñānam iti manyante na ca etat yuktam tathā hi na avidyamānam varṣa karma vidyamānasya vāyu abhra saṃyogasya sadbhāve liṅgam kim tarhi varṣa karma anutpādaḥ vyabhicārī sa ca sva rūpeṇa asti eva iti katham avidyamānam atha bhāva rūpatayā tasya asattvam tarhi bhāvasya api abhāva rūpeṇa asattvam iti sarvasya asattvam eva
translated: Others, however, think that just as the non-existent rain-action is the mark of the existent conjunction of wind and clouds, so also in the case of the destruction of a quality, the knowledge of the substance is from the mere knowledge of that [quality]. But this is not correct. For thus, the non-existent rain-action is not the mark of the existence of the existent conjunction of wind and clouds. What then? The non-production of rain-action is the deviating [mark]. And that exists in its own form. So how can it be non-existent? If it is non-existent in the form of an entity, then the entity also is non-existent in the form of a non-entity. Thus, everything would be non-existent. Therefore, the non-production of rain-action is the existent mark itself. Another example is proper.

original: na viśeṣyajñānatvāt / na hi viśeṣyajñānaṃ sārūpyād viśeṣaṇasambandhamantareṇa bhavitumarhati / tathāha sūtrakāraḥ samavāyinaḥ śvaityācchavaityabuddheḥ śvete buddhiste kāryakāraṇabhūte iti /PDhS
analyzed: na viśeṣya jñāna tvāt  na hi viśeṣya jñānam sārūpyāt viśeṣaṇa sambandham antareṇa bhavitum arhati tathā āha sūtrakāraḥ samavāyinaḥ śvaityāt śavaitya buddheḥ śvete buddhiḥ te kārya kāraṇa bhūte iti pdhs
translated: Not because it is the cognition of the qualified. For a cognition of the qualified cannot occur without the connection of the qualifier, due to similarity. Thus the author of the Nyāya Sūtra says: The cognition of whiteness is of the inhering whiteness, and the cognition of the white is of the two which are cause and effect.

original: pratisamādhānamāha yaduktaṃ laiṅgikajñānavat dve dravye itijñānaṃ bhaviṣyatītyetat na viśeṣyajñānatvāt tathā hi / dvitvānurāgeṇotpadyamānatvāt dve dravye itiviśeṣyajñānamato vidyamānasyaiva guṇasyātra vyāpāraḥ kalpanīyaḥ / tathā hi / yasmānna viśeṣyajñānaṃ viśeṣaṇasambandhamantareṇa viśeṣaṇasambandhaṃ vinā bhavitumarhati iti tadutpattau viśeṣaṇatajjñānatatsambandhānāṃ kāraṇatvam / anyathā hi sakalakāraṇānāṃ viśeṣyajñānotpattau viśeṣa /vyāpārāviśeṣeṇa niyatasyaiva viśeṣaṇatvaṃ na syāt / ato viśeṣaṇatajjñānatatsambandhānāṃ kāraṇatvam /
analyzed: pratisamādhānam āha yat uktam laiṅgika jñāna vat dve dravye iti jñānam bhaviṣyati iti etat na viśeṣya jñāna tvāt tathā hi dvi tva anurāgeṇa utpadyamāna tvāt dve dravye iti viśeṣya jñānam atas vidyamānasya eva guṇasya atra vyāpāraḥ kalpanīyaḥ tathā hi yasmāt na viśeṣya jñānam viśeṣaṇa sambandham antareṇa viśeṣaṇa sambandham vinā bhavitum arhati iti tad utpattau viśeṣaṇa tad jñāna tad sambandhānām kāraṇa tvam anyathā hi sakala kāraṇān
translated: He states the counter-argument: It has been said that there will be the cognition two substances like the cognition based on inference. This is not so, because it is a cognition of a qualified object. Thus, because it arises with the attachment to duality, it is a cognition of a qualified object two substances. Therefore, the operation of an already existing quality is to be imagined here. Thus, because a cognition of a qualified object cannot exist without the relation of the qualifier, without the relation of the qualifier, in its production, the qualifier, its cognition, and its relation are the causes. Otherwise, if all the causes were to have a specific operation in the production of the cognition of a qualified object, then only that which is determined by the specific operation would be the qualifier. Therefore, the qualifier, its cognition, and its relation are the causes.

original: tathā cāha sūtrakāraḥ samavāyinaḥ śvaityācchvaityabuddheḥ śvete buddhiste kāryakāraṇabhūte vai / sū / / / ityanena sūtrakārasyāpyayamartho 'bhipreta iti darśayati / tathā hi śvetaṃ dravyam tasya bhāvaḥ śvaityam / śvetaguṇastasmāt / kiṃ viśiṣṭāt / samavāyinaḥ samavāyena sambandhāt / śvaityabuddheriti śvetaguṇabuddheḥ / etasmāt kāraṇatrayāt śvetabuddhirviśeṣyajñānaṃ śvetaṃ dravyam utpadyate / te punarviśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabuddhī kāryakāraṇabhūte kāryakāraṇasvabhāve iti /
analyzed: tathā ca āha sūtrakāraḥ samavāyinaḥ śvaityāt śvaitya buddheḥ śvete buddhiḥ te kārya kāraṇa bhūte vai iti anena sūtrakārasya api ayam arthaḥ bhipretaḥ iti darśayati tathā hi śvetam dravyam tasya bhāvaḥ śvaityam śveta guṇaḥ tasmāt kim viśiṣṭāt samavāyinaḥ samavāyena sambandhāt śvaitya buddheḥ iti śveta guṇa buddheḥ etasmāt kāraṇa trayāt śveta buddhiḥ viśeṣya jñānam śvetam dravyam utpadyate te punar viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya buddhī kār
translated: And thus the author of the Nyāya Sūtra has said: The cognition of whiteness arises from whiteness, which inheres in the white substance, which is the cause of the cognition of whiteness, which is the effect of the cognition of whiteness, and which is related by inherence. This shows that this meaning is also intended by the author of the Nyāya Sūtra. For thus: The white substance, its existence is whiteness. The white quality arises from that. From what distinguished? From that which inheres, which is related by inherence. Of the cognition of whiteness, of the cognition of the white quality. From these three causes, the cognition of the white substance arises, which is the cognition of the qualified. And those two cognitions of the qualifier and the qualified are cause and effect, having the nature of cause and effect.

original: na tu laiṅgikaṃ jñānamabhedenotpadyata iti / tasmād viṣamo 'yamupanyāsaḥ /PDhS
analyzed: na tu laiṅgikam jñānam abhedena utpadyate iti tasmāt viṣamaḥ yam upanyāsaḥ
translated: But inferential cognition does not arise without distinction. Therefore this citation is inappropriate.

original: na ca laiṅgikaṃ jñānaṃ liṅgānuraktamiti liṅgābhāve 'pyutpadyata ityāha na tu laiṅgikaṃ jñānamabhedena liṅgānurāgeṇotpadyate / tasmād viṣamo 'yamupanyāsaḥ iti / yo 'yaṃ laiṅgikajñānavad dve dravye iti bhaviṣyatītyupanyāsaḥ sa viṣamaḥ samo na bhavatīti / tathā hi / viśeṣyajñāne viśeṣaṇānurāga iti / laiṅgike tu anurāgābhāva iti vaiṣamyam /
analyzed: na ca laiṅgikam jñānam liṅga anuraktam iti liṅga abhāve pi utpadyate iti āha na tu laiṅgikam jñānam abhedena liṅga anurāgeṇa utpadyate tasmāt viṣamaḥ yam upanyāsaḥ iti yaḥ yam laiṅgika jñāna vat dve dravye iti bhaviṣyati iti upanyāsaḥ sa viṣamaḥ samaḥ na bhavati iti tathā hi viśeṣya jñāne viśeṣaṇa anurāgaḥ iti laiṅgike tu anurāga abhāvaḥ iti vaiṣamyam
translated: And inferential knowledge is not produced by the attachment to the inferential mark, so it is produced even in the absence of the inferential mark. He says: But inferential knowledge is not produced by the attachment to the inferential mark in a non-distinct way. Therefore, this presentation is unequal. This presentation that it will be like the inferential knowledge, There are two substances, is unequal, it is not equal. For thus, in the knowledge of the qualified, there is attachment to the qualifier. But in the inferential, there is no attachment. This is the inequality.

original: yad vā viṣamo 'yamupanyāsaḥ / upanyasyate sādhyasādhanayorasmin vyāptirityupanyāsaḥ / laiṅgikavaditi dṛṣṭāntaḥ / sa ca viṣamaḥ / liṅgānurāgaśūnyatayā tasya aviśeṣyajñānatvāditi /
analyzed: yat vā viṣamaḥ yam upanyāsaḥ upanyasyate sādhya sādhanayoḥ asmin vyāptiḥ iti upanyāsaḥ laiṅgika vat iti dṛṣṭāntaḥ sa ca viṣamaḥ liṅga anurāga śūnyatayā tasya a viśeṣya jñāna tvāt iti
translated: Or, this presentation is unequal. In this, the pervasion of the probandum and the probans is presented, this is the presentation. And that is unequal. Because it is devoid of attachment to the inferential mark, it is not a qualified knowledge.

original: anye tu te viśeṣaṇatajjñāne kāryasya viśeṣyajñānasya kāraṇabhūte / tasmād guṇaṃ vinā na dravyajñānamiti manyante /
analyzed: anye tu te viśeṣaṇa tad jñāne kāryasya viśeṣya jñānasya kāraṇa bhūte tasmāt guṇam vinā na dravya jñānam iti manyante
translated: But others think that those are the cause of the effect, the knowledge of the qualified, which is the knowledge of the qualifier and the qualifier. Therefore, there is no knowledge of substance without a quality.

original: te ca viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabuddhī kāryakāraṇabhūte / na punaḥ sarvaṃ vijñānaṃ tathābhūtam / pramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: te ca viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya buddhī kārya kāraṇa bhūte na punar sarvam vijñānam tathābhūtam pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: And those cognitions of the qualifier and the qualified are in the relation of cause and effect. But not all cognition is of that nature, because there is no evidence for it.

original: etena saṅkalanājñānaṃ nirastam / viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyajñānavyatirekeṇa jñānāntare pramāṇābhāvādityalam /
analyzed: etena saṅkalanā jñānam nirastam viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya jñāna vyatirekeṇa jñāna antare pramāṇa abhāvāt iti alam
translated: By this, the cognition of combination is refuted. Because there is no evidence for a cognition other than the cognitions of the qualifier and the qualified, we have said enough.

original: na / āśūtpatteḥ / yathā śabdavadākāśamiti / atra trīṇi jñānānyāśūtpadyante tathā dvitvādijñānotpattāvityadoṣaḥ /PDhS
analyzed: na āśu utpatteḥ yathā śabdavat ākāśam iti atra trīṇi jñānāni āśu utpadyante tathā dvi tva ādi jñāna utpattau iti adoṣaḥ pdhs
translated: No, because of rapid occurrence. Just as in space is like sound, three cognitions arise rapidly there. Similarly, in the arising of the cognition of duality, etc., there is no fault.

original: nanu dvitvotpatteḥ prāk jñānadvayam / ekatvasāmānyajñānamapekṣājñānañca / utpanne tu dvitve tatsāmānyajñānam / guṇajñānam / dravyajñānañceti jñānapañcakaṃ yadi krameṇotpadyate sa kasmānnopalabhyate / anupalambhānnāstīti paraḥ / tanniII /ṣedhārthamāha na āśūtpatteḥ iti / yaduktaṃ kramasyāsattvamityetanna / āśubhāvitvena vidyamānasyāpi kramasyāsaṃvedanāt /
analyzed: nanu dvi tva utpatteḥ prāk jñāna dvayam eka tva sāmānya jñānam apekṣā jñānam ca utpanne tu dvi tve tad sāmānya jñānam guṇa jñānam dravya jñānam ca iti jñāna pañcakam yadi krameṇa utpadyate sa kasmāt na upalabhyate anupalambhāt na asti iti paraḥ na āśu utpatteḥ iti yat uktam kramasya asattvam iti etat na āśu bhāvi tvena vidyamānasya api kramasya asaṃvedanāt
translated: But before the arising of duality, there are two cognitions: the cognition of the universal oneness and the cognition of dependence. But when duality has arisen, there are five cognitions: the cognition of that universal, the cognition of the quality, and the cognition of the substance. If these arise in sequence, why are they not perceived? If they are not perceived, they do not exist, says the opponent. To refute that, he says No, because of rapid occurrence. What was said, that sequence does not exist, is not so. Because even though sequence exists due to rapid occurrence, it is not experienced.

original: atha āśūtpatteḥ kramasyāgrahaṇaṃ kasminnupalabdhamityāha yathā śabdavadākāśamiti ityatra śabdajñānamākāśajñānaṃ śabdākāśasambandhajñānañceti trīṇi jñānānyāśūtpadyante iti kramasyāgrahaṇam / tathā dvitvādijñānotpattau āśubhāvitvenaiva kramāgrahaṇamityadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: atha āśu utpatteḥ kramasya agrahaṇam kasmin upalabdham iti āha yathā śabdavat ākāśam iti iti atra śabda jñānam ākāśa jñānam śabda ākāśa sambandha jñānam ca iti trīṇi jñānāni āśu utpadyante iti kramasya agrahaṇam tathā dvi tva ādi jñāna utpattau āśu bhāvi tvena eva krama agrahaṇam iti adoṣaḥ
translated: Now, if the order is not grasped because of the quick arising, in what is it perceived? He says: Just as in the cognition of sound, space, etc. - here, three cognitions arise quickly: the cognition of sound, the cognition of space, and the cognition of the relation between sound and space. Thus, the order is not grasped. Similarly, in the arising of the cognition of duality, etc., the non-grasping of order is due to quick arising alone. So there is no fault.

original: na ca jñānānāṃ sahānavasthānalakṣaṇa eva virodhe jñānānāmāśubhāvitvenotpatteḥ / avinaṣṭe hi guṇe dravyajñānaṃ bhaviṣyatīti pratisamādhānametaditi vācyam / śīghraṃ kāraṇasadbhāvena kāryasyāpi tathābhāvāt / avaśyaṃ guṇabuddhisamakālaṃ guṇavināśe tadāyattasya dravyajñānasyānutpattiriti dūṣaṇasyāpyāvṛtteḥ / yadi jñānayoḥ sahāvirodhenāvasthānaṃ nāstīti sahānavasthānaṃ vivakṣitamavivāda eva /
analyzed: na ca jñānānām saha anavasthāna lakṣaṇaḥ eva virodhe jñānānām āśu bhāvi tvena utpatteḥ a vinaṣṭe hi guṇe dravya jñānam bhaviṣyati iti pratisamādhānam etat iti vācyam śīghram kāraṇa sadbhāvena kāryasya api tathābhāvāt avaśyam guṇa buddhi sama kālam guṇa vināśe tad āyattasya dravya jñānasya anutpattiḥ iti dūṣaṇasya api āvṛtteḥ  / yadi jñānayoḥ saha avirodhena avasthānam na asti iti saha anavasthānam vivakṣitam avivādaḥ eva
translated: And it should not be said that in the contradiction characterized by the non-coexistence of cognitions, the cognitions arise due to quick arising. For when the quality is not destroyed, the cognition of the substance will occur. This is the reply. Because the effect also has that nature due to the quick existence of the cause. When the destruction of the quality necessarily occurs simultaneously with the cognition of the quality, the non-arising of the cognition of the substance dependent on that is the fault that recurs. If it is intended that the non-coexistence is the non-coexistence of the two cognitions due to their not remaining together without contradiction, then there is no dispute.

original: vadhyaghātakapakṣe 'pi samāno doṣa iti cet / syānmatam / nanu vadhyaghātakapakṣe 'pi tarhi dravyajñānānutpattiprasaṅgaḥ / katham / dvitvasāmānyabuddhisamakālaṃ saṃskārādapekṣābuddhivināśāditi / na / samūhajñānasya saṃskārahetutvāt / samūhajñānameva saṃskārakāraṇaṃ nālocanajñānamitya doṣaḥ /PDhS
analyzed: vadhya ghātaka pakṣe samānaḥ doṣaḥ iti ced syāt matam nanu vadhya ghātaka pakṣe tarhi dravya jñāna anutpatti prasaṅgaḥ katham dvi tva sāmānya buddhi sama kālam saṃskārāt apekṣā buddhi vināśāt iti na samūha jñānasya saṃskāra hetu tvāt samūha jñānam eva saṃskāra kāraṇam doṣaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: If it is argued that the same fault applies to the side of the killer of the killed, it may be thought: But then, in that case, in the case of the killer of the killed also, there is the undesirable consequence of the non-arising of the knowledge of the substance. How? Because at the same time as the cognition of the universal of duality, the cognition of dependence is destroyed due to the impression. No, because the cognition of the aggregate is the cause of the impression. The cognition of the aggregate itself is the cause of the impression, not the cognition of reflection. There is no fault.

original: athedānīṃ sahānavasthānalakṣaṇavirodhād vadhyaghātakapakṣe 'pi samānaṃ dūṣaṇamiti paramatamāśaṅkamāna idamāha vadhyaghātakapakṣe 'pi samāno doṣa iti cet / syānmatam abhipretamiti saṅgrahavākyam / asya tu vivaraṇaṃ vadhyadhātakapakṣe 'pi tarhi dravyajñānānutpattiprasaṅgaḥ iti / tathā hi / yadi guṇabuddhisamakālaṃ guṇavināśe dravyajñānānutpattistarhi vadhyaghātakapakṣe 'pi tasyānutpattireva katham / sāmānyabuddhisamakālaṃ saṃskārādapekṣābuddhivināśāditi /
analyzed: atha idānīm saha anavasthāna lakṣaṇa virodhāt vadhya ghātaka pakṣe samānam dūṣaṇam iti para matam āśaṅkamānaḥ idam āha vadhya ghātaka pakṣe pi samānaḥ doṣaḥ iti ced syāt matam abhipretam iti saṅgraha vākyam asya tu vivaraṇam vadhya dhātaka pakṣe tarhi dravya jñāna anutpatti prasaṅgaḥ iti tathā hi yadi guṇa buddhi sama kālam guṇa vināśe dravya jñāna anutpattiḥ tarhi vadhya ghātaka pakṣe pi tasya anutpattiḥ eva katham sāmānya buddhi sama k
translated: Now, suspecting that the same fault would apply even in the case of the destroyed and destroyer, due to the contradiction of the characteristic of non-coexistence, he says this: If it is argued that the same fault applies even in the case of the destroyed and destroyer, it may be thought that the statement 'the intended' is a summary, but the explanation of this is 'then there would be the consequence of the non-arising of the knowledge of substance even in the case of the destroyed and destroyer.' This is because if, at the same time as the cognition of quality, there is the destruction of quality and the non-arising of the knowledge of substance, then how is it that there is the non-arising of that even in the case of the destroyed and destroyer? Because at the same time as the cognition of the universal, there is the destruction of the impression and the cognition of dependence.'

original: yathā hi / apekṣābuddhirdvitvaṃ janayati evaṃ saṃskāramapīti / tatastasyā vinaśyattā / dvitvasāmānyajñānasyotpadyamānatā / tato dvitvasāmānyajñānasyotpādaḥ / guṇajñānasyotpadyamānatā / apekṣābuddhervināśaḥ / guṇasya vinaśyattā / II / tato guṇajñānasyotpādaḥ / apekṣābuddhivināśād guṇasya vināśa iti tadapekṣatvād dravyajñānasyānutpattireva / na / samūhajñānasya saṃskārahetutvād iti pratisamādhānam / tathā hi / yaduktam / apekṣābuddheḥ saṃskārād vināśa iti / tanna / samūhajñānasya paṭvabhyāsādarapratyayasya saṃskārahetutvāditi /
analyzed: yathā hi apekṣā buddhiḥ dvi tvam janayati evam saṃskāram api iti  / tatas tasyāḥ vinaśyat tā dvi tva sāmānya jñānasya utpadyamāna tā tatas dvi tva sāmānya jñānasya utpādaḥ guṇa jñānasya utpadyamāna tā apekṣā buddheḥ vināśaḥ guṇasya vinaśyat tā tatas guṇa jñānasya utpādaḥ apekṣā buddhi vināśāt guṇasya vināśaḥ iti tad apekṣa tvāt dravya jñānasya anutpattiḥ eva na samūha jñānasya saṃskāra hetu tvāt iti pratisamādhānam tathā hi y
translated: For example, just as the relational cognition produces duality, so also it produces the impression. Then there is the destruction of that [relational cognition], the production of the cognition of the universal of duality, then the production of the cognition of the universal of duality, the production of the cognition of the quality, the destruction of the relational cognition, the destruction of the quality, then the production of the cognition of the quality, and the destruction of the quality due to the destruction of the relational cognition. Thus, due to its dependence, there is simply no production of the cognition of the substance. No, because the collective cognition is the cause of the impression, this is the reply. For it is said: From the impression of the relational cognition, there is destruction. That is not so. Because the collective cognition, which is a strong repetition and has the condition of respect, is the cause of the impression.

original: saṅgrahoktervivaraṇamāha samūhajñānameva saṃskārakāraṇam / na ālocanajñānam apekṣājñānamiti / tasmādadoṣaḥ / kimatra pramāṇamiti cet / smaraṇānutpattirdravyajñānotpattiśca / tathā hi / yatra smaraṇaṃ tatraiva saṃskārakalpanā kriyate / na cātra tadastīti / abhyupagame dravyajñānameva na syāt / tad dṛṣṭam / atastadanyathānupapattyā apekṣābuddheḥ saṃskārājanakatvaṃ niścīyate / prakārāntarābhāvāt /
analyzed: saṅgraha ukteḥ vivaraṇam āha samūha jñānam eva saṃskāra kāraṇam na ālocana jñānam apekṣā jñānam iti tasmāt adoṣaḥ kim atra pramāṇam iti ced smaraṇa anutpattiḥ dravya jñāna utpattiḥ ca tathā hi yatra smaraṇam tatra eva saṃskāra kalpanā kriyate na ca atra tat asti iti abhyupagame dravya jñānam eva na syāt tat dṛṣṭam atas tad anyathā anupapattyā apekṣā buddheḥ saṃskāra ajanaka tvam niścīyate prakāra antara abhāvāt
translated: He says that the explanation of the statement in the Saṅgraha is that the knowledge of the aggregate itself is the cause of the impression, not the knowledge of the object. Therefore there is no fault. If it is asked what is the proof here, it is the non-arising of memory and the arising of the knowledge of substance. For thus, where there is memory, the imagination of the impression is made, and it does not exist here. If it is accepted, there would be no knowledge of substance at all. That is seen. Therefore, by the impossibility of that, it is ascertained that the knowledge of the object does not produce the impression from the impression, because there is no other way.

original: jñānayaugapadyaprasaṅga iti cet / syānmatam / nanu jñānānāṃ vadhyaghātakavirodhe jñānayaugapadyaprasaṅga iti / na / avinaśyatoravasthānapratiṣedhāt / jñānāyaugapadyavacanena jñānayoryugapadutpattiravinaśyatośca yugapadavasthānaṃ pratiṣidhyate / na hi vadhyaghātakavirodhe jñānayoryugapadutpattiravinaśyatośca yugapadavasthānamastīti /PDhS
analyzed: jñāna yaugapadya prasaṅgaḥ iti ced syāt matam nanu jñānānām vadhya ghātaka virodhe jñāna yaugapadya prasaṅgaḥ iti na avinaśyatoḥ avasthāna pratiṣedhāt jñāna ayaugapadya vacanena jñānayoḥ yugapad utpattiḥ avinaśyatoḥ ca yugapad avasthānam pratiṣidhyate  / na hi vadhya ghātaka virodhe jñānayoḥ yugapad utpattiḥ avinaśyatoḥ ca yugapad avasthānam asti iti pdhs
translated: If it be said that there would be a simultaneity of cognitions, it may be said thus: Is it not that in the contradiction of cognitions as slayer and slain, there would be a simultaneity of cognitions? No, because the continued existence of the non-perishing is denied. By the statement of the non-simultaneity of cognitions, the simultaneous arising of two cognitions and the simultaneous continued existence of the non-perishing are denied. For in the contradiction of cognitions as slayer and slain, there is no simultaneous arising of two cognitions and simultaneous continued existence of the non-perishing.

original: athedānīṃ vadhyaghātakapakṣe 'pi parāśayamāśaṅkate jñānayaugapadyaprasaṅga iti cet syānmatam iti / saṅgrahoktervivaraṇam nanu jñānānāṃ vadhyaghātakavirodhe jñānayaugapadyaprasaṅga iti / tathā ca yadi jñānānāṃ vadhyaghātakalakṣaṇo virodhastadā ekasyāvasthāne dvitīyasyotpādājjñānayaugapadyaṃ prasajyata ityaniṣṭāpādanam /
analyzed: atha idānīm vadhya ghātaka pakṣe para āśayam āśaṅkate jñāna yaugapadya prasaṅgaḥ iti ced syāt matam iti saṅgraha ukteḥ vivaraṇam nanu jñānānām vadhya ghātaka virodhe jñāna yaugapadya prasaṅgaḥ iti tathā ca yadi jñānānām vadhya ghātaka lakṣaṇaḥ virodhaḥ tadā ekasya avasthāne dvitīyasya utpādāt jñāna yaugapadyam prasajyate iti aniṣṭa āpādanam
translated: Now, even in the case of slayer and slain, he raises a doubt: If it be said that there would be a simultaneity of cognitions, it may be said thus. This is an explanation of the summary statement: Is it not that in the contradiction of cognitions as slayer and slain, there would be a simultaneity of cognitions? And thus, if there is a contradiction characterized by slayer and slain between cognitions, then, due to the arising of a second one while one remains, there would be a simultaneity of cognitions. This is an undesirable consequence.

original: tannāniṣṭam / avinaśyatoravasthānapratiṣedhāt / tathā hi / jñānāyaugapadyavacanena prayatnāyaugapadyācca pratiśarīramekaṃ manaḥ vai / sū / / / iti sūtreṇa yugapadutpattiḥ / avinaśyatośca jñānayoḥ parasparāvirodhenāvasthānaṃ pratiṣidhyate / vadhyaghātakavirodhe tu ubhayamapi nāstītyāha na hi vadhyaghātakavirodhe jñānayoryugapadutpattiravinaśyatośca yugapadavasthānamastīti adūṣaṇametat /
analyzed: tat na aniṣṭam avinaśyatoḥ avasthāna pratiṣedhāt tathā hi jñāna ayaugapadya vacanena prayatna ayaugapadyāt ca pratiśarīram ekam manaḥ vai iti sūtreṇa yugapad utpattiḥ avinaśyatoḥ ca jñānayoḥ paraspara avirodhena avasthānam pratiṣidhyate vadhya ghātaka virodhe tu ubhayam api na asti iti āha na hi vadhya ghātaka virodhe jñānayoḥ yugapad utpattiḥ avinaśyatoḥ ca yugapad avasthānam asti iti adūṣaṇam etat
translated: That is not undesirable, because the existence of the non-perishing is denied. For thus, by the statement of the non-simultaneity of cognitions and by the non-simultaneity of efforts, the Sūtra says that there is one mind per body. The simultaneous arising is denied by the Sūtra. And the existence of the two cognitions that do not perish is denied without mutual contradiction. But in the case of the contradiction between the killed and the killer, both are absent. He says that in the case of the contradiction between the killed and the killer, there is no simultaneous arising of the two cognitions and no simultaneous existence of the two that do not perish. This is not a fault.

original: parimāṇavaidharmyam
analyzed: parimāṇa vaidharmyam
translated: The dissimilarity in magnitude

original: parimāṇaṃ mānavyavahārakāraṇam / taccaturvidham / aṇumahaddīrghaṃ hrasvañceti / tatra mahad dvividhaṃ nityamanityañca / nityamākāśakāladigātmasu paramamahattvam / anityaṃ tryaṇukādāveva / tathā ca aṇvapi dvividhaṃ nityamanityañca / nityaṃ paramāṇumanaḥsu / tattu pārimāṇḍalyam / anityaṃ dvyaṇuka eva /PDhS
analyzed: parimāṇam māna vyavahāra kāraṇam tat caturvidham aṇu mahat dīrgham hrasvam ca iti tatra mahat dvividham nityam anityam ca nityam ākāśa kāla diś ātmasu parama mahat tvam anityam tryaṇuka ādau eva tathā ca aṇu api dvividham nityam anityam ca nityam paramāṇu manaḥsu tat tu pārimāṇḍalyam anityam dvyaṇuke eva pdhs
translated: Dimension is the cause of the operation of measurement. And it is of four kinds: atomic, large, long, and short. Among them, largeness is of two kinds: eternal and non-eternal. The highest largeness in space, time, direction, and self is eternal. The non-eternal exists only in the triads and so on. And the atom is also of two kinds: eternal and non-eternal. The eternal exists only in atoms and mind. That is sphericity. The non-eternal exists only in the dyad.

original: idānīmuddeśakrameṇāvasaraprāptasya parimāṇasya lakṣaṇaparīkṣārthaṃ parimāṇaṃ mānavyavahārakāraṇam ityādi prakaraṇam / vyavahṛtirvyavahāro jñānam / vyavahriyate 'neneti vyavahāro 'bhidhānam tayorhetuḥ parimāṇamityukte 'tiprasaṅgastadarthaṃ mānapadam / tathāpi mānavyavahārahetutvamākāśātmanorvidyata iti viśeṣaṇatve satīti viśeṣaṇam / tathāpi parimāṇatvasāmānyena vyabhicāraparihārārthaṃ dravyaviśeṣaṇatve satīti viśeṣaṇamabhyūhyam / tathā hi / parimāṇam / itarasmād bhidyate / dravyaviśeṣaṇatve sati mānavyavahārakāraṇatvāt / yastu itarasmādaparimāṇānna bhidyate na cāsāvevam / yathā rūpādiriti / vyavahāro vā sādhyaḥ /
analyzed: idānīm uddeśa krameṇa avasara prāptasya parimāṇasya lakṣaṇa parīkṣā artham parimāṇam māna vyavahāra kāraṇam ityādi prakaraṇam vyavahṛtiḥ vyavahāraḥ jñānam vyavahriyate nena iti vyavahāraḥ bhidhānam tayoḥ hetuḥ parimāṇam iti ukte tiprasaṅgaḥ tad artham māna padam tathā api māna vyavahāra hetu tvam ākāśa ātmanoḥ vidyate iti viśeṣaṇa tve sati iti viśeṣaṇam tathā api parimāṇa tva sāmānyena vyabhicāra parihāra artham dravya viśeṣ
translated: Now, in order to define and examine Dimension, which has come up in the order of topics, the topic begins with Dimension is the cause of the operation of measurement. Operation is knowledge. It is said that Dimension is the cause of that, because it is by this that one operates, i.e., expresses oneself. Even when this is said, there is over-extension, therefore the word measurement is used. Even so, in order to exclude the sky and the self, which are the causes of the operation of measurement, the qualification when it exists is used. Even so, in order to exclude the fallacy of over-extension by the general property of Dimension, the qualification when it exists as a particular of substance should be inferred. Thus, Dimension is different from the other, because it is the cause of the operation of measurement when it exists as a particular of substance. But that which is not different from the other, which is not Dimension, is not so, like form etc. Or, the operation is to be proved.

original: tathā āvartyamānamidameva vākyamanekārthamiti parīkṣāparatvena sambadhyate / tathā hi / mānavyavahāro viśeṣyajñānatvād viśeṣaṇamapekṣate daṇḍyādijñānavat / na ca rūpādīnāmanyatamastadviśeṣaṇaṃ tadvyavahāravilakṣaṇatvāditi vilakṣaṇenaiva nimittena bhavitavyam / na cedaṃ kalpanājñānaṃ vāsanāprabhavam / tasyāḥ pūrvameva pratiṣedhāt /
analyzed: tathā āvartyamānam idam eva vākyam aneka artham iti parīkṣā paratvena sambadhyate tathā hi māna vyavahāraḥ viśeṣya jñāna tvāt viśeṣaṇam apekṣate daṇḍi ādi jñāna vat  na ca rūpa ādīnām anyatamaḥ tad viśeṣaṇam tad vyavahāra vilakṣaṇa tvāt iti vilakṣaṇena eva nimittena bhavitavyam na ca idam kalpanā jñānam vāsanā prabhavam tasyāḥ pūrvam eva pratiṣedhāt
translated: Similarly, this very sentence, when repeated, is connected with the meaning of examination, as having multiple meanings. For instance, the cognition of the object requires a qualifier, because it is the cognition of something qualified, like the cognition of one who is to be punished, etc. And none of color, etc. is its qualifier, because it is unlike the usage of that. So it must be by a qualifier that is different. And this conceptual cognition is not born from impressions, because that has already been refuted earlier.

original: taccaturvidham iti vibhāgaḥ / kena rūpeṇetyāha aṇumahaddīrghaṃ hrasvañceti /
analyzed: tat caturvidham iti vibhāgaḥ kena rūpeṇa iti āha aṇu mahat dīrgham hrasvat ca iti
translated: And that is fourfold - this is the division. By what form? He says: atom, large, long, and short.

original: nanu cāyuktaṃ cāturvidhyaṃ caturasrādibhedasyāpi sambhavāt / tanna / mahatvasyaiva avayavaracanāviśeṣopalambhasahakāriṇaḥ caturasrādivyavahārasampādakatvāt / tathā hi / avayavaracanāviśeṣopalambhe sati caturasraṃ tryasraṃ parimaṇḍalamiti vyavahāraḥ / tadabhāve ca neti na parimāṇāntarasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca ayuktam cāturvidhyam catur asra ādi bhedasya api sambhavāt tat na mahatvasya eva avayava racanā viśeṣa upalambha sahakāriṇaḥ catur asra ādi vyavahāra sampādaka tvāt tathā hi avayava racanā viśeṣa upalambhe sati catur asram tri asram parimaṇḍalam iti vyavahāraḥ tad abhāve ca na iti na parimāṇa antara siddhiḥ
translated: But it is not proper to have only four kinds, as there can be other kinds like square etc. That is not so. Only largeness, aided by the perception of a particular arrangement of parts, produces the notion of square etc. For thus: when there is perception of a particular arrangement of parts, there is the notion of square, triangular, or circular. And when that is absent, there is the notion of not so. Therefore, there is no establishment of another kind of dimension.

original: nanvevaṃ dīrghatvahrasvatvavyavahāro 'pyavayavasaṃyogaviśeṣopalambhādeva bhaviṣyatītyalaṃ dīrghatvahrasvatvaparikalpanayā / na / tadanupalabdhāvapi dīrghatvopalabdheḥ / tathā hi / mandamandaprakāśe satyantareṇāpyavayavaracanopalambhaṃ sthāṇvādau dīrghapratibhāso dṛṣṭaḥ / na caivaṃ caturasrapratibhāsa ityanvayavyatirekābhyāmityūhyam /
analyzed: nanu evam dīrgha tva hrasva tva vyavahāraḥ pi avayava saṃyoga viśeṣa upalambhāt eva bhaviṣyati iti alam dīrgha tva hrasva tva parikalpanayā na tad anupalabdhau api dīrgha tva upalabdheḥ tathā hi manda manda prakāśe sati antareṇa api avayava racanā upalambham sthāṇu ādau dīrgha pratibhāsaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ na ca evam catur asra pratibhāsaḥ iti anvaya vyatirekābhyām iti ūhyam
translated: But in that case, the notions of long and short will also occur just from the perception of a particular arrangement of parts, so there is no need to imagine long and short. No, because longness is perceived even when that is not perceived. For thus: when there is dim light, the appearance of longness is seen in a post etc. even without the perception of the arrangement of parts, but the appearance of squareness is not so. Therefore, it should be inferred from positive and negative concomitance.

original: tatra mahattvāṇutvayorapyavāntarabhedāt ṣaḍvidhamapi parimāṇamityāha mahad dvividhaṃ nityamanityañca iti / nityamākāśakāladigātmasu vartate / tacca paramamahattvam na tasmādūrdhvaṃ mahattvamastīti / anityaṃ tryaṇukādāveva iti / tryaṇukamādau yasya tattathoktam / tat tasminneva / tatra hi utpattikāraṇasadbhāvāt /
analyzed: tatra mahat tva aṇu tvayoḥ api avāntarabhedāt ṣaḍvidham api parimāṇam iti āha mahat dvividham nityam anityam ca iti nityam ākāśa kāla diś ātmasu vartate tat ca parama mahat tvam na tasmāt ūrdhvam mahat tvam asti iti anityam tryaṇuka ādau eva iti tryaṇukam ādau yasya tat tathā uktam tat tasmin eva tatra hi utpatti kāraṇa sadbhāvāt
translated: There, even magnitude and minuteness have subdivisions, so there are six kinds of dimension. He says: Greatness is of two kinds, eternal and non-eternal. The eternal exists in space, time, direction and self. And that is the highest magnitude. There is no magnitude higher than that. The non-eternal exists only in the triads and so on. That which has the triad as its beginning is said to be so. That exists only there, because the cause of origination is present there.

original: tathā na paraṃ mahad aṇvapi dvividhaṃ nityamanityañca / keṣvityāha paramāṇumanaḥsu paramāṇavaśca manaśceti paramāṇumanāṃsi teṣu vartate / pārimāṇḍalyam iti tasya nāma / tathā hi parimaṇḍalāni paramāṇumanāṃsi teṣāṃ bhāvaḥ pārimāṇḍalyam / tat parimāṇameva / tattu nityam / utpattivināśakāraṇānupalabdheḥ / tathā hi / paramāṇūnāṃ kāraṇāsambhavānna tatparimāṇakāraṇam anekatvasaṃkhyā pracayo vāstīti / etāvattu kāraṇaṃ parimāṇasya / na ca nityatvādaṇūnāṃ vināśaḥ sambhavatīti tatparimāṇasya nityatvameva / anityaṃ dvyaṇuka eva ityāśrayāntaravyudāsaḥ /
analyzed: tathā na param mahat aṇu api dvividham nityam anityam ca  / keṣu iti āha paramāṇu manaḥsu paramāṇavaḥ ca manaḥ ca iti paramāṇu manāṃsi teṣu vartate pārimāṇḍalyam iti tasya nāma tathā hi parimaṇḍalāni paramāṇu manāṃsi teṣām bhāvaḥ pārimāṇḍalyam tat parimāṇam eva tat tu nityam utpatti vināśa kāraṇa anupalabdheḥ tathā hi paramāṇūnām kāraṇa asambhavāt na tat parimāṇa kāraṇam aneka tva saṃkhyā pracayaḥ vā asti iti etāvat t
translated: Similarly, there is no other entity, not even an atom, that is twofold - permanent and impermanent. In which ones? He says: in atoms and minds. Atoms and minds are the atoms and minds. It exists in them. Its name is 'parimandala'. Thus, atoms and minds are circular. Their state is parimandala. That is just dimension. But that is permanent. Because the causes of origination and destruction are not perceived. Indeed, because atoms have no cause, that is not the cause of their dimension. There is no plurality, aggregation. This much is the cause of dimension. And because atoms are permanent, their destruction is not possible. Therefore, their dimension is permanent only. The impermanent one is in the dyad alone. This excludes other substrata.

original: kuvalayāmalakabilvādiṣu mahatsvapi tatprakarṣabhāvābhāvamapekṣya bhākto 'ṇutvavyavahāraḥ / dīrghatvahrasvatve ca utpādyamahadaṇutvaikārthasamavete / samidikṣuvaṃśādiṣvañjasā dīrgheṣvapi tatprakarṣabhāvābhāvamapekṣya bhākto hrasvatvavyavahāraḥ /PDhS
analyzed: kuvalaya āmalaka bilva ādiṣu mahatsu api tad prakarṣa bhāva abhāvam apekṣya bhāktaḥ ṇu tva vyavahāraḥ dīrgha tva hrasva tve ca utpādya mahat aṇu tva ekārtha samavete samidh ikṣu vaṃśa ādiṣu añjasā dīrgheṣu api tad prakarṣa bhāva abhāvam apekṣya bhāktaḥ hrasva tva vyavahāraḥ
translated: Even in large things like the kuvala, amalaka, bilva, etc., the usage of smallness is figurative, depending on the absence or presence of the highest degree of that. And length and shortness are in the same substratum as the produced largeness and smallness. Even in long things like the sacrificial wood, sugarcane stalk, etc., the usage of shortness is figurative, depending on the absence or presence of the highest degree of that.

original: nanu cāyuktametad / anyatrāpyaṇuvyavahāropalabdheḥ / na / tatra mukhyāsambhavena upacārābhyupagamāt ityāha kuvalayāmalakabilvādiṣu mahatsvapi tatprakarṣabhāvābhāvamapekṣya parimāṇātiśayaḥ / kuvalayādyapekṣayā tasmād vā prakarṣaḥ / tasya bhāvo vidyamānatā bilvādau / tadabhāvamapekṣyāmalake 'ṇuvyavahāraḥ / tathā tatprakarṣaḥ kuvalayāpekṣayā parimāṇātiśayaḥ / tasya bhāvo vidyamānatā II / āmalake / tadabhāvamapekṣya kuvalaye 'ṇuvyavahāraḥ / yatra hi vāstavamaṇutvaṃ tatra parimāṇātiśayasyābhāvo draṣṭavyaḥ / tasyānyatrāpyupalambhād upacāraḥ pravartata eva /
analyzed: nanu ca ayuktam etat anyatra api aṇu vyavahāra upalabdheḥ na tatra mukhya asambhavena upacāra abhyupagamāt iti āha kuvalaya āmalaka bilva ādiṣu mahatsu api tad prakarṣa bhāva abhāvam apekṣya parimāṇa atiśayaḥ kuvalaya ādi apekṣayā tasmāt vā prakarṣaḥ tasya bhāvaḥ vidyamāna tā bilva ādau tad abhāvam apekṣya āmalake ṇu vyavahāraḥ tathā tad prakarṣaḥ kuvalaya apekṣayā parimāṇa atiśayaḥ tasya bhāvaḥ vidyamāna tā āmalake tad abhāvam apekṣya
translated: But this is improper, because the usage of atom is observed elsewhere too. No, because in that case, due to the impossibility of the primary meaning, figurative usage is accepted. He says: Even in large things like the lily, the myrobalan fruit, and the wood-apple, the excess of dimension is in relation to the presence or absence of the highest degree of that. The highest degree is in relation to the lily, etc., or from that. The presence of that is its existence in the wood-apple. In relation to the absence of that, there is the usage of atom in the myrobalan fruit. Similarly, the excess of dimension in relation to the lily is the highest degree. The presence of that is its existence in the myrobalan fruit. In relation to the absence of that, there is the usage of atom in the lily. Where there is real atomicity, there the absence of the excess of dimension should be seen. Because that is observed elsewhere too, figurative usage certainly occurs.

original: yad vā mukhyāsadbhāve kiṃ pramāṇamityāha bhākto 'ṇuvyavahāraḥ / yathā hi māṇavake siṃhavyavahāro mukhyāpekṣaḥ / tadvadayamaṇuvyavahāro 'pyupacaritatvānmukhyapūrva ityaṇutvasiddhiḥ / tathā ca kuvalayādiṣu aṇuvyavahāro mukhyapūrvako bhāktavyavahāratvāt / māṇavake siṃhavyavahāravat /
analyzed: yat vā mukhya asadbhāve kim pramāṇam iti āha bhāktaḥ ṇu vyavahāraḥ yathā hi māṇavake siṃha vyavahāraḥ mukhya apekṣaḥ tadvat ayam aṇu vyavahāraḥ upi upacarita tvāt mukhya pūrvaḥ iti aṇu tva siddhiḥ tathā ca kuvalaya ādiṣu aṇu vyavahāraḥ mukhya pūrvakaḥ bhākta vyavahāra tvāt māṇavake siṃha vyavahāra vat
translated: Or, what is the evidence for the absence of the primary meaning? He says: The usage of atom is figurative, just as the usage of lion in a young boy is dependent on the primary meaning. Similarly, this usage of atom is also figurative and preceded by the primary meaning. Thus atomicity is established. And thus, the usage of atom in a jasmine flower etc. is preceded by the primary meaning, because it is figurative usage, like the usage of lion in a young boy.

original: yathā ca mahattvāṇutvayornityānityabhedo naivaṃ dīrghatvahrasvatvayoḥ / āśrayāntarānupapatteḥ / kva vā tayorvṛttirityāśaṅkāyāmāha dīrghatvahrasvatve ca dīrghatvañca hrasvatvañceti dīrghatvahrasvatve / te tu utpādyamahadaṇutvaikārthasamavete utpādye ca te mahadaṇutve ca utpādyamahadaṇutve / tābhyāṃ sahaikasminnarthe samavete / tathā hi / tryaṇukādāvutpādyaṃ mahattvaṃ tatraiva dīrghatvam / dvyaṇuke cāṇutvaṃ tatraiva hrasvatvamiti / paramāṇūnāṃ parimaṇḍalatvāna hrasvatvam / ākāśādervyāpakatvācca na dīrghatvam / tadviparīteṣu tadvyavahāradarśanāt /
analyzed: yathā ca mahat tva aṇu tvayoḥ nitya anitya bhedaḥ na evam dīrgha tva hrasva tvayoḥ āśraya antara anupapatteḥ kva vā tayoḥ vṛttiḥ iti āśaṅkāyām āha dīrgha tva hrasva tve ca dīrgha tvam ca hrasva tvam ca iti dīrgha tva hrasva tve te tu utpādya mahat aṇu tva eka artha samavete utpādye ca te mahat aṇu tve ca utpādya mahat aṇu tve tābhyām saha ekasmin arthe samavete tathā hi tryaṇuka ādau utpādyam mahat tvam tatra eva dīrgha tvam dvyaṇuke ca aṇu tvam tatra eva
translated: And just as there is no difference between eternality and non-eternality of largeness and minuteness, so also there is no such difference between length and shortness. Because there is no other substratum. Where then is their existence? To remove this doubt, he says: Length and shortness are in what is produced, large and small, and in what is produced, large and small. They are in what is produced, large and small, and are co-existent in one object. For instance, in the tripartite atom, there is the produced largeness, and in the same place, length. In the dyad, there is minuteness, and in the same place, shortness. In atoms, there is no shortness because of their circularity. In space, etc., there is no length because of their all-pervasiveness. Because the usage is seen in what is opposite to that.

original: atha dvyaṇukeṣveva kathaṃ hrasvatvamityuktamanyatrāpi tadvyavahāropalabdheḥ / tanna / bādhakasadbhāvena anyatropacārābhyupagamādityāha samidikṣuvaṃśādiṣvañjasā dīrgheṣvapi tatprakarṣabhāvābhāvamapekṣya bhākto hrasvatvavyavahāraḥ iti / tathā hi / samidādiṣu dīrghatvotpattau kāraṇasadbhāvādañjasā mukhyayā vṛttyā dīrghatvam / dīrdheṣvapi hrasvatvavyavahāro dṛṣṭa iti mukhyāsambhavāt upacāraḥ kalpyate / tatra ca tatprakarṣabhāvābhāvo nimittam / tasya vaṃśādeḥ prakarṣaḥ samidādyapekṣayā dīrghatvātiśayaḥ / tasya bhāvo vidyamānatā vaṃśādau / tadabhāvamapekṣya ikṣau hrasvatvavyavahāraḥ / samidhamapekṣya ikṣau dīrghatvātiśayaḥ / tatra tadabhāvamapekṣya samidhi hrasvavyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: atha dvyaṇukeṣu eva katham hrasva tvam iti uktam anyatra api tad vyavahāra upalabdheḥ tat na bādhaka sadbhāvena anyatra upacāra abhyupagamāt iti āha samidh ikṣu vaṃśa ādiṣu añjasā dīrgheṣu api tad prakarṣa bhāva abhāvam apekṣya bhāktaḥ hrasva tva vyavahāraḥ iti tathā hi samidh ādiṣu dīrgha tva utpattau kāraṇa sadbhāvāt añjasā mukhyayā vṛttyā dīrgha tvam  /   api hrasva tva vyavahāraḥ dṛṣṭaḥ iti mukhya asambhavāt upacāraḥ kalpyate tatra ca
translated: Now, how is shortness in the binary atoms? It is said that the usage is observed elsewhere too. That is not so. Because of the presence of contradiction, the figurative usage is accepted elsewhere. He says: In the case of the sacrificial altar, sugarcane, bamboo, etc., which are long, the figurative usage of shortness is based on the absence or presence of the highest degree of length. Thus, in the case of the sacrificial altar, etc., the length arises due to the presence of the cause, so the length is primary and principal. The usage of shortness is seen even in the long ones. Since the primary is not possible, the figurative usage is imagined. And there, the absence or presence of the highest degree is the reason. The highest degree of that bamboo, etc., is the excess of length in comparison to the sacrificial altar, etc. The presence of that is the existence in the bamboo, etc. In comparison to that absence, there is the usage of shortness in the sugarcane. In comparison to the sacrificial altar, there is the excess of length in the sugarcane. There, in comparison to that absence, there is the usage of shortness in the sacrificial altar.

original: yadvā mukhyahrasvatvasya sadbhāve kiṃ pramāṇam / upacarito hrasvavyavahāraḥ / tathā hi / samidādiṣu hrasvavyavahāraḥ / mukhyapūrvakaḥ / bhāktavyavahāratvāt / māṇavake siṃhavyavahāravaditi /
analyzed: yat vā mukhya hrasva tvasya sadbhāve kim pramāṇam upacaritaḥ hrasva vyavahāraḥ tathā hi samidh ādiṣu hrasva vyavahāraḥ mukhya pūrvakaḥ bhākta vyavahāra tvāt māṇavake siṃha vyavahāra vat iti
translated: Or, what is the evidence for the existence of primary shortness? The usage of shortness is figurative. Thus, the usage of shortness in samid etc. is preceded by the primary, because it is a figurative usage, like the usage of lion in a boy.

original: parimāṇotpattiprakāraḥ
translated: The mode of origination of magnitude

original: anityaṃ caturvidhamapi saṃkhyāparimāṇapracayayoni /PDhS
analyzed: anityam caturvidham api saṃkhyā parimāṇa pracaya yoni
translated: The non-eternal is of four kinds, having number, magnitude, and aggregation as its source.

original: evaṃ cāturvidhyamuktvotpattikāraṇamāha anityaṃ caturvidhamapi saṃkhyāparimāṇapracayayoni iti / saṃkhyā ca parimāṇañca pracayaśceti saṃkhyāparimāṇapracayāḥ / te yoniḥ kāraṇamasyeti / saṃkhyāparimāṇapracayaiḥ samastavyastairjanyata iti vākyārthaḥ / tathā ca sūtram kāraṇabahutvāt kāraṇamahattvāt pracayaviśeṣācca mahaditi vai / sū / / / / anityagrahaṇam nityavyudāsārtham / caturvidhamiti nyūnatāvyavacchedaḥ /
analyzed: evam cāturvidhyam uktvā utpatti kāraṇam āha anityam caturvidham api saṃkhyā parimāṇa pracaya yoni iti saṃkhyā ca parimāṇam ca pracayaḥ ca iti saṃkhyā parimāṇa pracayāḥ te yoniḥ kāraṇam asya iti saṃkhyā parimāṇa pracayaiḥ samasta vyastaiḥ janyate iti vākya arthaḥ tathā ca sūtram kāraṇa bahu tvāt kāraṇa mahat tvāt pracaya viśeṣāt ca mahat iti vai sū      anitya grahaṇam nitya vyudāsa artham caturvidham iti nyūna tā vyavacchedaḥ
translated: Having thus stated the fourfold nature, he states the cause of origination: The non-eternal is of four kinds, having number, magnitude, and aggregation as its source. Number and magnitude and aggregation are the number, magnitude, and aggregation. That is the source, the cause, of this. The meaning of the sentence is that it is produced by number, magnitude, and aggregation, collectively and individually. And thus the aphorism: Because of the plurality of causes, because of the greatness of the cause, and because of the special aggregation, it is great. Thus, the Vaiseṣikas say. The word non-eternal is for the exclusion of the eternal. Of four kinds excludes deficiency.

original: tatreśvarabuddhimapekṣyotpannā paramāṇudvyaṇukeṣu bahutvasaṃkhyā tairārabdhe tryaṇukādilakṣaṇe kāryadravye rūpādyutpattisamakālaṃ mahattvaṃ dīrghatvañca karoti /PDhS
analyzed: tatra īśvara buddhim apekṣya utpannā paramāṇu dvyaṇukeṣu bahu tva saṃkhyā taiḥ ārabdhe tryaṇuka ādi lakṣaṇe kārya dravye rūpa ādi utpatti sama kālam mahat tvam dīrgha tvam ca karoti
translated: There, the number of plurality, produced in dependence on the intellect of God, in atoms and dyads, produces in the effect substance characterized by triads etc., produced by them, at the time of the origin of color etc., the qualities of largeness and length.

original: sūtrārthaprakramasya vivakṣitvād uddeśāakramātikrameṇa mahattvotpattau kāraṇamāha tatreśvarabuddhimapekṣyotpannā paramāṇudvyaṇukeṣu bahutvasaṃkhyā tairārabdhe tryaṇukādilakṣaṇe kāryadravye rūpādyutpattisamakālaṃ mahattvaṃ dīrghatvañca karoti / tathā ceśvarabuddhirnityā sakalārthaviṣayā ceti ekaikaguṇālambanāstyeva / tāmapekṣyakaikaguṇaiḥ paramāṇudvyaṇukeṣu tritvamārabhyate / paramāṇudvyaṇukeṣviti dvyaṇukavyavacchedārtham / paramāṇubhyāmeva dvyaṇukamārabhyate / na dvyaṇukābhyām / vyarthārambhaprasaṅgādityuktam / ataḥ paramāṇudvyaṇukārabdhe kāryadravya iti / tairārabdhaṃ rūpādyapi bhavatīti tanniṣedhārthaṃ dravyagrahaṇam / dravyapadañca dravyatve 'pi vartata ityabhivyaktivivakṣayā tadapyārabdhamiti kāryagrahaṇam / tryaṇukādilakṣaṇa iti / tryaṇukañca tadādilakṣaṇaṃ kāraṇakāryasvarūpañceti / yad vā sarvamahaddravyāṇāmādau lakṣyata ityādilakṣaṇam / tasminnutpanne rūpādyutpattisamakālaṃ dvyaṇukeṣu vartamānaṃ tritvaṃ mahattvaṃ dīrghatvañca karotīti /
analyzed: sūtra artha prakramasya vivakṣi tvāt uddeśa a akrama atikrameṇa mahat tva utpattau kāraṇam āha tatra īśvara buddhim apekṣya utpannā paramāṇu dvyaṇukeṣu bahu tva saṃkhyā taiḥ ārabdhe tryaṇuka ādi lakṣaṇe kārya dravye rūpa ādi utpatti sama kālam mahat tvam dīrgha tvam ca karoti tathā ca īśvara buddhiḥ nityā sakala artha viṣayā ca iti ekaika guṇa ālambanā asti eva tām apekṣya kaika guṇaiḥ paramāṇu dvyaṇukeṣu tritvam ārabhyate paramāṇu dvy
translated: Since the order of the meaning of the Sutra is intended, he states the reason for the origin of greatness in excess of the order of enunciation, saying: There, greatness and length are produced simultaneously with the origin of color etc. in the effect substance characterized by triads etc. produced by those, in the number of plurality produced in atoms and dyads in dependence on the intellect of God. And thus the intellect of God is eternal and has all objects as its content, so it is indeed the basis of each quality. Beginning with three in dependence on that, the number of plurality is produced in atoms and dyads. The words in atoms and dyads are for the purpose of excluding dyads. A dyad is produced from two atoms only, not from two dyads. Because of the contingence of useless production, it has been said. Therefore, in the effect substance produced by those means in the effect substance produced by atoms and dyads. Color etc. is also produced by them, so the word substance is used to negate that. And the word substance also occurs in substantiality, so that is also produced by manifestation, by the desire to manifest.

original: tathā hi / kāryavastuno 'samavāyikāraṇapūrvakatvaṃ dṛṣṭamiti tryaṇukasya samavāyikāraṇatvād anyenāsamavāyikāraṇena bhavitavyam / dvyaṇukeṣu ca mahattvasyābhāvānna kāraṇaguṇapūrvakatvam / athāṇuparimāṇādeva tryaṇuke mahattvam / kāraṇaparimāṇāt kāryapariṇāmasyātiśayopalabdheḥ / tathā ca paṭāpekṣayā II / sūkṣmāstantavastadapekṣayā tadaṃśava iti dṛṣṭam / evaṃ dvyaṇukāpekṣayā atiśayaparimāṇasambandhi tryaṇukaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: tathā hi kārya vastunaḥ samavāyi kāraṇa pūrvaka tvam dṛṣṭam iti tryaṇukasya samavāyi kāraṇa tvāt anyena asamavāyi kāraṇena bhavitavyam dvyaṇukeṣu ca mahat tvasya abhāvāt na kāraṇa guṇa pūrvaka tvam atha aṇu parimāṇāt eva tryaṇuke mahat tvam kāraṇa parimāṇāt kārya pariṇāmasya atiśaya upalabdheḥ tathā ca paṭa apekṣayā sūkṣmāḥ tantavaḥ tad apekṣayā tad aṃśavaḥ iti dṛṣṭam evam dvyaṇuka apekṣayā atiśaya parimāṇa sam
translated: For thus, the fact that an effect is preceded by an inherence cause is seen. Therefore, since the triadic atom is the inherence cause, there must be another non-inherence cause. And since there is no largeness in the dyadic atoms, it is not preceded by the quality of the cause. Now, if largeness in the triadic atom is due to atomic dimension itself, then the transformation of the effect is due to the dimension of the cause, as it is observed to be superior. And thus, the threads are seen to be subtler in relation to the cloth, and their parts are subtler in relation to that. In the same way, the triadic atom will be related to superior dimension in relation to the dyadic atom.

original: tadasat / yacchabdavācyaṃ kāraṇaparimāṇaṃ tacchabdavācyaṃ kārye 'pīti tryaṇuke dvyaṇukaparimāṇameva syāt / yathā mahacchabdavācyāt tantugaṇād utpadyamānaḥ paṭastacchabdavācya iti / evamaṇuparimāṇādaṇuparimāṇameva syāt / paramāṇuparimāṇācca dvyaṇuke 'pi parimāṇamiti kalpanāyāmaṇutvasyāsambhave kathaṃ tasmānmahattvamiti / na cāṇutvasyāsambhave paramāṇuriti yuktam / tathā cāṇoratiśayenāṇuḥ paramāṇuriti vyapadiśyate / anyathā hi viśeṣaṇamanarthakameva syād vyavacchedyābhāvāt / mahattvañcāpekṣyāṇuvyavahāraḥ / na ca paramāṇuriti / na ca mahattvam aṇuparimāṇasya kāraṇatvābhyupagame / tasmādaṇvabhāve paramāṇuvyavahārocchedaprasaṅgāt na paramāṇuparimāṇaṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: tat asat yat śabda vācyam kāraṇa parimāṇam tat śabda vācyam kārye pi iti tryaṇuke dvi aṇuka parimāṇam eva syāt yathā mahat śabda vācyāt tantu gaṇāt utpadyamānaḥ paṭaḥ tad śabda vācyaḥ iti evam aṇu parimāṇāt aṇu parimāṇam eva syāt paramāṇu parimāṇāt ca dvyaṇuke pi parimāṇam iti kalpanāyām aṇu tvasya asambhave katham tasmāt mahā tvam iti na ca aṇu tvasya asambhave paramāṇuḥ iti yuktam tathā ca aṇoḥ atiśayena aṇuḥ paramāṇu
translated: That is not so. The dimension of the cause, denoted by the word 'that', would be the same in the effect also. So the dimension of the dyad would be the same as that of the triad. Just as a cloth produced from a collection of threads denoted by the word 'large' is denoted by the same word. Similarly, the dimension of the atom would be the same as that of the dyad. And if it is supposed that the dimension in the dyad is due to the dimension of the atom, then how can largeness result from smallness when smallness is impossible? And if smallness is impossible, it is not proper to call it an atom. And thus it is designated as an atom, smaller than an atom, by the excess of smallness. Otherwise, the qualification would be meaningless, as there would be nothing to be excluded. And largeness is the basis for the usage of 'small'. And it is not an atom. And largeness is not the cause of small dimension, if it is accepted as the cause. Therefore, because of the undesirable consequence of the cessation of the usage of atom if there is no atom, the dimension of the atom is not the cause.

original: itaśca paramāṇuparimāṇasyāṇutvotpattāvaṇutvasya mahattvotpattāvasamavāyikāraṇatvamayuktam / atyantasamānajātīyasyāsamavāyikāraṇatvopalabdheḥ / tathā cātyantaṃ samānajātīyamasamavāyikāraṇaṃ yathā śuklatamād rūpācchuklatamameva rūpam / atyantavijātīyañca yathā saṃyogācchabda iti / na caivamaṇuparimāṇaṃ mahattvotpattau / paramāṇuparimāṇaścāṇutvotpattāviti / tasyāpi parimāṇatvānnātyantaṃ vijātīyatvam / paramāṇutvañcāṇutvasyaiva viśeṣo 'ṇutvañca mahattvājjātyantarameveti nātyantasamānajātīyatvam /
analyzed: itas ca paramāṇu parimāṇasya aṇu tva utpattau aṇu tvasya mahā tva utpattau asamavāyi kāraṇa tvam ayuktam atyanta samāna jātīyasya asamavāyi kāraṇa tva upalabdheḥ tathā ca atyantam samāna jātīyam asamavāyi kāraṇam yathā śuklatamāt rūpāt śuklatamam eva rūpam atyanta vijātīyam ca yathā saṃyogāt śabdaḥ iti na ca evam aṇu parimāṇam mahat tva utpattau paramāṇu parimāṇaḥ ca aṇu tva utpattau iti tasya api parimāṇa tvāt na atyantam vijātīya tvam p
translated: And for this reason also, the atomicity of atoms cannot be the inherent cause of the production of largeness, because an inherent cause is found to be of a totally similar kind; and in that case, the inherent cause would be of a totally similar kind, just as a colour of the highest degree of whiteness produces a colour of the highest degree of whiteness; and it is of a totally dissimilar kind, just as conjunction produces sound. And atomicity is not so in the production of largeness, nor is the atomicity of atoms in the production of atomicity. Because it is a kind of dimension, it is not of a totally dissimilar kind. And atomicity is a particular kind of atomicity, and atomicity is a different kind from largeness, so it is not of a totally similar kind.

original: na cātra pracayaḥ sambhavati / rūpādīnāṃ svakārye sāmarthyāvadhāraṇāt / ataḥ saṃkhyaivāsamavāyikāraṇamiti kalpyate / pratyāsattirmahatī / tathā ca mahattvaṃ dīrghatvañca tryaṇuke vartate tryaṇukaśca dvyaṇukeṣu / tritvamapi teṣveveti kāryakāraṇaikārthasamavāyalakṣaṇā pratyāsattiriti /
analyzed: na ca atra pracayaḥ sambhavati rūpa ādīnām sva kārye sāmarthya avadhāraṇāt atas saṃkhyā eva asamavāyi kāraṇam iti kalpyate pratyāsattiḥ mahatī tathā ca mahā tvam dīrgha tvam ca tryaṇuke vartate tryaṇukaḥ ca dvyaṇukeṣu tri tvam api teṣu eva iti kārya kāraṇa eka artha samavāya lakṣaṇā pratyāsattiḥ iti
translated: And here aggregation is not possible, because the capability of form etc. in their own effects is determined. Therefore, number alone is postulated as the non-inherent cause. Proximity is great. And thus, largeness and length exist in the tripartite, and the tripartite in the bipartite atoms. And the number three also exists in them. Thus, proximity is characterized by the inherence of the effect, cause, and the same object.

original: nanvevamīśvarabuddhernityatvād dvyaṇukānāñca kālāntaramavasthānād avasthāyitvameva / saṃkhyāyā nityadravyasamavetāyāśca nityatvamiti / naiṣa doṣaḥ / saṃkhyāyāḥ kāryatvādavaśyaṃ vināśitvamiti / nirhetukavināśapratiṣedhenāsyā vināśahetorabhāvāt sthitihetvadṛṣṭābhāvād vināśaḥ kalpyate /
analyzed: nanu evam īśvara buddheḥ nitya tvāt dvyaṇukānām ca kāla antaram avasthānāt avasthāyi tvam eva saṃkhyāyāḥ nitya dravya samavetāyāḥ ca nitya tvam iti  na eṣa doṣaḥ saṃkhyāyāḥ kārya tvāt avaśyam vināśi tvam iti nirhetuka vināśa pratiṣedhena asyāḥ vināśa hetoḥ abhāvāt sthiti hetu adṛṣṭa abhāvāt vināśaḥ kalpyate
translated: If so, then the eternality of the number inhering in eternal substances follows from the eternality of the cognition of God and the temporal existence of the bipartite atoms. This is not a fault. The number must necessarily be destructible because it is an effect. Its destruction is postulated due to the absence of a cause of destruction, by negating destruction without a cause, and due to the absence of an observed cause of persistence.

original: yadvā īśvaraśabdo yogīśvare vartata iti tadbuddheranityatvāt tadvināśo ghaṭata eva saṃkhyāyāḥ /
analyzed: yat vā īśvara śabdaḥ yogi īśvare vartate iti tad buddheḥ anitya tvāt tad vināśaḥ ghaṭate eva saṃkhyāyāḥ
translated: Or, the word God refers to a yogic lord. Since his cognition is non-eternal, the destruction of the number is possible.

original: tathā hi / dvyaṇuke kriyotpannā / yadaiva vibhāgamārabhate / saṃyogasya vinaśyattā / tadaivaikatvasāmānye jñānamutpadyate / apekṣābuddherutpadyamānatā / tataḥ saṃyogasya vināśaḥ / uttarasaṃyogasyotpadyamānatā / apekṣābuddherutpādaḥ / tritvasyotpadyamānatā / tato dvyaṇukasya dvyaṇukābhyāṃ saṃyogasyotpādaḥ / tryaṇukasyotpadyamānatā / vibhāgakarmaṇorvinaśyattā / tritvasyotpādaḥ / tatsāmānyajñānasyotpadyamānatā / tatastryaṇukasyotpādaḥ / vibhāgakarmaṇorvināśaḥ / tritvasāmānyajñānasyotpādaḥ / mahattvadīrghatvayorutpadyamānatā / apekṣābuddhervinaśyattā / tritvaguṇabuddherutpadyamānatā / tato mahattvadīrghatvayorutpādaḥ / apekṣābuddhervināśaḥ / tritvaguṇasya vinaśyattā / tritvaguṇabuddherutpādaḥ / dravyajñānasyotpadyamānatā / tato dravyajñānasamakālaṃ tritvasyāpi vināśa iti /
analyzed: tathā hi dvyaṇuke kriyā utpannā yadā eva vibhāgam ārabhate saṃyogasya vinaśyat tā tadā eva eka tva sāmānye jñānam utpadyate apekṣā buddheḥ utpadyamāna tā tatas saṃyogasya vināśaḥ uttara saṃyogasya utpadyamāna tā apekṣā buddheḥ utpādaḥ tritvasya utpadyamāna tā tatas dvyaṇukasya dvyaṇukābhyām saṃyogasya utpādaḥ tryaṇukasya utpadyamāna tā vibhāga karmaṇoḥ vinaśyat tā tritvasya utpādaḥ tad sāmānya jñānasya utpadyamāna tā tatas tryaṇuk
translated: For instance, when the action arises in the dyad, it begins the disjunction, and at the same time the conjunction is destroyed, and the cognition of the universal of oneness arises, and the cognition of dependence is in the process of arising. Then the conjunction is destroyed, and the subsequent conjunction is in the process of arising, and the cognition of dependence arises, and the triad is in the process of arising. Then the conjunction of the dyad with the two dyads arises, and the triad is in the process of arising, and the disjunction and action are in the process of being destroyed, and the triad arises, and the cognition of that universal is in the process of arising. Then the triad arises, and the disjunction and action are destroyed, and the cognition of the universal of triad arises, and largeness and length are in the process of arising, and the cognition of dependence is in the process of being destroyed, and the cognition of the quality of triad is in the process of arising. Then largeness and length arise, and the cognition of dependence is destroyed, and the quality of triad is in the process of being destroyed, and the cognition of the quality of triad arises.

original: dvibahubhirmahadbhiścārabdhe kāryadravye kāraṇamahattvānyeva mahattvamārabhante na bahutvam / samānasaṃkhyaiścārabdhe 'tiśayadarśanāt /PDhS
analyzed: dvi bahubhiḥ mahadbhiḥ ca ārabdhe kārya dravye kāraṇa mahat tvāni eva mahat tvam ārabhante na bahu tvam samāna saṃkhyaiḥ ca ārabdhe tiśaya darśanāt
translated: When an effect substance is produced by two or many great causes, greatness is produced only by the greatness of the causes, not by multiplicity. And when produced by causes of equal number, there is an observed excess.

original: mahattvānmahattvamutpadyata ityāha dvibahubhirmahadbhiścārabdhe kāryadravye kāraṇamahattvānyeva mahattvamārabhante iti / dve ca bahavaśca tairdvibahubhiḥ / kiṃ viśiṣṭaiḥ / mahadbhiḥ / ārabdhe kāryadravye kāraṇagatāni mahattvānyeva mahattvamārabhante na bahutvam / katham / samānasaṃkhyaiḥ kāraṇairārabdhe kārye 'tiśayadarśanāt /
analyzed: mahat tvāt mahat tvam utpadyate iti āha dvi bahubhiḥ mahadbhiḥ ca ārabdhe kārya dravye kāraṇa mahat tvāni eva mahat tvam ārabhante iti dve ca bahavaḥ ca taiḥ dvi bahubhiḥ kim viśiṣṭaiḥ mahadbhiḥ ārabdhe kārya dravye kāraṇa gatāni mahat tvāni eva mahat tvam ārabhante na bahu tvam katham samāna saṃkhyaiḥ kāraṇaiḥ ārabdhe kārye tiśaya darśanāt
translated: He says that greatness arises from greatness. When an effect substance is produced by two or many great causes, greatness is produced only by the greatness of the causes. What kind of causes? Great ones. When produced by two or many great causes, greatness is produced only by the greatness present in the causes, not by multiplicity. How? Because when an effect is produced by causes of equal number, an excess is observed.

original: tathā hi / sthūlaiścaturbhirārabdhaṃ kāryamekam / anyaiśca sūkṣmaiścaturbhireva / yattu sthūlairārabdhaṃ tadatiśayena mahat sampadyata iti mahattvasyaiva kāraṇatvam / saṃkhyāyāścobhayatra sādhāraṇatvāt kāraṇatve parimāṇasyāviśeṣaḥ syāt / yatra ca dvayorārambhakatvaṃ / tatra bahutvāsambhavena mahattvasyaiva kāraṇatvamiti /
analyzed: tathā hi sthūlaiḥ caturbhiḥ ārabdham kāryam ekam anyaiḥ ca sūkṣmaiḥ caturbhiḥ eva  yat tu sthūlaiḥ ārabdham tat atiśayena mahat sampadyate iti mahat tvasya eva kāraṇa tvam saṃkhyāyāḥ ca ubhayatra sādhāraṇa tvāt kāraṇa tve parimāṇasya aviśeṣaḥ syāt yatra ca dvayoḥ ārambhaka tvam tatra bahu tva asambhavena mahat tvasya eva kāraṇa tvam iti
translated: For example, one effect is produced by four gross ones, and by four subtle ones alone. But what is produced by the gross ones becomes very great, so greatness itself is the cause. And since number is common in both cases, there would be no difference in the cause of dimension. And where there is the nature of producing two, there, due to the impossibility of plurality, greatness itself is the cause.

original: anye tu saṃkhyāyāḥ parimāṇavadanvayavyatirekābhyāmanyatra sāmarthyāvadhāraṇād ihāpi kāraṇatvamiti manyante / yaccedaṃ samānasaṃkhyairārabdhe 'pi ekatrātiśayadarśanaṃ na tat saṃkhyāyāḥ kāraṇatvapratiṣedhaparam / parimāṇasyāpi akāII /raṇatvaprasaṅgāt / tathā hi / yathā samānasaṃkhyairārabdhamapekṣya tatra parimāṇātiśayastathā sthūlatamaiḥ samānasaṃkhyairārabdhamapekṣya tatparimāṇairasamānasaṃkhyairārabdhe tatparimāṇasyānatiśayopalabdheḥ parimāṇasyāpyakāraṇatvaṃ syāt / tathā adhikaparimāṇāpekṣayānatiśayasadbhāve 'pi etat cet kāraṇam anvayavyatirekābhyāṃ sāmarthyāvagateriṣyate / tatsadbhāve tasya bhāvastadabhāve cābhāva ityetat saṃkhyāyāmapi samānam / yadi cātra mahattvotpattāvakāraṇaṃ saṃkhyā / tarhi sthūlaistribhirārabdhamekam anyat caturbhirityubhayatrāpi kāraṇaparimāṇasyāviśeṣāt kāryaparimāṇasyāviśeṣaḥ syāt / na caitat / caturbhirābdhe parimāṇātiśayadarśanāt / ataḥ saṃkhyāpi kāraṇamiti / tathā samānasaṃkhyaiḥ samānaparimāṇaiścārabdhe mahattvamubhābhyāṃ sampadyata iti yuktam / anyatrobhayoḥ sāmarthyāvadhāraṇād / iha pratyāsannatvācceti / tathā ca tritantukādi parimāṇaṃ tritantukādau vartate / tritantukādau ca tantuṣu tatparimāṇañca tatsaṃkhyā ca teṣveveti kāryakāraṇaikārthasamavāyalakṣaṇā pratyāsattiriti / kathaṃ tarhīdaṃ vākyam kāraṇamahattvānyeva mahattvamārabhante na bahutvamiti / avadhāraṇapratiṣedhārtham / tathā hi / yaduktaṃ samānasaṃkhyairārabdhe 'tiśayaādarśanāt kāraṇamahattvānyeva mahattvamārabhanta iti / etanna / bahutvasyāpyuktanyāyena kāraṇatvāt /
analyzed: anye tu saṃkhyāyāḥ parimāṇa vat anvaya vyatirekābhyām anyatra sāmarthya avadhāraṇāt iha api kāraṇa tvam iti manyante yat ca idam samāna saṃkhyaiḥ ārabdhe ekatra atiśaya darśanam na tat saṃkhyāyāḥ kāraṇa tva pratiṣedha param parimāṇasya api  / tathā hi yathā samāna saṃkhyaiḥ ārabdham apekṣya tatra parimāṇa atiśayaḥ tathā sthūlatamaiḥ samāna saṃkhyaiḥ ārabdham apekṣya tad parimāṇaiḥ asamāna saṃkhyaiḥ ārabdhe tad parimāṇasya an
translated: Others, however, think that number, like dimension, is not the cause here also, because its causal efficiency is not ascertained elsewhere by positive and negative concomitance. And this observation of excess in one case even when composed of equal numbers is not meant to deny number as the cause. For then dimension also would be non-cause, because even when composed of equal numbers, there is excess of dimension in one case. For just as, in relation to what is composed of equal numbers, there is excess of dimension, so also, in relation to what is composed of unequal numbers by the very largest, there is no excess of dimension in what is composed of equal numbers by those dimensions. Therefore, dimension also would be non-cause. If it be said that this is the cause, because its presence and absence are ascertained by positive and negative concomitance, that is present when it is present and absent when it is absent, the same applies to number also. And if number is not the cause in the production of largeness here,

original: yad vā samānasaṃkhyairārabdhe 'tiśayaādarśanāditi mahattvasya kāraṇatvopadarśanametat / nāvadhāraṇamiti /🔽pracayaśca tūlapiṇḍayorvartamānaḥ piṇḍārambhakāvayavapraśithilasaṃyogāpekṣaḥ / itaretarapiṇḍāvayavasaṃyogāpekṣo vā dvitūlake mahattvamārabhate na bahutvamahattvāni / samānasaṃkhyāpalaparimāṇairārabdhe 'tiśayadarśanāt /PDhS
analyzed: yat vā samāna saṃkhyaiḥ ārabdhe tiśaya ādarśanāt iti mahat tvasya kāraṇa tva upadarśanam etat na avadhāraṇam iti  pracayaḥ ca tūla piṇḍayoḥ vartamānaḥ piṇḍa ārambhaka avayava praśithila saṃyoga apekṣaḥ itaretara piṇḍa avayava saṃyoga apekṣaḥ vā dvi tūlake mahattvam ārabhate na bahu tva mahattvāni samāna saṃkhyā pala parimāṇaiḥ ārabdhe tiśaya darśanāt
translated: Or, this shows that magnitude is the cause, because an excess is seen when it is composed of equal numbers, not that it is a determiner.🔽And the aggregation, existing in the two balls of cotton, produces magnitude in the double ball, depending on the loose conjunction of the parts that form the balls, or depending on the mutual conjunction of the parts of the balls. It does not produce multiplicity or magnitude, because an excess is seen when it is composed of equal numbers of palas of magnitude.

original: pracayasya kāraṇatvamāha pracayaśca tūlapiṇḍayorvataṃmānaḥ piṇḍārambhakāvayavapraśithilasaṃyogāpekṣaḥ / itaretarapiṇḍāvayavasaṃyogāpekṣo vā dvitūlake mahattvamārabhate iti /
analyzed: pracayasya kāraṇa tvam āha pracayaḥ ca tūla piṇḍayoḥ vataṃmānaḥ piṇḍa ārambhaka avayava praśithila saṃyoga apekṣaḥ itaretara piṇḍa avayava saṃyoga apekṣaḥ vā dvi tūlake mahattvam ārabhate iti
translated: He states that aggregation is the cause: And the aggregation, existing in the two balls of cotton, produces magnitude in the double ball, depending on the loose conjunction of the parts that form the balls, or depending on the mutual conjunction of the parts of the balls.
