translated: The arising of cognitions in succession, one after another, in regard to each individual thing, is ‘Continuance’; and when this is there, the ‘Repetition’ of the cognition consists in the fact that the subsequent cognitions are dependent upon the Impressions left by the previous experiences; and it is from this Repetition that there comes about the ‘Remembrance’ of the past series of Cognitions. ‘Past’ i.e. the series of Cognitions; the ‘Remembrance’ of this consists in the idea that ‘I have seen this before’; and it is on the basis of this Remembrance that the existence of the ‘Universal’ is cognised. ‘Recognition’ also is of the same nature; i.e. it is of the nature of the Remembrance of the Universal. The ‘Recognition’ also is of the same nature; i.e. it is of the nature of the Remembrance of the Universal. The ‘Recognition’ is of the form ‘This is that same thing’; and it is on the basis of this Recognition that the existence of the ‘Universal’ is cognised. ‘The Universal is that which, being different from the Individuals, is the cause of the notion of sameness among them’.

translated: There, existence is the highest universal, the cause of the cognition of what is common, just as in the case of skin, cloth, blanket, etc., which are mutually distinct, the cognition of what is common, such as 'blue', 'blue', arises from the connection with a single blue substance. Similarly, in the case of substances, qualities, and actions, which are mutually distinct, the cognition of what is common, such as 'existent', 'existent', occurs without distinction. And that must arise from something else. Therefore, that which is the other thing is existence. Thus it is established. The cognition of what is common as 'existent', 'existent' is due to the connection with existence. And that is a universal, because it is the cause of the cognition of what is common.

original: bhedaṃ nirūpayati tatra sattā paraṃ sāmānyam / atra ca mahāviṣayatvādityuktameva sādhanam / sā tu sattā sāmānyameva / kutaḥ / yato 'nuvṛttipratyayasyaiva kāraṇam / yadyapi abhāvādibhyo vyāvṛttijñānasyāpi hetuḥ / tathāpi sāmānyavatsu anuvṛttāmeva buddhiṃ janayati / na vyāvṛttām / ataḥ sāmānyameveti /

analyzed: tatra sāmānya mātrasya sadbhāve vyavasthāpite vispaṣṭa artham sattāyāḥ sadbhāva anumānam āha yat vā pūrvam pratyakṣam uktam idānīm anumānam ucyate tatra vyāpti samarthana artham dṛṣṭāntam vyācaṣṭe yathā paraspara viśiṣṭeṣu vyāvṛtteṣu carma vastra kambala ādiṣu anyasmāt artha antara bhūtāt nīla dravya sambandhāt nīlam nīlam iti pratyaya anuvṛttiḥ tathā paraspara viśiṣṭe dravya guṇa karmasu aviśiṣṭā sat sat iti pratyaya anuvṛtti
translated: When the mere existence of the universal has been established there, he states the inference of the existence of existence, with a clear meaning. Or, what was previously stated as perception is now stated as inference. There, in order to establish the pervasion, he explains the example. Just as in mutually distinct, excluded things like leather, cloth, blanket, etc., the cognition of blue as blue, due to the connection with a blue substance that is a different object from another, similarly in mutually distinct substances, qualities, and actions, the cognition of existence as existence is not distinct. translated: Another is substance-ness, quality-ness, action-ness, etc. The word etc. includes earth-ness and so on. translated: And since a single entity cannot have two forms, how can the same thing be both a universal and a particular? For particulars cannot have an extensive scope, because they inhere in each individual substance. They are called particulars figuratively, by implication, because they qualify their substrata. The nature of particulars is to produce cognitions of exclusions. Their figurative application is also found here, because of the perception of that. Thus, a universal such as substance-ness distinguishes its substratum from other substrata, excludes it, and therefore obtains the designation of particular.

translated: Their difference is established from substances, qualities and actions by the difference in their characteristics. For this very reason, they are eternal. translated: Now, if it is argued that there is only one universal characterized by existence, which produces different cognitions due to the difference in limiting adjuncts, to refute this he says: Because of the restriction of manifestation in substances etc., and because of the difference in cognitions, there is difference from each other. Because there is no means of valid knowledge of its existence in another object. Thus quality...

original: athāstu vyañjakaniyamāt svaviṣaya evopalambhāt svaviṣayasarvagatatvamatra kāraṇaṃ vācyam / niyāmakābhāve niyatāśrayasambandhasyaivābhāvaprasaṅgādityāha kārakasāmagrīniyamācca svaviṣayasarvagatamiti / tathā hi gotvajātisambandhopabhogitvaprāpakādṛṣṭopalakṣitasāmagrīsampādito gopiṇḍo nāśvādi itaraḥ / tanniyamāt sa eva gotvenābhisambadhyate nānyaḥ / tathā aśvatvajātisambandhopabhogaprāpakādṛṣṭopalakṣitasāmagrījanyatvād aśvapiṇḍo 'śvatvenābhisambadhyata iti / evamanyatrā'pīti / ato yaduktaṃ yatrāsau vartate bhāvastena sambadhyate na tu ityādi / tadapāstam / niyatāśrayasamavetasyaivopalambhasiddhau / niyamakāraṇasyānabhidhānāt /
analyzed: atha astu vyañjaka niyamāt sva viṣaye eva upalambhāt sva viṣaya sarvagata tvam atra kāraṇam vācyam niyāmaka abhāve niyata āśraya sambandhasya eva abhāva prasaṅgāt iti āha kāraka sāmagrī niyamāt ca sva viṣaya sarvagatam iti tathā hi go tva jāti sambandha upabhogi tva prāpaka adṛṣṭa upalakṣita sāmagrī sampāditaḥ go piṇḍaḥ na aśva ādi itaraḥ tad niyamāt saḥ eva go tvena abhisambadhyate na anyaḥ tathā aśva tva jāti sambandha upabhoga prāpaka adṛṣ
translated: Now, let it be said that the cause here is the all-pervasiveness of the object with respect to its own domain, because of the perception only of what is in its own domain due to the restriction of the manifester. When there is no restriction, the relation with a restricted substratum itself would be impossible, hence he says: and because of the restriction of the assemblage of causal factors, the all-pervasiveness of the object with respect to its own domain. It is like this: the individual cow, produced by the assemblage characterized by unseen [forces] that bring about the experience related to the universal cowness, is not the other, the horse etc. Because of that restriction, only that is related to cowness, not another. Similarly, the individual horse is related to horsemanship because it is produced by the assemblage characterized by unseen [forces] that bring about the experience related to the universal horseness. It is the same in other cases as well. Therefore, what was said - It is related to that where it exists, not to the other etc. - is refuted. When the perception is established only of what inheres in a restricted substratum, because the cause of restriction is not stated.

original: yaccedaṃ kiṃ gaurgotvenābhisambadhyate athāgauriti codyam / tanna pratisamādhānārham / niṣṭhāsambandhayorekakālatvāditi / svakāraṇaiḥ sattādibhiśca piṇḍasyābhisambandha evātmalābhaḥ / na pūrvaṃ tasya gorūpatā'gorūpatā vā / tatsattvasyaivāsambhavāt /
analyzed: yat ca idam kim gauḥ go tvena abhisambadhyate atha agauḥ iti codyam tat na pratisamādhāna arham niṣṭhā sambandhayoḥ eka kāla tvāt iti sva kāraṇaiḥ sattā ādibhiḥ ca piṇḍasya abhisambandhaḥ eva ātmalābhaḥ na pūrvam tasya go rūpa tā a go rūpa tā vā tad sattvasya eva asambhavāt
translated: And this objection - is the cow related to cowness or not? - is not worthy of a reply, because the relation and the state of being are simultaneous. The individual's relation to its own causes like existence is itself the attainment of self. Not before that is it of the form of a cow or not of the form of a cow, because its existence is impossible.

original: atha yayā maṇimantrauṣadhādīni viśiṣṭārthakriyāsampādanasamarthāni svakāraṇādutpannāni evaṃ gopiṇḍā gauritijñānotpādanasamarthāḥ svakāraṇādevotpannā na aśvādijñānamutpādayantīti cet / tarhi yat tat sāmarthyaṃ yena satā gaurityanugatajñānamutpādayanti / tad yadyarthāntaraṃ saṃjñābhedamātram / avyatireke tvanugatajñānābhāvaprasaṅgaḥ / tasmādanugatasya vastunaḥ pratyakṣeṇa pratibhāsanāt sāmānyanirākaraṇe sarvaṃ dūṣaṇamasādhanameveti /
analyzed: atha yayā maṇi mantra auṣadha ādīni viśiṣṭa arthakriyā sampādana samarthāni sva kāraṇāt utpannāni evam go piṇḍāḥ gauḥ iti jñāna utpādana samarthāḥ sva kāraṇāt eva utpannāḥ na aśva ādi jñānam utpādayanti iti ced tarhi yat tat sāmarthyam yena satā gauḥ iti anugata jñānam utpādayanti tat yadi artha antaram saṃjñā bheda mātram avyatireke tu anugata jñāna abhāva prasaṅgaḥ tasmāt anugatasya vastunaḥ pratyakṣeṇa pratibhāsanāt sāmānya nir
translated: If it is argued that gems, mantras, herbs etc. are produced from their own causes as capable of accomplishing a specific function, and similarly the individual cow is produced from its own causes as capable of producing the cognition cow, but does not produce the cognition of a horse etc., then if that capacity by which it produces the cognition cow which is related to an existent thing is a different thing, merely a different name, then in the absence of difference there would be the undesirable consequence of the absence of a related cognition. Therefore, since an all-pervading entity appears to perception, all the criticisms in the refutation of universals are not valid arguments.

original: atha svaviṣayasarvagatatve gopiṇḍayorantarāle 'pi sāmānyamupalabhyeta / na caitattat /dasti tasmāt kathaṃ svaviṣayasarvagatamityāśaṅkyāha antarāle ca saṃyogasamavāyavṛttyabhāvād avyapadeśyānīti / saṃyuktasamavāyena gotvādisāmānyasyopalambhād gotvamiti vyapadeśo na cāsāvihāsti / ato 'vyapadeśyānīti / tathā kimidamantarālaṃ nāma yatra sāmānyasyopalambhaprasaṅgaścodyate / yadi mūrtadravyābhāvaḥ / na tatra gotvādisāmānyam / abhāvatvādeva / atha śabdānumeyamatīndriyamākāśam / antarālāvasthitaṃ vā ghaṭādi dravyam / tatrāpi na gotvādeḥ samavāye pramāṇamastītyanupalambho ghaṭata ityalam /
analyzed: atha sva viṣaya sarvagata tve go piṇḍayoḥ antarāle pi sāmānyam upalabhyeta na ca etat tat asti tasmāt katham sva viṣaya sarvagatam iti āśaṅkya āha antarāle ca saṃyoga samavāya vṛtti abhāvāt avyapadeśyāni iti saṃyukta samavāyena go tva ādi sāmānyasya upalambhāt go tvam iti vyapadeśaḥ na ca asau iha asti atas vyapadeśyāni iti tathā kim idam antarālam nāma yatra sāmānyasya upalambha prasaṅgaḥ codyate yadi mūrta dravya abhāvaḥ na tatra go tva ādi sāmānya
translated: If, on the other hand, it were all-pervading in its own object, then the universal would be perceived even in the space between two individual cows. But this is not so. Therefore, how can it be all-pervading in its own object? Anticipating this doubt, he says: And because there is no inherence in the space between, it is inexpressible. Since the universal such as cowness is perceived by inherence in the conjoined, it is designated as cowness. But this is not present here. Therefore, it is inexpressible. Similarly, what is this space between, where the perception of the universal is suspected and objected to? If it is the absence of corporeal substance, then there is no universal such as cowness there, because it is itself an absence. Or if it is the imperceptible space inferred from sound, or a pot or other substance located in the space between, even there there is no proof of inherence of cowness etc. Therefore, non-perception is established. That is enough.

original: iti śrīvyomaśivācāryaviracitāyāṃ padārthasaṅgrahaṭīkāyāṃ sāmānyapadārthaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī vyomaśiva ācārya viracitāyām padārthasaṅgraha ṭīkāyām sāmānya padārthaḥ
translated: Thus ends the section on the meaning of universals in the commentary on Padarthasamgraha composed by the illustrious Vyomaśiva.

original: viśeṣapadārthanirūpaṇam
translated: The definition of the meaning of particularity

original: anteṣu bhavā antyāḥ / svāśrayaviśeṣakatvādviśeṣāḥ / vināśārambharahiteṣu nityadravyeṣvaṇvākāśakāladigātmamanassu pratidravyamekaikaśo vartamānā atyantavyāvṛttibuddhihetavaḥ /PDhS
analyzed: anteṣu bhavāḥ antyāḥ sva āśraya viśeṣaka tvāt viśeṣāḥ vināśa ārambha rahiteṣu nitya dravyeṣu aṇu ākāśa kāla diś ātma manaḥsu pratidravyam ekaikaśas vartamānāḥ atyanta vyāvṛtti buddhi hetavaḥ
translated: The ultimate [specifics] exist at the ends [of substances]. They are specifics because they distinguish their substrata. They are the causes of the cognition of absolute exclusion in the eternal substances devoid of destruction and origination, such as atoms, space, time, direction, self, and mind, occurring individually in each substance.

original: yathā asmadādīnāṃ gavādiṣvaśvādibhyastulyākṛtiguṇakriyāvayavasaṃyoganimittā pratyayavyāvṛttirdṛṣṭā / gauḥ śuklaḥ śīghragatiḥ pīnakakudmān mahāghaṇṭa iti / tathā asmadviśiṣṭānāṃ yogināṃ nityeṣu tulyākṛtiguṇakriyeṣu paramāṇuṣu muktātmamanassu ca anyanimittāsambhavād yebhyo nimittebhyaḥ pratyādhāraṃ vilakṣaṇo 'yaṃ vilakṣaṇo 'yamiti pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ / deśakālaviprakarṣe ca paramāṇau sa evāyamiti pratyabhijñānañca bhavati / te 'ntyā viśeṣāḥ /PDhS
analyzed: yathā asmad ādīnām go ādiṣu aśva ādibhyaḥ tulya ākṛti guṇa kriyā avayava saṃyoga nimittā pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ dṛṣṭā gauḥ śuklaḥ śīghra gatiḥ pīna kakudmān mahā ghaṇṭaḥ iti tathā asmad viśiṣṭānām yoginām nityeṣu tulya ākṛti guṇa kriyeṣu paramāṇuṣu mukta ātma manaḥsu ca anya nimitta asambhavāt yebhyaḥ nimittebhyaḥ pratyādhāram vilakṣaṇaḥ yam vilakṣaṇaḥ yam iti pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ deśa kāla viprakarṣe ca param
translated: Just as we see in cows and so on, which have similar forms, qualities, actions, and conjunctions of parts, a cognition of exclusion from horses and other [animals], such as the cow is white, moves quickly, has a large hump, and has a big bell. Similarly, for yogis superior to us, in eternal atoms with similar forms, qualities, and actions, and in liberated selves and minds, since other causes are impossible, from those causes there is a cognition of exclusion, this one is different from that one, this one is different from that one, and even when there is distance in space and time, there is recognition of the atom as this is the same one. Those are the ultimate specifics.

original: yadi punarantyaviśeṣamantareṇa yogināṃ yogajāddharmāt pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānañca syāt tataḥ kiṃ syāt / naivaṃ bhavati / yathā ca cāyogajā ddharmādaśukle śuklapratyayaḥ sañjāyate / atyantādṛṣṭe ca pratyabhijñānam / yadi syānmithyā bhavet / tathehāpyantyaviśeṣamantareṇa yogināṃ na yogajāddharmāt pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānaṃ vā bhavitumarhati /PDhS
analyzed: yadi punar antya viśeṣam antareṇa yoginām yoga jāt dharmāt pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānam ca syāt tatas kim syāt na evam bhavati yathā ca ca ayoga jāt dharmāt aśukle śukla pratyayaḥ sañjāyate atyanta adṛṣṭe ca pratyabhijñānam yadi syāt mithyā bhavet tathā iha api antya viśeṣam antareṇa yoginām na yoga jāt dharmāt pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānam vā bhavitum arhati pdhs
translated: But if, without the final specific quality, there would be cessation of cognition and recognition from the yoga-born quality of the yogins, then what would follow? It does not happen like that. And just as from a non-yoga-born quality, a white cognition arises from the non-white, and there is recognition of what is absolutely unseen, if it were so, it would be false. Similarly here too, without the final specific quality, cessation of cognition and recognition cannot possibly arise from the yoga-born quality of the yogins.

original: athāntyaviśeṣeṣviva paramāṇuṣu kasmānna svataḥ pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ kalpayata iti cet / na / tādātmyāt / iha atadātmakeṣvanyanimittaḥ pratyayo bhavati / yathā ghaṭādiṣu pradīpāt / na tu pradīpe pradīpāntarāt / yathā gavāśvamāṃsādīnāṃ svata evāśucitvaṃ tadyogādanyeṣām / tathehāpi tādātmyādantyaviśeṣeṣu svata eva pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ tadyogāt paramāṇvādiṣviti /PDhS
analyzed: atha antya viśeṣeṣu iva paramāṇuṣu kasmāt na svatas pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ kalpayate iti ced na tādātmyāt iha a tad ātmakeṣu anya nimittaḥ pratyayaḥ bhavati yathā ghaṭa ādiṣu pradīpāt na tu pradīpe pradīpa antarāt yathā gavāśva māṃsa ādīnām svatas eva aśuci tvam tad yogāt anyeṣām tathā iha api tādātmyāt antya viśeṣeṣu svatas eva pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ tad yogāt paramāṇu ādiṣu iti pdhs
translated: If it is asked why there is not a natural exclusion of cognition in atoms, as in the final specific universals, it is not so. Because of identity. Here, in what is not of that nature, cognition has another cause, like from a lamp in pots etc. But not in a lamp from another lamp. Just as the impurity of cow, horse, and other meats is natural, and of others through their connection. So here too, due to identity, there is a natural exclusion of cognition in the final specific universals, and due to their connection in atoms etc.

original: viśeṣāṇāṃ parīkṣārthamāha anteṣu bhavā antyāḥ svāśrayaviśeṣakatvād viśeṣā iti / utpattivināśayorante vyavasthitatvād antaśabdavācyāni nityadravyāṇīti / tathā hi paramāṇūn avadhiṃ kṛtvā dvyaṇukādikāryasyotpattiḥ / tathā pṛthivyādīnāmapi tāvadutpādo yāvadākāśādīti pāṭhāpekṣayā tasyāpyantaśabdavācyatvam / evaṃ vināśānte vyavasthānaṃ paramāṇvādīnām / tathā ca tāvad dravyaṃ vinaśyati yāvat paramāṇavaḥ / pāṭhāpekṣayā pṛthivyādīnāmapyākāśādikaṃ yāvad vināśa iti / teṣu bhavāḥ tadvṛttayo 'ntyā ityapadiśyante / tathā hi bhūrityayaṃ dhātuḥ sattāyāṃ vāpyupalabdhau / yathedānīṃ devadatto gṛhe bhavatyāsta iti / saṅgrahoktervivaraṇamāha vināśārambharahiteṣvityādi / tatrāntapadasya vivaraṇaṃ vināśārambharahiteṣu nityadravyeṣveva / aṇvākāśakāladigātmamanassviti viśeṣasaṃjñāyā nirdeśaḥ spaṣṭārtham / pratyayārthaṃ vyācaṣṭe pratidravyamekaikaśo vartamānā iti / dravyaṃ dravyaṃ pratyekaiko viśeṣo vartate / naikasminnanekaḥ / vaiyarthyaprasaṅgāt / tathā caikenaiva viśeṣeṇa vyāvṛttapratyayasya janitatvād viśeṣāntaravaiyarthyameva / nāpyeko 'nekasmin / sāmānyarūpatāprasaṅgāditi / dvitīyapadasya tu vivaraṇam atyantavyāvṛttibuddhihetava iti / nityadravyeṣveva vartanta eva ityayogānyayogavyavacchedena nityeṣu vartamānatvād viśeṣā itarasmād bhidyanta iti / lakṣaṇaṃ pūrvamevoktam /
analyzed: viśeṣāṇām parīkṣā artham āha anteṣu bhavāḥ antyāḥ sva āśraya viśeṣaka tvāt viśeṣāḥ iti utpatti vināśayoḥ ante vyavasthita tvāt anta śabda vācyāni nitya dravyāṇi iti tathā hi paramāṇūn avadhim kṛtvā dvyaṇuka ādi kāryasya utpattiḥ tathā pṛthivī ādīnām api tāvat utpādaḥ yāvat ākāśa ādi iti pāṭha apekṣayā tasya api anta śabda vācya tvam evam vināśa ante vyavasthānam paramāṇu ādīnām tathā ca tāvat dravyam vinaśyati yāv
translated: In order to examine the specificities, it is said: Those that exist at the ends are the ultimate, because they specifically qualify their substratum, they are specificities. Because they are situated at the ends of origination and destruction, they are denoted by the word 'anta' (end). Thus, taking the atoms as the limit, the effect such as the dyad is originated. Similarly, there is the origination of earth etc. up to space. From the point of view of the text, that also is denoted by the word 'anta' (end). Similarly, the atoms etc. are situated at the end of destruction. And thus, a substance is destroyed up to the atoms. From the point of view of the text, the destruction of earth etc. is up to space. Those that exist in them are said to be the ultimate, having their existence in them. Thus, this root 'bhu' (to be) is used in the sense of existence or perception, just as Devadatta exists or is in the house now. The explanation of the summary statement begins with 'in those devoid of destruction and origination' etc. There, the explanation of the word 'anta' (end) is 'devoid of destruction and origination' etc.

original: atha viśeṣāṇāṃ sadbhāve kiṃ pramāṇam / anumānam / tatra vyāptisamarthanārthaṃ dṛṣṭāntaṃ nirūpayati / yathā asmadādīnāṃ gavādiṣvaśvādibhyaḥ pratyayavyāvṛttirdṛṣṭā tulyākṛtiguṇādapi sajātīyād vyāvṛttatatkriyāvayavasaṃyoganimittā / tatra jātinimittā pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ / yasmād gaurayam / ato 'śvādivilakṣaṇa iti / sajātīyatve 'pi kṛṣṇādiguṇasambandhibhyaḥ śukla iti II / pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ / tathā śīghragatiriti kriyāviśeṣanimittā / tena hi satā samānaguṇādapi sajātīyād vyāvartata iti / pīna ityavayavopacayanimittā / tena satā samānaguṇakriyādapi samānajātīyād vyāvartate / kakudmān ityavayavaviśeṣanimittā / tena satā anyasmād vilakṣaṇapratyayajananāditi / mahāghaṇṭa iti saṃyoganimittā / tatsadbhāve vyāvṛttapratyayajananāt /
analyzed: atha viśeṣāṇām sadbhāve kim pramāṇam anumānam tatra vyāpti samarthana artham dṛṣṭāntam nirūpayati yathā asmad ādīnām gavādiṣu aśva ādibhyaḥ pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ dṛṣṭā tulya ākṛti guṇāt api sajātīyāt vyāvṛtta tad kriyā avayava saṃyoga nimittā tatra jāti nimittā pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ yasmāt gauḥ ayam śva ādi vilakṣaṇaḥ iti sajātīya tve pi kṛṣṇa ādi guṇa sambandhibhyaḥ śuklaḥ iti pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ tathā śīghra ga
translated: Now, what is the evidence for the existence of universals? Inference. To establish the pervasion, he presents an example: Just as we see that for us, the notion of a cow is excluded from horses and others, and is due to the conjunction of parts that perform the same function as those of similar kind, even if they have similar form and qualities. There, the notion that excludes others is due to the universal. Because this is a cow, therefore it is different from horses and so on. Even if it belongs to the same class, the notion that excludes others is due to being white, related to the quality of black and so on. Similarly, the notion of moving quickly is due to a particular action. By that, even if it exists, it is excluded from those of the same class that have the same qualities and actions. The notion of being fat is due to the accumulation of parts. By that, even if it exists, it is excluded from those of the same class that have the same qualities and actions. The notion of having a dewlap is due to a particular part. By that, even if it exists, it generates a notion that is different from others. The notion of having a large bell is due to conjunction. In its existence,

original: taddārṣṭāntikavyākhyārthamāha asmad viśiṣṭānāṃ yogināṃ nityeṣu tulyākṛtiguṇakriyeṣu paramāṇuṣu muktātmamanassu ca pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ / etasmād vilakṣaṇo 'yaṃ vilakṣaṇo 'yamiti dṛṣṭā / sā cānyanimittāsambhavād viśeṣasambandhādeva bhavatīti / tathā ca tulyākṛtiguṇakriyādhārāḥ paramāṇavaḥ / viśeṣasambandhinaḥ / vyāvṛttajñānaviṣayatvāt / gavādivat / na ca gavādiṣviva jātiguṇakriyātmakā eva viśeṣā bhaviṣyantīti vācyam / samānajātiguṇakriyādhāratvena viśeṣitatvāditi / tathā'pi sarve taijasāḥ paramāṇavaḥ tejastvasambandhinaḥ samānaguṇādhārāḥ samānākriyāsambandhinaśca pakṣīkṛtā iti na teṣu tannimittā pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ / tathā ca bhāsvaraṃ rūpamuṣṇasparśaḥ parimāṇamekatvaikapṛthaktvādayaḥ sādhāraṇatvānna vyāvṛttajñānahetavaḥ / kriyāpi vātāhatānāmekadigabhimukhatayā gamanāt sādhāraṇatayā vailakṣaṇyapratipattau na kāraṇam / ato dravyādisvarūpasya viśeṣasyāsambhavād yato nimittāt pratyayavyāvṛttiste 'ntyā viśeṣāḥ / tathā muktātmāno muktamanāṃsi ca vyāvṛttajñānaviṣayatvād viśeṣamapekṣante / śarīrasambandhasya cātyantaṃ vyāvṛtterna ātmani buddhyādiviśeṣo vyāvṛttajñānahetuḥ / asambhavāt / manaso 'pi śarīrasambandhaśūnyasya saṃkhyādiguṇānāṃ sādhāraṇatvād viśeṣaṃ vinā na vyāvṛttajñānotpattau kāraṇamastīti / yathoktaviśeṣaṇādhyāsiteṣu vyāvṛttapratyayaḥ / viśeṣakāryaḥ / vyāvṛttapratyayatvād / gavādivyāvṛttapratyayavat /
analyzed: tad dārṣṭāntika vyākhyā artham āha asmat viśiṣṭānām yoginām nityeṣu tulya ākṛti guṇa kriyeṣu paramāṇuṣu mukta ātma manassu ca pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ etasmāt vilakṣaṇaḥ yam vilakṣaṇaḥ yam iti dṛṣṭā sā ca anya nimitta asambhavāt viśeṣa sambandhāt eva bhavati iti tathā ca tulya ākṛti guṇa kriyā dhārāḥ paramāṇavaḥ viśeṣa sambandhinaḥ vyāvṛtta jñāna viṣaya tvāt gavādi vat na ca gavādiṣu iva jāti guṇa kriyā ātmakā
translated: To explain the meaning of the example, he says: For yogis superior to us, there is a distinction in cognition regarding eternal atoms of similar form, quality, and action, and liberated souls and minds. This one is different, this one is different - this is seen. And that distinction arises only from the connection with a particular, because another cause is not possible. And thus, atoms are the substrata of similar form, quality, and action, and are connected with a particular, because they are the objects of a distinguishing cognition, like a cow etc. And it cannot be said that the particulars are only of the nature of class, quality, and action, like in the case of a cow etc. Because they are specified as the substrata of similar class, quality, and action. Even so, all fiery atoms are the substrata of similar qualities and the substrata of similar actions connected with fireness, being the subject. Therefore, there is no distinction in cognition caused by that in them. And thus, the luminous form, the hot touch, the dimension, the oneness, the one-ness, the separateness etc. are common.

original: athātīndriyatvāt paramāṇvādeḥ vyāvṛttajñānaviṣayatve kiṃ pramāṇam / anumānameva / tathā hi paramāṇvādayaḥ / vyāvṛttajñānaviṣayāḥ / dravyatvāt / gavādivat / saṃśayaviṣayatvañca paramāṇvādeḥ sattāsambandhitvāt sthāṇvādivat / yatra ca saṃśayastatrāvaśyaṃ nirṇaya iti / paramāṇvādayaḥ / viśeṣasambandhinaḥ / nirṇayaviṣayatvāt / sthāṇvādivadeva / ata idamāha anyanimittāsambhavād yebhyo II / nimittebhyaḥ pratyādhāraṃ vilakṣaṇo 'yaṃ vilakṣaṇo 'yamiti pratyayavyāvṛttiste antyā viśeṣāḥ / tathā deśakālaviprakṛṣṭe 'dṛṣṭe paramāṇau sa evāyamiti pratyayaḥ pramāṇam / viśeṣasambandhe sati pratyabhijñānasya devadattādāvupalabdheḥ / ato vyāvṛttapratyayaviṣayatvāt pratyabhijñāyamānatvācca paramāṇvāderviśeṣasambandhitvam / asti ca yogināṃ pūrvopalabdhe paramāṇau sa evāyaṃ paramāṇuḥ yaḥ pañcapurāvasthito vasantasamayopalabdha iti /
analyzed: atha atīndriya tvāt paramāṇu ādeḥ vyāvṛtta jñāna viṣaya tve kim pramāṇam anumānam eva tathā hi paramāṇu ādayaḥ vyāvṛtta jñāna viṣayāḥ dravya tvāt gavādi vat saṃśaya viṣaya tvam ca paramāṇu ādeḥ sattā sambandhi tvāt sthāṇu ādi vat yatra ca saṃśayaḥ tatra avaśyam nirṇayaḥ iti paramāṇu ādayaḥ viśeṣa sambandhinaḥ nirṇaya viṣaya tvāt sthāṇu ādi vat eva atas idam āha anya nimitta asambhavāt yebhyaḥ nimittebhyaḥ pratyādhā
translated: Now, since atoms etc. are beyond the senses, what is the evidence for their being the objects of differentiating cognition? Inference itself. Thus, atoms etc. are the objects of differentiating cognition. Because they are substances, like a cow etc. And the object of doubt is atoms etc., because they are related to existence, like a post etc. And where there is doubt, there must be determination. Therefore, atoms etc. are related to particulars. Because they are the objects of determination, like a post etc. For this reason, he says: Because other causes are not possible, those causes from which there is the exclusion of the cognition 'this is different, this is different', those are the ultimate particulars. Similarly, the cognition this is the same regarding an unseen atom far removed in space and time is evidence. Because recognition occurs when there is a relation to a particular, as is observed in Devadatta etc. Therefore, because atoms etc. are the objects of differentiating cognition and are recognized, they are related to particulars.

original: atha itaretarābhāvāt pṛthaktvād vā pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānaṃ veti / na tato 'nyo viśeṣa iti cet / na / tadupalambhe 'pi sthāṇvādau saṃśayadarśanāt / tathā hi itaretarābhāvopalabdhau pṛthaktvopalambhe ca sati sāmānyadarśanādibhyaḥ kimayaṃ sthāṇuḥ puruṣo veti saṃśayo dṛṣṭaḥ / tadvyatiriktaśiraḥpāṇyādiviśeṣopalambhe ca sati puruṣa evāyamiti ca nirṇayadarśanād itaretarābhāvapṛthaktvānya eva viśeṣaḥ paramāṇvādau vācya iti /
analyzed: atha itaretara abhāvāt pṛthaktvāt vā pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānam vā iti na tatas nyaḥ viśeṣaḥ iti ced na tad upalambhe sthāṇu ādau saṃśaya darśanāt tathā hi itaretara abhāva upalabdhau pṛthaktva upalambhe ca sati sāmānya darśana ādibhyaḥ kim ayam sthāṇuḥ puruṣaḥ vā iti saṃśayaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ tad vyatirikta śiraḥ pāṇi ādi viśeṣa upalambhe ca sati puruṣaḥ eva ayam iti ca nirṇaya darśanāt itaretara abhāva pṛthaktva anyaḥ eva
translated: Now, if it is argued that the exclusion of other conditions is either due to mutual absence or to distinctness, and that there is no other difference than that, it is not so. Because even when that is perceived, doubt is seen in the case of a post etc. Indeed, when mutual absence is perceived and distinctness is perceived, doubt is seen as to whether this is a post or a man, due to the perception of a universal etc. And when the specific features like head, hands etc. different from that are perceived, certainty is seen as this is a man, so a difference other than mutual absence and distinctness should be stated in the case of an atom etc.

original: anye tu itaretarābhāvasya niṣidhyamānajñānajanakatvameva / vyāvṛttajñānañca tasmād vilakṣaṇam / ato nimittāntarakāryamiti manyante / pṛthaktvavaśācca pṛthagiti vyavahāraḥ / na vilakṣaṇa iti /
analyzed: anye tu itaretara abhāvasya niṣidhyamāna jñāna janaka tvam eva vyāvṛtta jñānam ca tasmāt vilakṣaṇam atas nimitta antara kāryam iti manyante pṛthaktva vaśāt ca pṛthak iti vyavahāraḥ na vilakṣaṇaḥ iti
translated: But others think that mutual absence merely produces the cognition of what is being negated, and the cognition of exclusion is different from that. Therefore, it is the effect of another cause. And usage as distinct is due to distinctness, not to being different.

original: atha yogināṃ yogajadharmādeḥ pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānañceti / tadevāha yadi punaḥ antyaviśeṣamantareṇa yogināṃ yogajadharmāt pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānañca syāt ko doṣaḥ / tadāha evaṃ naiva bhavatīti / yathā cāyogajād dharmād aśukle śuklapratyayaḥ sañjāyate / atyantādṛṣṭapūrve ca pratyabhijñānañceti / yadi kadācit syād yogināmaśukle śuklapratyayaḥ / pratyabhijñānañca / mithyā bhavet / tathehāpyantyaviśeṣamantareṇa yogajadharmānna pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānaṃ vā bhavitumarhatīti /
analyzed: atha yoginām yoga ja dharma ādeḥ pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānam ca iti tat eva āha yadi punar antya viśeṣam antareṇa yoginām yoga ja dharmāt pratyaya vyāvṛttiḥ pratyabhijñānan ca syāt kaḥ doṣaḥ tat āha evam na eva bhavati iti yathā ca ayoga jāt dharmāt aśukle śukla pratyayaḥ sañjāyate atyanta adṛṣṭa pūrve ca pratyabhijñānam ca iti yadi kadācid syāt yoginām aśukle śukla pratyayaḥ pratyabhijñānam ca mithyā bhavet tathā iha api antya viśeṣa
translated: Now, if for yogis, there is cessation of cognition and recognition from the dharma born of yoga, he says that. If again, without the final specific, there were cessation of cognition and recognition for yogis from the dharma born of yoga, what is the fault? He says that it does not happen in this way. And just as from the dharma not born of yoga, a cognition of the white arises in the non-white, and there is recognition of what has never been seen before, if it were to happen sometimes for yogis, a cognition of the white in the non-white and recognition, it would be false. In the same way, here too, without the final specific, the cessation of cognition and recognition cannot occur from the dharma born of yoga.

original: atha antyaviśeṣāṇāṃ paramāṇūnāmiva vyāvṛttajñānaviṣayatvād viśeṣāntarasambandhe tatrāpyanyo viśeṣastatrāpyanya ityanavasthā syāt / na ca vyāvṛttapratyayaviṣayatve samāne 'pi paramāṇūnāmevāyaṃ viṣayasambandho na viśeṣāṇāmiti viśeṣaheturastīti / abhyupagame vā / viśeṣeṣu viśeṣāntarasambandhaṃ vinā vyāvṛttapratyayavat paramāṇuṣvapi syādityāha athāntyaviśeṣeṣviva II / paramāṇuṣu kasmānna svataḥ pratyayavyāvṛttiḥ kalpyata iti / asya pratiṣedhārthamāha yaduktaṃ paramāṇuṣu viśeṣābhāvo viśeṣeṣu ca viśeṣāntaramityetanna / kuta etat / tādātmyāt / tatsvarūpatvād viśeṣāṇām / ye hi aviśeṣasvarūpāste vyāvṛttajñānajanmani viśeṣamapekṣante / yathā paramāṇvādayaḥ / na caivaṃ viśeṣāstadātmakā na bhavanti / atastādātmyād viśeṣāḥ samānalakṣaṇaṃ viśeṣaṃ nāpekṣante / tathā ceha atadātmakeṣvatatsvarūpeṣvanyanimittaḥ pratyayo dṛṣṭo yathā ghaṭādiṣu pradīpāt / tathā hi ghaṭādiṣvaprakāśasvarūpeṣvanvayavyatirekābhyāṃ pradīpād vijñānaṃ dṛṣṭam / na tu pradīpe pradīpāt / tasya prakāśarūpatayā pradīpaṃ vināpi prakāśanāt / na caivaṃ ghaṭādiṣvapi prakāśaṃ vinaiva prakāśo 'stu / adarśanāt / āgamikamudāharaṇaṃ darśayati yathā gavāśvamāṃsādīnāṃ svata evāśucitvaṃ tadyogādanyeṣāṃ modakādīnām / na tu śvamāṃsasyāpi aśucyantarasambandhād aśucitvam / adarśanāt / nāpi śvamāṃsavat bhaktādīnāmapi svata evāśucitvamadarśanādeva / tathehāpi tādātmyād viśeṣasvarūpatvād antyaviśeṣeṣu svata eva pratyayavyāvṛttistadyogāt paramāṇuṣvityupasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: atha antya viśeṣāṇām paramāṇūnām iva vyāvṛtta jñāna viṣaya tvāt viśeṣa antara sambandhe tatra api anyaḥ viśeṣaḥ tatra api anyaḥ iti anavasthā syāt na ca vyāvṛtta pratyaya viṣaya tve samāne paramāṇūnām eva ayam viṣaya sambandhaḥ na viśeṣāṇām iti viśeṣa hetuḥ asti iti abhyupagame vā viśeṣeṣu viśeṣa antara sambandham vinā vyāvṛtta pratyaya vat paramāṇuṣu api syāt iti āha atha antya viśeṣeṣu iva paramāṇuṣu kasmāt na sva
translated: Now, if the ultimate specificities, like atoms, are the objects of cognition of exclusion, and are related to another specificity, then there would be an infinite regress, with another specificity there too, and another there too. And when the object of the cognition of exclusion is the same, there is no reason to say that this relation to the object is only of atoms, not of specificities. And if it is accepted, then even in atoms, without the relation of another specificity to the specificities, there would be a cognition of exclusion. Therefore he says: If it is so, why is the exclusion of cognition not imagined in atoms as in the ultimate specificities? To counter this, he says: What was said - the absence of specificities in atoms, and another specificity in specificities - is not so. Why is this? Because of identity. Because the specificities have that as their nature. Those which have the nature of non-specificity require another specificity for the production of an exclusive cognition, like atoms and so on. But the specificities are not so, they do not have that as their nature. They are not non-specificities. They are specificities. Therefore they do not require another specificity for the production of an exclusive cognition. Thus the specificities are not related to another specificity. original: atha viśeṣāṇāṃ nityatvamutānityatvam / utpattivināśakāraṇānupalabdhernityatvameva / tathā hi viśeṣāṇāṃ svāśrayaḥ samavāyikāraṇam / asamavāyyādikāraṇañca nāsti iti / vināśābhyupagame 'pi viśeṣāṇāṃ punarvyāvṛttijñānotpattau na kāraṇamastīti / atha viśeṣāntarādvyāvṛttajñānam / tanna / anyatve pramāṇābhāvādityalamativistareṇa /
analyzed: atha viśeṣāṇām nitya tvam uta anitya tvam utpatti vināśa kāraṇa anupalabdheḥ nitya tvam eva tathā hi viśeṣāṇām sva āśrayaḥ samavāyi kāraṇam asamavāyi ādi kāraṇam ca na asti iti vināśa abhyupagame viśeṣāṇām punar vyāvṛtti jñāna utpattau na kāraṇam asti iti atha viśeṣa antarāt vyāvṛtta jñānam tat na anya tve pramāṇa abhāvāt iti alam ati vistareṇa
translated: Now, are the universals eternal or non-eternal? Due to the non-apprehension of causes of origination and destruction, they are eternal only. Thus, for universals, the substratum is the inherent cause, and there is no non-inherent cause etc. Even if the destruction of universals is accepted, there is no cause for the production of the knowledge of exclusion again. If the knowledge of exclusion is from another universal, that is not so. Because there is no proof of difference. Thus, I desist from excessive elaboration.

original: iti śrīvyomaśivācāryaviracitāyāṃ padārthasaṅgrahaṭīkāyāṃ viśeṣapadārthaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī vyomaśiva ācārya viracitāyām padārthasaṅgraha ṭīkāyām viśeṣa padārthaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the definition of universals in the commentary on Padarthasamgraha composed by the illustrious Vyomaśiva.

original: samavāyapadārthanirūpaṇam
translated: Definition of Inherence

original: ayutasiddhānāmādhāryādhārabhūtānāṃ yaḥ sambandha ihapratyayahetuḥ sa samavāyaḥ / dravyaguṇakarmasāmānyaviśeṣāṇāṃ kāryakāraṇabhūtānāmakāryaII /kāraṇabhūtānāṃ vā ayutasiddhānāmādhāryādhārabhāvenāvasthitānāmihedamiti buddhiryato bhavati / yataścāsarvagatānāmadhigatānyatvānām aviṣvagbhāvaḥ sa samavāyākhyaḥ sambandhaḥ / katham / yatheha kuṇḍe dadhītipratyayaḥ sambandhe sati dṛṣṭaḥ / tatheha tantuṣu paṭaḥ / iha vīraṇeṣu kaṭaḥ / iha dravye guṇakarmaṇī / iha guṇe guṇatvam / iha karmaṇi karmatvam / iha nityadravye 'ntyā viśeṣā iti pratyayadarśanādastyeṣāṃ sambandha iti jñāyate /PDhS
analyzed: ayuta siddhānām ādhārya ādhāra bhūtānām yaḥ sambandhaḥ iha pratyaya hetuḥ sa samavāyaḥ dravya guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣāṇām vā ayuta siddhānām ādhārya ādhāra bhāvena avasthitānām iha idam iti buddhiḥ yatas bhavati yatas ca asarvagatānām adhigata anya tvānām a viṣvak bhāvaḥ sa samavāya ākhyaḥ sambandhaḥ katham yathā iha kuṇḍe dadhi iti pratyayaḥ sambandhe sati dṛṣṭaḥ tathā iha tantuṣu paṭaḥ iha vīraṇeṣu kaṭaḥ iha dravye gu
translated: That relation which is the cause of the cognition of 'this' between things that are not simultaneously produced and are related as container and contained, is inherence. It is the relation between substance, quality, action, universal and particular, which are cause and effect, or between those that are not effects and causes, but exist as container and contained, and from which arises the cognition of 'this here'. And that relation called inherence is the non-separation of things that are not all-pervading and are known to be different. How? Just as the cognition 'curd in this pot' is seen to occur when there is a relation, so too 'cloth in these threads', 'mat in these reeds', 'qualities and actions in this substance', 'universality in this quality', 'actionality in this action', 'ultimate particulars in this eternal substance'. From the observation of such cognitions, it is known that there is a relation between them.

original: na cāsau saṃyogaḥ sambandhināmayutasiddhatvād anyatarakarmādinimittāsambhavād vibhāgāntatvādarśanādadhikaraṇādhikartavyayoreva bhāvāditi /PDhS
analyzed: na ca asau saṃyogaḥ sambandhinām ayuta siddha tvāt anyatara karma ādi nimitta asambhavāt vibhāga anta tva adarśanāt adhikaraṇa adhikartavyayoḥ eva bhāvāt iti
translated: And that is not conjunction, because the relata are not non-simultaneously existent, because the cause such as the action of one of them is not possible, and because inherence is not seen to end with disjunction, and because it exists only between the substratum and the object to be related.

original: sa ca dravyādibhyaḥ padārthāntaraṃ bhāvavallakṣaṇabhedāt / yathā bhāvasya dravyatvādīnāṃ svādhāreṣu ātmānurūpapratyayakartṛtvāt svāśrayādibhyaḥ parasparataścārthāntarabhāvaḥ tathā samavāyasyāpi pañcasu padārtheṣvihetipratyayadarśanāt tebhyaḥ padārthāntaratvamiti / na ca saṃyogavannānātvaṃ bhāvavalliṅgāviśeṣād viśeṣaliṅgābhāvācca / tasmād bhāvavat sarvatraikaḥ samavāya iti /PDhS
analyzed: sa ca dravya ādibhyaḥ padārtha antaram bhāvavat lakṣaṇa bhedāt yathā bhāvasya dravya tva ādīnām sva ādhāreṣu ātma anurūpa pratyaya kartṛ tvāt sva āśraya ādibhyaḥ parasparataḥ ca artha antara bhāvaḥ tathā samavāyasya api pañcasu padārtheṣu iha iti pratyaya darśanāt tebhyaḥ padārtha antara tvam iti na ca saṃyogavat nānātvam bhāvavat liṅga aviśeṣāt viśeṣa liṅga abhāvāt ca  /
translated: And that is a different category from substance etc., because of the difference in nature and characteristics like existence. Just as existence, substantiality etc. are different from their own substrata, from each other, and from themselves, because they cause the cognition of their own form in their own substrata, similarly, inherence is also a different category from the five categories, because the cognition here in this is seen in the five categories. And it is not multiple like conjunction, because of the non-difference in gender like existence, and because there is no indication of difference. Therefore, like existence, inherence is one everywhere.

original: nanu yadyekaḥ samavāyaḥ / dravyaguṇakarmaṇāṃ dravyatvaguṇatvakarmatvādiviśeṣaṇaiḥ saha sambandhaikatvāt padārthasaṅkaraprasaṅga iti / na / ādhārādheyaniyamāt / yadyapyekaḥ samavāyaḥ sarvatra svatantrastathāpyādhārādheyaniyamo 'sti / katham / dravyeṣveva dravyatvam / guṇeṣveva guṇatvam / karmaṣveva karmatvamityevamādi / kasmāt / anvayavyatirekadarśanāt / iheti samavāyanimittasya jñānasyānvayadarśanāt sarvatraikaḥ samavāya iti gamyate / dravyatvādinimittānāṃ vyatirekadarśanāt pratiniyamo jñāyate / yathā kuṇḍadadhnoḥ saṃyogaikatve bhavatyāśrayāśrayibhāvaniyamastathā dravyatvādīnāmapi samavāyaikatve 'pi vyaṅgyavyañjakaśaktibhedādādhārādheyaniyama iti /PDhS
analyzed: nanu yadi ekaḥ samavāyaḥ dravya guṇa karmaṇām dravya tva guṇa tva karma tva ādi viśeṣaṇaiḥ saha sambandha ekatvāt padārtha saṅkara prasaṅgaḥ iti na ādhāra ādheya niyamāt yadi api ekaḥ samavāyaḥ sarvatra svatantraḥ tathā api ādhāra ādheya niyamaḥ sti  / katham dravyeṣu eva dravya tvam guṇeṣu eva guṇa tvam karmaṣu eva karma tvam iti evamādi  / kasmāt anvaya vyatireka darśanāt iha iti samavāya nimittasya jñānasya anvaya darśanāt sarvatra ekaḥ s
translated: But if there is only one inherence, then there would be a confusion of categories due to the oneness of the relation with the specific attributes of substance, quality, and action, such as substantiveness, qualityness, actionness, etc. - not so, because of the restriction of substratum and superstratum. Although inherence is one and independent everywhere, still there is a restriction of substratum and superstratum. How so? Substantiveness exists only in substances, qualityness only in qualities, actionness only in actions, and so on. Why? Because of the observation of concomitance and non-concomitance. Because the knowledge caused by inherence is observed to be concomitant here, it is understood that inherence is one everywhere. Because of the observation of non-concomitance of the causes of substantiveness, etc., the restriction is known. Just as there is a restriction of container and contained even in the oneness of the conjunction of a pot and curd, similarly, even in the oneness of inherence of substantiveness, etc., there is a restriction of substratum and superstratum due to the difference in the power of the manifested and manifester.

original: sambandhyanityatve 'pi na saṃyogavadanityatvam / bhāvavadakāraṇatvāt / yathā pramāṇataḥ kāraṇānupalabdhernityo bhāva ityuktam tathā samavāyo 'pīti / na hyasya kiñcit kāraṇaṃ pramāṇata upalabhyata iti / kayā punarvṛttyā dravyādiṣu samavāyo vartate / na saṃyogaḥ sambhavati / tasya guṇatvena II / dravyājitatvād nāpi samavāyaḥ / tasyaikatvāt / na cānyā vṛttirastīti / na / tādātmyāt / yathā dravyaguṇakarmaṇāṃ sadātmakasya bhāvasya nānyaḥ sattāyogo 'sti / evamavibhāgino vattātmakasya samavāyasya nānyā vattirasti / tasmāt svātmavṛttiḥ / ata evātīndriyaḥ / sattādīnāmiva pratyakṣeṣu vṛttyabhāvāt / svātmagatasaṃvedanābhāvācca / tasmādiha buddhyanumeyaḥ samavāya iti /
analyzed: sambandhi anitya tve pi na saṃyoga vat anitya tvam bhāva vat akāraṇa tvāt yathā pramāṇataḥ kāraṇa anupalabdheḥ nityaḥ bhāvaḥ iti uktam tathā samavāyaḥ u pi iti na hi asya kiñcid kāraṇam pramāṇataḥ upalabhyate iti  kayā punar vṛttyā dravya ādiṣu samavāyaḥ vartate na saṃyogaḥ sambhavati tasya guṇa tvena dravya ajita tvāt na api samavāyaḥ tasya ekatvāt na ca anyā vṛttiḥ asti iti na tādātmyāt yathā dravya guṇa karmaṇām sat ātmakasya bhāva
translated: By what mode does inherence inhere in substances etc.? Conjunction is not possible, because it is a quality and inheres in substances. Nor is inherence itself, because it is one. And there is no other mode. No, because of identity. Just as for substances, qualities and actions, which are of the nature of existence, there is no other connection with existence, similarly for inherence, which is of the nature of non-division, there is no other mode. Therefore it inheres in itself. For this very reason it is imperceptible, because like existence etc., there is no mode in perceptible things, and because there is no self-awareness in itself. Therefore inherence is to be inferred here by the intellect.

original: atha samavāyasya lakṣaṇaparīkṣārthamayutasiddhānāmityādiprakaraṇam / ayutasiddhānāmeva ādhāryādhārabhūtānāmeva yaḥ sambandhaḥ / sa samavāya iti lakṣaṇaṃ vyākhyātameva / atha keṣāmayutasiddhānāmasau sambandhastadāha dravyaguṇakarmasāmānyaviśeṣāṇām / aniyamopadarśanārthaṃ kāryakāraṇabhūtānāntu paṭādīnām / na /akāryakāraṇabhūtānāñca sāmānyāditadvatāmiti / ayutasiddhānāmādhāryādhārabhūtāvasthāna /nāmiti cāyaṃ niyamaḥ / ihedamiti buddhiryato nimittād bhavati / sa samavāyākhyaḥ sambandhaḥ / tathā ca sūtram ihedamiti yataḥ kāryakāraṇayoḥ sa samavāyaḥ vai / sū / / / iti / iha ityadhikaraṇam / idamityādheyam / tayoḥ sambandhaṃ vinā ihedam buddhirna bhavatīti / yataścāsarvagatānāmiti niyamāśaṅkānirāsārtham / tathā hi sarvagatānāmapyākāśādīnāṃ svaguṇādibhiḥ samavāyopalabdheḥ asarvagatānām iti vākyaṃ niyamāśaṅkānirāsārthaṃ vyākhyeyam / tathā ca sarvagatānāmeva samavāya ityayaṃ niyamo na ghaṭate / yataścāsarvagatānāmapi samavāyo dṛśyata iti / caśabdasya cānuktasamuccayārthatvād asarvagatānāṃ sarvagatānāñceti labhyate / adhigatānyatvānāmiti / adhigatamanyatvaṃ nānātvaṃ yeṣāṃ te tathoktāḥ / teṣāmiti tādātmyavyudāsaḥ / tathāpyadhigatānyatvāII /gavāśvādayo bhavanti iti aviṣvagbhāvenāvasthitānāmiti padam / aviṣvagbhāvo 'pṛthagbhāvo deśāpṛthaktvam / na tvabhedaḥ / svarūpabhedasyopalabdheḥ / tathā hi tantavo vibhinnajātisambandhino vibhinnasvarūpāśca pṛthaktve paṭo 'pyevamiti parasparato 'nyatvameva / viruddhadharmādhyāsāt / pratibhāsabhedācceti / tathā ca rūpādayo 'pi viruddhadharmādhyāsācca bhidyante / sa ca tantupaṭādīnāmasti ityanyatvameva / sūtramapyevaṃ vyākhyeyam / kāryakāraṇayorekatvapṛthaktvābhāvād parasparaṃ pratibhāsabhedād ekatvapṛthakatve na vidyete / tasmādadhigatānyatvānāmaviṣvagbhāvenāvasthitānām ihedamiti buddhiryataḥ sambandhād bhavati / sa samavāyākhyaḥ sambandhaḥ / kathamityavyutpannapraśnaḥ / viparyastākṣepo vā / tathā ca na samavāyasadbhāve pramāṇamastīti /
analyzed: atha samavāyasya lakṣaṇa parīkṣā artham ayuta siddhānām ityādi prakaraṇam ayuta siddhānām eva ādhārya ādhāra bhūtānām eva yaḥ sambandhaḥ sa samavāyaḥ iti lakṣaṇam vyākhyātam eva atha keṣām ayuta siddhānām asau sambandhaḥ tat āha dravya guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣāṇām aniyama upadarśana artham kārya kāraṇa bhūtānām tu paṭa ādīnām na akārya kāraṇa bhūtānām ca sāmānya ādi tadvatām iti ayuta siddhānām ādhārya ādhāra bhūta avasth
translated: Now, for the purpose of examining the definition of inherence, the section begins with of only those that are not produced simultaneously. The relation of only those that are not produced simultaneously, which are the supported and the supporter, is inherence. This definition has been explained. Now, he says, this relation is of those that are not produced simultaneously, namely, substance, quality, action, universal and particular. For the sake of showing the absence of restriction, it is said to be of cause and effect such as cloth etc. No, it is of those that are not cause and effect, such as the universal and its possessor. This restriction is that the relation of inherence is the state of being the supported and the supporter of those that are not produced simultaneously. And this relation called inherence is the cause of the cognition this in that. And the aphorism is: That inherence of cause and effect, which is the basis of the cognition 'this in that'. Here means the substratum. This means the superstratum. Without the relation of those two, the cognition this in that does not occur. And because it is of those that are not all-pervading, this suspected restriction is refuted.

original: sarvametadasambaddham / athehabuddhiḥ pramāṇam / na tasyāḥ samavāyālambanatvamādhāraviṣayatvāt / taduktam 🔽iheti cānayā buddhyā samavāyo na gṛhyate /
analyzed: sarvam etat asambaddham atha iha buddhiḥ pramāṇam na tasyāḥ samavāya ālambana tvam ādhāra viṣaya tvāt tat uktam  iha iti ca anayā buddhyā samavāyaḥ na gṛhyate
translated: All this is irrelevant. If the cognition of 'here' is the means of knowledge, it cannot have inherence as its object, because it has the substratum as its object. This is stated:🔽And by this cognition of 'here', inherence is not grasped.

original: atha sambandhanimittā / sa tu tādātmyalakṣaṇa eva bhaviṣyati / samavāyapakṣe bādhakopapatteḥ / tathā hi na aniṣpannayoḥ samavāyo ghaṭate / sambadhyabhāve sambandhasyādarśanāt / atha niṣpannayoḥ sambandhaḥ samavāyaḥ / tarhi yutasiddhiḥ syāt / tathā samavāyasyāpi sambandhānabhyupagame sarvato 'nyatvāviśeṣād anayoḥ sambandhinoḥ sambandhaḥ / na padārthāntarāṇāmiti pratiniyame heturnāstīti / athavā gṛhītaṃ viśeṣaṇaṃ viśeṣyajñānotpattau / liṅgañca liṅgijñānotpattau vyāpriyate / samavāye tu tadrūpatā nāstīti tadgrahaṇe pramāṇābhāvaḥ / tathā hi iha tantuṣu paṭa iti jñānamādheyānuraktādhāraṃ viśeṣayan na samavāyānuraktamiti svātmagatasaṃvedanābhāvād iha buddhau apratyakṣa eva samavāyaḥ / nirvikalpake tu avayavāvayavinoḥ saṃśleṣajñāne samavāyaḥ pratyakṣa eva / kevalamiheti buddheḥ sambandhanimittatvenānyatropalabdherihāpi tadupalambhādanumānaṃ pravartate / yata evaṃ tasmādihabuddhyanumeyaḥ samavāyo na tvihabuddhau pratyakṣa ityupasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: atha sambandha nimittā sa tu tādātmya lakṣaṇaḥ eva bhaviṣyati samavāya pakṣe bādhaka upapatteḥ tathā hi na aniṣpannayoḥ samavāyaḥ ghaṭate sambadhya bhāve sambandhasya adarśanāt atha niṣpannayoḥ sambandhaḥ samavāyaḥ tarhi yuta siddhiḥ syāt tathā samavāyasya api sambandha anabhyupagame sarvatas nya tva aviśeṣāt anayoḥ sambandhinoḥ sambandhaḥ na padārtha antarāṇām iti pratiniyame hetuḥ na asti iti athavā gṛhītam viśeṣaṇam viśeṣya jñāna
translated: If, on the other hand, the relation is the cause of the cognition, it must be the relation of identity, because the theory of inherence is set aside by the following argument. Inherence cannot subsist between two things that are not accomplished, because a relation is never seen to subsist between non-entities. If, on the other hand, inherence is the relation between two accomplished things, then the two things must be simultaneous. Similarly, if inherence is not admitted to be a relation, then, as there is no difference between the two relata and all other things, there is no reason why inherence should subsist between these two and not between other things. Or, a perceived object is the cause of the cognition of a qualified object, and an inferential mark is the cause of the cognition of an inferred object. But inherence is not of the nature of either of these, so there is no means of knowing it. For instance, the cognition 'the cloth is in the yarns' qualifies the substratum as affected by what is to be added, but not as affected by inherence. As there is no self-awareness of what is in the self, inherence is not directly perceived in this cognition. In indeterminate cognition,
